Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but hard bed”
Reviews.Author: Bunny1956
Reviews.Content: Previous reviews are accurate. A lovely boutique hotel on a quiet street close to Termini railway station. Perfectly clean hotel with helpful staff. We had a budget room which was very small but quite adequate and everything worked properly. However, I would not recommend the hotel if you are used to a soft bed, as the mattress was very firm indeed and the pillows rather lumpy. This produced a poor sleeping experience for me.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Superb”
Reviews.Author: uri_fi
Reviews.Content: When coming to Rome I had to choose a hotel in the vicinity of Termini station for work purposes. I was offered a dew hotels by my agent but chose to go with my gut (and trip advisor) feeling and choose this hotel. This choice ended up exceeding all my expectations! I arrived at the hotel which is very conveniently located next to Termini station (hopping distance) and a nice 30 min. walk to Piaza Venezia. My room was not ready but I was checked in and my luggage left there. Upon my return I found a beautiful and huge room awaiting me. The bed could fit three people, there was a jacoozi in the bathroom, the drinks at the minibar were free of charge and there was free wifi in the room. I don't think you can expect anything better. The breakfast was good and fresh (lacking a bit on the variety side) and there was coffee and tea in the room. A gym was ready for use and was small but useful for my needs (especially since I was there on my own every time). The staff were very friendly and helpful and on the first day it was convenient that my suitcase was waiting for me in the room when I arrived. I warmly recommend this hotel to everyone traveling to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pamela R
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights and have nothing but great things to say about the hotel. It is so close to the buses, trains, and metro...so very easy to get around the city. The hotel is located on a nice side street with less noise so sleeping at night was not disturbed. Staff was very friendly and the breakfast was adequate. I would recommend staying here for your trio to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all expectations”
Reviews.Author: 138robertj
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for several nights and couldn't have been more pleased with this hotel. Good location on a quiet street near Termini and the subway. Staff was very helpful with directions, recommendations, and even handles currency exchange at a competitive rate. Room was very comfortable and the daily refreshing of soft drinks in the mini fridge was a nice touch. We would definitely recommend this hotel and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Moonboots11
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel staff are brilliant, helped us out with maps and recommended restaurants. A lot of reviews say that as the hotel is on a quiet street they felt threatened the area is a little rough, but we walked around the area for 3 nights the restaurants are excellent and we never felt threatened or intimitated, there are a few colourful characters but this just adds to the experience, Romes is absolutely bonkers. If you want to go to the Papal audience on Wednesday dont get ripped off by the travel companys which were charging 44 Euros, go to St Peters Basilica at the exit steps on the right hand side there are two swiss gaurds, if you speak to them they will give you free tickets which allows you to sit in the seated areas in St Peters square. At the start of the audience the Pope travels round the perimeter in his Pope mobile but doesnt go up the central avenue. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful staff, wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: sima1961
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Rome and had the most pleasant time in this hotel. The staff - all of them, but specially: Valentino, Marilli, Bryan and Criscan - were trying to make us feel comfortable and home-like. We travel a lot but never experience and met such a lovely people as this staff hotel. You won't regret staying in Dioclleziano because of that and also because of the tasty breakfast, the good location, the aesthetic design of the interior areas, the pleasant shower room, and in short -that magnificent place.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and met our expectations”
Reviews.Author: DDutch01
Reviews.Content: we stayed here one night after arriving from amsterdam on our way to Siena. the hotel was accross the street from Rome central train station and an easy 15 minute walk with a carry-on. the hotel met our expectations and was clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: indrajray
Reviews.Content: Boutique hotel in a nice location for tourism. Nice clean and comfortable room. Good breakfast. We really like this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel not far from the station”
Reviews.Author: c_and_a_Melbourne
Reviews.Content: Friendy, efficient, clean, tastefully decorated Italian decor and well priced for what you get. Little extras like a good selection of non alcoholic drinks in the Mini Bar and a big breakfast spread made it particularly good. Staff couldnt do enough to help. Booked us into a great restaurant and very helpful with busses, maps and general suggestions. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, great service”
Reviews.Author: Angelk8
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights. Concierge was excellent. Warm welcome (which was a nice change after our last hotel where sour faces were more common), and answered our questions even before we asked them. Room was small, typical of European hotels, even though it was for a family of 3 pax. While the hotel is very near Termini train station, we found it easier to approach the hotel from Via Volturno with our heavy luggage. Pavement slightly less pot-holed but beware the women pickpockets who will approach tourists trapped waiting at traffic lights. Good local restaurant nearby was La Famiglia on Via Gaeta. We also found a cheap but good Chinese restaurant called L'Orientale on Via Calatafimi. After 4 days at Sorento, we returned to stay an additional night before flying home. Pleasantly surprised that the breakfast staff still remembered us and what we preferred for breakfast. Nice!!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: AnnaChristchurch
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel Diocleziano twice over the past 2 years. Both times I spent time in Rome on the way to a conference in Florence. I love the handy location close to the Termini station but tucked away down a quiet street away from the Rome traffic noise. It is an easy 15-20 minute walk from the hotel to the Trevi fountain, Spanish Steps and the Forum/Colloseum and of the course the Metro is accessible within the main train station for more distant trips. The staff are very friendly and helpful. I have always arrived in the early morning and the room has never taken long to be ready. I have booked a Superior room both trips and have enjoyed the comfortable bed, the spa bath and the free minibar facilities. The room is warm in winter. There are tea and coffee making facilities in the room which I always appreciate. The hotel provides a comprehensive breakfast, particularly when compared to some hotels in Italy. There is free WiFi throughout the hotel which is a nice touch. There is a small gym and sauna and a nice bar with English and European newspapers to relax in at the end of the day. I felt quite safe as a solo female traveller. There are a lot of grotty hotels around Termini but this one is a gem and I will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid”
Reviews.Author: Maym91
Reviews.Content: Free Wi-Fi, Mini Bar & Breakfest Their rooms are very nice. They have a very helpful staff. Great location near the Train Station & Close to the Republica Plaza. The rooms which face the front of the hotel are nicer than the ones on the back & they have bigger bathrooms. The only bad thing is they have noisy pipes.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: 123s
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice 4 night stay at the hotel. The rooms are very clean and relatively spacious. The front desk attendants were very nice and helpful. The Location near termini was good, but I would stay in the historic city center if I returned to Italy - closer to restaurants and bars. Overall, a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Friendly Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Nicholas D
Reviews.Content: We chose the Diocleziano after reading Trip Advisor, and seeing that it was offered on Jet 2 Holidays. We are very glad we did. *Bear in mind we stayed at the beginning of March, so all our comments here may or may not be appropriate to other times of the year* It's situated close to Termini Station. Before booking, we were a little peturbed about the location based on other reviews of different hotels, as well as sites such as Wikitravel. It's true, there are some interesting characters knocking around Termini, and I should imagine that during high season it's a place to keep a close eye on your valuables, but we didn't feel at all threatened there, and the Diocleziano itself is situated on a very quiet (Roman standards!) street. We wandered around the area quite happily at night without any incident at all. Being so close to Termini means that it is ideally situated for travel around the city - it's literally 2 minutes to the Metro and Bus station. The metro station is currently undergoing quite a lot of renovation and upgrading, so double check you're on the right platform. The room we had was really, really good - spacious and equipped with quality items. The bed was firm and comfortable (so comfortable that I kept my wife up all night snoring - sorry dear!), the shower and bathroom were modern and spacious. The whole hotel was spotlessly - and I mean SPOTLESSLY - clean. We loved the free mini-bar in the room as well. There was no booze in it, but hey, after a hard days sight seeing you really want a nice coke or orange anyway rather than wine right? It was replinished every day. They forgot to do it on our last but one day, but as soon as we pointed it out they did it while we were out. The breakfast was absolutely fine. It was the same choice every day, but when there's so much on offer we were fine with it. Everything tasted nice and fresh. We loved the freshly squeezed orange juice and the made-to-order cappucinos and espressos. My wife noticed that the pictures on the hotel website don't do justice to the breakfast room - it was really nice. The staff were also fantastic. Polite and friendly and knowledgeable. It's nice at smaller hotels when there's fewer staff because it's easier to form a relationship and know who's who and who to speak to for what. The lady who served the breakfast coffees and juice was lovely - really chirpy and happy, was nice to see a happy face at the start of the day! Overall, we really loved the Diocleziano. Can't think of anything bad to say about the place. Oh, wait, the lift was a bit small. That says it all really - if the worst thing you can find to say about somewhere is that the elevator was a bit cramped, then you should definitely think about staying again sometime. And we will. :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, very clean, great location”
Reviews.Author: LivinginCH
Reviews.Content: Before booking this hotel, we read the reviews. We start with the best and the worst. What impressed us was the consistency of the comments, even with the average reviews. The staff were excellent - this is no exaggeration. The breakfast was great, the rooms perfectly clean, and the location great. Because it is so near the train station, yes the area can be a little less inviting. However, we have lived in NYC and DC and felt safe on the street, even at night. As in any big city, you have to be careful anyway. We booked at a good time so got great value for our euros. Having lived in Europe and traveled to several cities, this hotel is typical in size. So for Americans, keep in mind the rooms will be small but you are not in Rome to stay in the hotel, hopefully. The free WiFi, miniBar and breakfast add to the value. We agree that the staff is worthy of 5 Star service.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms but clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: 4rkidz
Reviews.Content: This was our home base when in Rome, location is great as near train station and walking distance to many of the great sites.. area felt safe too and fantastic staff who keep fridge stocked up and have good advice for tickets, places to see etc., Smallest elevator in the world though so be prepared to walk the stairs.. best breakfast in Rome - don't forget to ask for the Espresso..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in rome”
Reviews.Author: Lisa B
Reviews.Content: Great hotel near to the central rail station. Everything works, service is excellent, rooms spotless and large by European standards, breakfast had wide variety of choices, Free Wifi. I would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent place”
Reviews.Author: edcik
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel, friendly staff, emilio, also the groom who took our luggage to our room, the waitresses, etc... the bedroom was clean, the jacuzzi in the bathroom was great! good breakfast with hot stuff, fruits and so on! the hotel is not quite in the center but it's located near termini station, which is strategically speaking a good position when you come by train or plane as buses leave U there when you come to Rome. to make it short I recommend this hotel to the readers, oh and I forget the sauna and gym! good points too!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for your 1st visit to Rome”
Reviews.Author: Denroncollections
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very central, opposite the central station. Excellent rooms, clean, and very comfortable and FREE WiFi. Buffet breakfast was tremendous including full English breakfast and all included in the room price. Very friendly staff, went out of their way to help us. Highly recommended. We´d stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Baby Archie (son,nephew and grandson)”
Reviews.Author: DonnaHerlock
Reviews.Content: This being my first trip to Rome I found this Hotel,and its staff, exceptional. Particularly when my sister who was six months pregnant went into premature labour and gave birth to a baby boy, Archie, in the hotel. we cannot have wished for better treatment anywhere. The staff were absolutely amazing looking after us for the rest of our stay and even putting themselves out by asking every day how mum and baby were doing. i cannot recommend this hotel highly enough!

Reviews.Title: “no better place in Rome”
Reviews.Author: MichalK74
Reviews.Content: I decided for this hotel basing on previous opinion from web. The decision was good. The staff in the hotel was very helpfull and very friendly. Just on the booking hotel offered transfer from the airport just on the price of taxi. So leaving the airport we were welcomed by the driver who has taken us directly to the hotel driveing the local roads and avoiding the traffic jams. The hotel is located few minutes walking to the Termini station which allow easy access to the city (via bus or tube) or via train to whole Italy. Only minus of the hotel is lack of the restaurant but not so far away is very good restaurant named Babbo's and unfortunately poor breakfest. I am the breakfest fun and the breakfest in the hotel means a lot for me. In this case only staff can be recommended but the rest was just on 2 star level. Besides of above It is teh best place in Rome. THANKS FOR THE STAFF.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: RickyDerbyshire
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a fantastic break in Rome, during which we stayed at the Hotel Diocleziano on the basis of other trip adviser recommendations. We definitely made the right choice- this hotel is centrally located, yet in a quiet little enclave, is spotlessly clean, cosy and offers excellent value for money. Room facilities are more than adequate (wonderful shower!)and the hotel provides internet access as well as a gym containing state of the art equipment. Breakfast is available from very early until 10.30 am, offering flexibility to guests and comprises a large selection of meats, cheeses, cereals, pastries, fruit and cooked items all included in the standard room rate. The staff are professional, unobtrusive and, as we discovered, delighted to help with any requests such as airport transfer schedules, taxi and restaurant bookings- all done with a smile. We particularly appreciated several meals at restaurants recommended by the hotel as 'not touristy'- both ('Babbo's and the 'Lampada' , very close by, specialised in traditional italian food at a reasonable price- the Lamapda in particular was the only restaurant we found during our stay which charged the 'non tourist' price for a bottle of wine- five euros as opposed to eighteen and the food was excellent. In summary we would definitely stay at the Hotel Diocleziano again and would strongly recommend it to anyone wanting a reasonably priced, comfortable hotel in a central area but without a main road running outside!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: SueCleethorpes
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it is very close to Termini station making it very easy to get around Rome. The hotel was great, the rooms were clean and comfortable and there was plenty of choice at breakfast. The staff were very friendly and helpful as it was our first visit the man on reception gave us a map, advised us where to go and what to see and to buy a Roma pass. The pass gave us 3 days travel on the trains, buses and underground and also discounted or free entry in some of the main attraction, well worth the money. Whilst there we took his advise and went to see Colosseum, Vatican, Pantheon, St Pauls, Trevi Fountain, Spanish steps, Piazza Navona, Roman Forum, Zoo etc. Plenty to see and do just make sure you get to main attractions early in the morning to avoid the massive queues and take some comfortable shoes there's a lot of walking.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: jdwksu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while in Rome. It is fairly close to Termini station. Located on a quiet street. Staff was very helpful, breakfast was good and included in price. We were able to walk everywhere from the hotel, except to the Vatican, that was a bit far.

Reviews.Title: “Ticks all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: zackary71
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights recently and were very satisfied overall. The service is the highlight as all staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfasts were of a good standard and the free soft drinks in the fridge was a nice touch. There's 3 PC's near reception available to guests too so no need to bring a laptop. The gym looks perfectly adequate and there's a very good restaurant just around the corner called Babbo's. The bedroom wasn't the biggest but was warm, comfortable and all the amenities you'd expect form a 4* Hotel. Tea and coffee plus LCD TV with English speaking channels added to th homel feel. Quick tip to find Hotel from Termini train station-do a left past Benetton shop and walk 300m, over crossroad traffic lights then 1st left where you see vertical "HOTEL" sign overhead, past Faemma hotel and then Hotel is on the right.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: rach6101
Reviews.Content: Walking distance from the train station made this a really convenient place to stay. The hotel itself is very nice and staff friendly. A pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good place”
Reviews.Author: tat2loser
Reviews.Content: A very centrally located hotel, only a few blocks from Termini, very convenient for the metro and getting around by train. It's a smaller hotel but I found it to be perfect for my needs. It was very clean the staff was very polite and helpful. They provide some snacks and beverages which was nice after a day of sightseeing. The rooms are smallish but very clean and comfortable and the bathrooms are good sized. The breakfast that was offerrred was way overpriced and there are plenty of options in the area. The front desk offers currency exchange with no fee and a decent rate. Overall I thought this hotel was a great value with a great staff and excellent location. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: dianadepp
Reviews.Content: Hotel Diocleziano is a very nice hotel. The room we had was on the first floor, just off from the main check-in desk. It was small, but comfortable and very clean. Oddly enough, the bathroom appeared larger than the room! There was also a cute little deck with a bistro set. Some small complaints: The shower is tiny! And if you move the shower head so that it faces the area where you enter/exit, you will flood the bathroom, as the water goes through the curtain and the drainage system is slow. Hopefully it's something they will fix before the next guests stay. Another complaint is there is some noise, not sure what it is, every morning. It's almost like some ice machine above or something. So if you're a light sleeper, or don't like noise, this may be something to consider. Ask to stay in another room. Some people have written that you can go on the roof of the hotel and get a great view of the city. This is true, ONLY if you are a guest in the top floor room. That's the only access to the roof. So unless the guest staying in that room is you, or really friendly and let's you in, you won't be able to access the roof. Just felt I should make this clear. Another thing to mention is that they only serve breakfast. No lunch, dinner or food available at any other time. Luckily there are several eating places nearby. I can't say anything about the breakfast buffet as we did not eat breakfast here. I also can't comment on the gym or sauna b/c I didn't even check it out, but I know they have one. Perks: They leave you coffee, tea and other beverages daily. This was great. Especially after some long days of touring. It was nice to come back and have something easily available to drink. It's so close to Roma Termini. A stone's throw away really. This was incredibly convenient!! It's also close to several eating places. They exchange money for you at the front desk. And the rate is fair. Comparable to most other places. I had a hard time giving this hotel an overall rating. It's definitely better than a 3, but not quite a 4. I've stayed in some of the best rated hotels in the world, so a 5 is something I don't easily give. I'd say 3.5 is about right. It doesn't have a lot of the perks that a larger hotel/resort does, but if you're looking for a very nice, comfortable, clean and conveniently located place to stay while you spend most of your days seeing what this great city has to offer, then this place will suit you just fine.

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: alabam25
Reviews.Content: friendly and very accomodating staff, excellent breakfast before a long day sightseeing, very comfortable rooms, clean, tidy, spacious and a good sized bed would reccomend evryone and anyone to try this hotel if you are ever staying in roma, I would like to thank all the staff for making my stay in rome a very enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel for the Area”
Reviews.Author: Zen&Co
Reviews.Content: You can't beat this hotel for location from the Termini Station just a 5 min walk out the front accross the bus station and main road. So the journey from Fiumicino is very easy by train just jump on the Leonardo Express and you are there approx 30 mins later (€14 per head each way). The hotel is in a quiet road opposite the bus station but like any area with a large train and bus station it has its odd characters and with major building/excavation works opposite the station could be considered not the best part of town. The hotel/bedroom was spotless and well furnished, good size bedroom ours looked out over the front of the hotel and had shutters if we wanted to use them. Bed was large and comfy and bathroom modern and very clean. Breakfast provides a good variety of some hot and all the usual cold things (cereal, fruit, cheese, meats etc.). You can order freshly squeezed orange juice for free - recommended! Staff are very friendly and helpful and we got great service at their bar with late night drinks, the porter was also very keen to help with the cases and wasn't looking for money just to be helpful. I've also just received an email at home from the hotel hoping we had an enjoyable holiday and stay - nice touch. Great hotel, good travel location, just a pity the local area wasn't a bit nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Made travel so much easier”
Reviews.Author: MollyMary516
Reviews.Content: The close proximity to Termini is great for those traveling by train and if you plan to use the Metro. The neighborhood is close to the Baths of Diocletion, but it is a bit of a walk to the coliseum, pantheon, piazza navona, etc. we used the metro from termini and had no problem getting around. The hotel staff was amazing! They were nice and accommodating. When we needed to miss the included breakfast for an early flight - they made us breakfast bags. The room was perfect for our needs, clean with a nice bathroom. Free Internet is definitely a perk for American travelers.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Quality/Value Accommodation In Rome”
Reviews.Author: PietroMorrizio
Reviews.Content: I was returning to Rome in late November after five years, and last time I stayed in a budget hotel that had it's quirks. So I decided to splurge a little more this time, and after looking at all the options, I liked the location and perceived quality of the Hotel Diocleziano. And I was not disappointed - I would not even bother looking for another hotel in Rome, as HD suited all my needs. I like the idea of being close to Roma Termini (train station), and this hotel couldn't get much closer, with it being located virtually across the road. The rooms were excellent, proof that you get what you pay for in Europe. The room I had was massive, with a large anteroom and bathroom. I slept well there, and only woke to my alarm. The wi-fi was steady and did not disconnect at any time during my stay. I am returning to Rome in February and have booked again at HD. The hotel is right next door to the side walls of the villa that forms part of Diocletian's Baths, and was handy when I had an hour or so to kill before taking the train to Fiumicino Airport (the hotel even gave me a late check-out). I could get to the centre of old Rome (forum) very quickly by train, and reasonably quickly by foot, as it was a walk down the Via Cavour. The breakfast is a buffet, and while I usually don't like buffets, this one was ok, and I got a decent breakfast. The staff were very helpful, and although they hadn't readied my room when I arrived at about 1pm, I went and got some lunch and came back, and my luggage was in the room waiting for me. I would recommend any traveller looking for good accommodation in the 3-4 star bracket to look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: 186334Chris
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights & found all the staff very friendly, helpful & interested in what we asked. They seemed proud of their wonderful city. We had the only room on the 5th floor - warm, clean & spacious. Breakfast was good, with a good selection of hot & cold food. Good location - all the main sites within walking distance with the main train & bus terminal - where all the tour buses started from - about eight minutes walk. The Metro was here as well. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in Rome to stay”
Reviews.Author: FBendall
Reviews.Content: this hotel is central, great staff, excellent value for money. The staff were really helpful, especially Brian the doorman! We would definitely come back and stay here again,

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: islandgirl59j
Reviews.Content: We booked our room last minute (day prior) through TripAdvisor's special offer link. Upon arrival the front desk told us 'happy new year, we've upgraded you from a standard room to superior'. Nice surprise! Room was very nice, though small (as they all tend to be in Rome). Super quiet room, many other rooms we stayed in throughout Italy the walls were thin and we could hear our neighbors conversations. We had a king bed (two twins pushed together...standard in Italy), complimentary mini fridge with drinks replenished daily, large jacuzzi bathtub, free wifi, and breakfast. Bed was quite firm as were pillows, but this was a third hotel in Italy on this trip and they all seem to be same. Our room and hotel were very clean, and the hotel appears to be newly renovated. Front desk staff were extremely helpful, as were bell hops and breakfast staff. There was a sauna and fitness facility on site, which we didn't get to use, but looked quite nice. Location of Hotel Diocleziano is ideal! Only 1 block from main train station, Roma Termini, as well as access to metro stations and buses, making it very easy to get around the city to all the sights. Breakfast was good, not the best I had while in Italy, but nonetheless good. We would definitely recommend this hotel to others. I have to note, we ate nearby, maybe 6 blocks or so, at La Gallina Bianca (The White Chicken) which came highly recommended by our Vatican tour guide...Simon with Happy Travel Tours...our only guided tour on our entire trip - and most excellent. The White Chicken was very good and where locals go to eat - not a tourist trap. We also stayed in Florence at Hotel Berchielli and in Siena at Palazzo Ravizza on this trip. Both really excellent hotels, see reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Station”
Reviews.Author: klr
Reviews.Content: We travelled up from south on the train and wanted to be able to walk from the Termini to our hotel.The location was great and the metro and buses allowed us to get to the attratctions easily. The staff were very helpful in recomending good reasonablt priced restaurants to eat in.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: nomz33
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one block from the metro and bus station making it a great location to stay. There are some restaurants and shops around the hotel and its a quick metro ride to all of the major tourist attractions. The staff is very nice and helpful. They told us the best place to get gelato, how to get around the city and top things to do. They spoke English very well. The rooms we had were very nice and clean with heated floors in the bathroom and a heated towel rack. The breakfast was really good as well. I rated the sleep quality as average as the beds were not very soft, but I think this is common across all of Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in close proximity to Termini Station”
Reviews.Author: KittyJoyNewcastle
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel as it had good TA reviews and was very close to Termini Station. As we were arriving in Rome at around 7pm, I knew that both myself and my husband would be very hungry; in our relationship, hunger is the main cause of arguements, so I wanted a hotel that was quick and easy to find, so that our special trip got off to a good start! The hotel met this first requirement with ease; it is about 2 minutes walk from the train station and with the help of the map on the hotel website, was found very quickly. It is conveniently located for most things and we were able to walk to most places, although less active people might find it a bit far away from some of the sights. However, being so close to Termini, public transport is on your doorstep if you'd rather do it that way. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful; the room was very clean; bed was nice and comfy (quite firm mattress which is our preference); good shower and complimentary soft drinks in the mini bar were very welcome and well used! There is nothing I would really criticise about this hotel. The only reasons why I haven't awarded 5 stars are 1.The breakfasts - these were fine; I have had better, but also had much worse, and 2. The room - this was perfectly adequate but not amazing (although I wasn't expecting this for the price!) Good value for money hotel which I would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Diocleziano is a must”
Reviews.Author: Carlos M
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just 200 metres away from the train central station (Stazione Termini), where you can take a train to the airport and to various towns and countries; very close to the station there is an underground station and several buses lines nearby. The hotel staff is very kind and helpful and at the same time very professional. The breakfast is fantastic; there’s plenty of choice and the quality of the food is very high. There is Wi-Fi Internet in the entire hotel; it is free and speedy. Computers are also available to the guests in a room close to the hall. For those who need or want to exercise there is a well equipped gym on the ground floor. In the fridge water, soft drinks and juices are free and replaced every day. This and a few more other details make all the difference: Diocleziano is not pretentious; it’s a must – very chic indeed.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in Central Rome”
Reviews.Author: Alex_Hove
Reviews.Content: We had an enjoyable stay at the Diocleziano. The rooms were lovely - nicely decorated and comfortable, with a free mini bar stocked with soft drinks and mineral waters (very useful). Breakfast was excellent, with a good selection of hot and cold food. The location was very central and made for a useful base, given its proximity to the train station and bus stops. Most sites were in walking distance. The reason I've given 3 stars (rather than 4) is because we were let down by the fact that we didn't have any hot water in our shower/bathroom for almost our entire stay. Despite complaining about this several times, there didn't seem to be any effort to resolve the problem (we were simply told they were having problems with boiler) and we were offered no apology or compensation. Furthermore, whilst the location was indeed central, it wasn't a particularly nice area. For example, there were at least 2 homeless men sleeping rough in the same road as the hotel and the area to the side of the Termini station was even worse (a whole camp of people sleeping rough on mattresses and in tents). Not a huge problem as I didn't feel unsafe, but there are certainly nicer areas of Rome. In summary, the Diocleziano is a lovely hotel with excellent breakfast and spotlessly clean rooms. I'm sure that our stay would have been excellent had there not been an issue with the hot water.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful surprise!”
Reviews.Author: pattib16
Reviews.Content: Staff was welcoming, hotel was very clean, room was very comfortable. Breakfast was great! Hotel located only two blocks from Roma Termini station. I read the reviews and decided to book here, and I am so pleased that I did. I will return!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Central”
Reviews.Author: RichTiss
Reviews.Content: We followed the reviews of others and were not disappointed. Lovely hotel, very central and quiet at the same time. The staff were very helpful. we would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peter M
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice boutiqe hotel, centrally located near the main train and bus terminals, with easy access to the Metro. Staff were very cordial and helpful and the breakfast was excellent. Rooms were very clean and well equipped with a nice bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly and quiet haven”
Reviews.Author: Observer2908
Reviews.Content: We too found friendly, helpful staff; a quiet, clean and comfortable bedroom with a nice firm bed and good en suite. Breakfast dishes were varied and plentiful and could be as healthy - or not - as we wished. Breakfast staff were even more friendly and smiley! Touches such as the free minibar, restocked daily, plus free internet were a useful bonus, much appreciated. Our one tiny criticism is that the elegant nameplate is so small that we failed to see it so then spent 15 minutes trailing around with heavy cases trying to find the hotel! We also came at it from the left hand (west) side of the piazza in front of Termini station - this is an over populated obstacle course that includes the bus station. Far better to approach from the right (east) side when the hotel is more or less just straight over and up. A taxi should be 5€. [If using the train from the airport follow the blue line, same level throughout].

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: LJH_64
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel with a recommendation from a friend and were not disappointed. The hotel is so clean and very conveniently located to Termini which made it very easy to get around the city. The biggest plus to this hotel is the outstanding service we received from the staff. Emilio at the front desk was so accommodating and helpful when reservations for 2 tours were cancelled and he immediately helped us rebook them, along with recommending good restaurants and local products to purchase. He helped make our stay in Rome wonderful. I would definitely return to this hotel the next time we stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: sailor908
Reviews.Content: This hotel was conveniently located a short walk away from Roma Termini station. From there, we were able to walk to major attractions such as the Colosseum, the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, etc. The staff were all warm and friendly, and eager to please. This is a typical European hotel, in an older building with up-to-date fixtures in the rooms and bathrooms. Our room was a decent size, with a king bed (actually adjoining twins), desk and small closet. There was a small fridge with complimentary bottled water and soft drinks, an electric kettle with instant coffee, tea and hot chocolate, and a safe for valuables. The 4 pc. bathroom (toilet, bidet, sink and shower) was also comfortably sized, but here was our only complaint: the hot water just wasn't very hot. We mentioned it to the front desk every morning, and every afternoon, we got a message that the problem had been fixed, only to have another lukewarm (at best) shower the next morning. (Note: we did have hot water when we got up before 6AM to catch a train on our last morning, so perhaps the hot water heater doesn't keep up as more guests arise through the morning.) With that caveat, we would still recommend this hotel for the unbeatable location, great staff, immaculately clean rooms and public spaces, and good breakfast (ask for fresh squeezed OJ!).

Reviews.Title: “Not exactly what we thought it would be”
Reviews.Author: haldane42
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located walking distance from the train station- the staff were very helpful- the rooms were clean the breakfast great- the room wasn't pretty! Thought it would have more character!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and Incredible Staff”
Reviews.Author: Chocaholic1001
Reviews.Content: This was out first trip to Rome, so we wanted a central hotel that was in easy access to everything. We we delighted that not only was the hotel easy access to the train station, but it was also lovely! The rooms are big enough, and the free water and soft drinks in the mini bar each day was a really nice surprise. It was also nice to have coffee and tea in the room without having to go out. Breakfast was great and the staff could not have been more pleasant! It is perhaps not the best/most picturesque part of town, but the hotel was was quiet and immaculately maintained. I would definitely recommend it to anyone who wants to visit Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jamdoree1
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and decently sized. They also stock free water and soft drinks in the mini fridge every morning. The breakfast buffet was awesome and the service was excellent. The best part about the hotel is the location. It is located about 5 minutes (walking distance) from the central train station (Termini) and you can also reach most of the major sites within 15 - 20 minutes of walking. I will definitely go back to this hotel when I visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service is exceptional”
Reviews.Author: travelmaven52
Reviews.Content: We were not able to go to Rome and stay in this hotel, but we had made our reservation and I was so impressed by the customer service that I had to write a review. I was contacted immediately after the reservation was made with information about transportation and extra services available. Then, when we cancelled, I received a very nice confirmation and note. Was impressed by how easy it was to work with this hotel and how nice the personal touch and note were. Have to agree with the reviews that I read about the service - even great when you have to cancel - can't say that about many hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: FranWConcordMA
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just about perfect. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were comfortable and immaculate, and had a lot of nice small touches (like free water and soft drinks in the mini-bar, an electric kettle in the room with a selection of teas and some snacks, and ample and well-placed outlets so you didn't have to crawl on the floor or unplug the lights to charge your phone) that are thoughtful and not necessarily typical of Italian hotels (particularly in this price range). The breakfast was excellent and (another thoughtful touch) began to be served by 6:45am, which is great if you are making an early flight. The rooms were extremely reasonably priced for Rome. We booked on the hotel's website directly and paid about 280 Euro for two nights - in Rome, it is easy to pay close to that for one night! The only weakness of the hotel, in my view, is also one of its strengths, and that is its proximity to the train station. The hotel is on a quiet side street so unlike other hotels in this area noise is not a problem, but as a general rule the area right near the train station is not the nicest part of any Italian city and Rome is no exception. The location IS convenient though, since the train station,Termini Metro stop and the city's major bus station are all very nearby. So the hotel is a convenient base for touring the city, and for getting to and from the airport. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone going to Rome who wants to stay in this part of town rather than the more charming but much less convenient historic center.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to Roma Termini”
Reviews.Author: MauroSantos
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, short walk to Roma Termini and metro station. This 4 star is really a very good 3 star. Confortable room and bathroom, good breakfast (but I missed the fruit salad), free wifi. If you need to stay close the train station, that's a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Truly worthwhile”
Reviews.Author: NYPhysician
Reviews.Content: Diocleziano... I can definitely recommend this hotel to anybody who can afford the price. This place is definitely worth the price you pay for the stay. First of all, the location is superb. It is located about 7-10 minutes by walk from Roma Termini (the train station of Rome) and another major Metro station (Republica) which you could take to reach important sites of interest such as the Colosseum and the Vatican. I have observed that when a hotel is located in such close proximity to a train station or on a main street, there is often a lot of noise and your night's sleep could be compromised for the convenience of the location. However, this hotel is located in a secluded side street which offers enough quietness at night despite being so close to a major street. Safety is not at all an issue. Staff was very friendly and helpful. They provide information and help with transfer to the airport. I arrived from Florence by train and I could easily walk to the hotel from the train station with my travel bags as they had wheels. Rome was my last destination and I flew back from Rome. To get to the airport, I used the affordable taxi arranged by the hotel staff. If you don't have big bags to carry along, you could also take the air-train connection from Roma Termini station. The hotel provides complimentary internet, spa and gym although I never had the opportunity to use these facilities as I was busy enjoying Rome itself. The room was very cosy with a spacious bath/toilet. The only shortcoming that I noticed was that hot water was not hot enough after 11 pm. I wanted to use the bath-tub before I went to sleep, but noticed that the water was just warm enough to wash hands or brush. Another huge plus is the breakfast that they provide. I had stayed in 2 other hotels (Venice and Florence) prior to my visit to Rome. The other hotels provided great breakfast too, but comparatively this was the best. This is very important because the major purpose of my visit was touring and sight-seeing. Having a good breakfast gave me enough time till early in the evening to concentrate the bulk of my sight-seeing in the daytime when attractions are open (many sights close 1-2 hours earlier in the winter months). I did not have to worry about where or when I would have my next meal. All I needed to do was to grab a quick bite during the day and have a good dinner earlier in the evening. For a single person, this hotel could be on the pricier side, but if you travel as a family or couple, then I can seriously recommend this hotel as you would be saving on time spent looking for a cab or public transport as well the money spent on them. Walk to the subway (Line A) or train station (Lines A and B) within a distance of 7-10 minutes from here. Piazza Republicca is about 5 minutes from here and you could walk there in the evening to enjoy its dazzling brilliance! If I visit Rome again, I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly reliable to be a good experience”
Reviews.Author: CaptJack6933
Reviews.Content: The staff went out of its way to make us feel welcome and to assist us with all kinds of issues, like recommending sites and restaurants, making cab reservations, and spending a lot time helping us receive a package from overseas. The breakfast buffet offers variety. The rooms are clean and ours was roomy by European standards. The internet wi-fi is very strong and reliable.

Reviews.Title: “Rome Overnight”
Reviews.Author: JRinLexington
Reviews.Content: Hotel Diocleziano was a chance taken because my usual hotel was booked. A convenient location a short walk from Termini Station. The hotel borders on the elegant. The room was spacious with a comfortable bed and outstanding bathroom. There was also a small private courtyard with table and chairs that was a bonus. The refrigerator had several types of drinks that were included in the price of the room The breakfast was very good with a number of options. The wait staff were excellent. Two negatives - the PC proivded for guest use had a virus that shut dowm access to my e-mail; boarding passes for my return flight to London had to be e-mailed to the front desk for printing - a minor problem but I had to wait for the e-mail to "arrive" before the staff could print it out. The virus problem seemed to be related to a lack of adequate virus protection - not sure what program they use but it didn't work. That said, the staff at the front desk went out of their way to help. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeds expectations”
Reviews.Author: bigcat57
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel on the strength of previous reviews. We were not disappointed. Excellent location, very quiet but convenient for all attractions. Reasonably sized rooms, spotlessly clean, more than adequate breakfast and the staff are outstanding - nothing is too much trouble. Very good value for money, especially in such an expensive city. The only 'strange odours' we encountered were bacon cooking and furniture polish and these enhanced our stay rather than detracting from it!

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel, near train station”
Reviews.Author: KangaTex
Reviews.Content: We started our trip in Rome here. The room was tiny for 2 twin beds, but was clean. As noted elsewhere the beds are very firm and the pillows are hard. The breakfast was full English type breakfast, with hot eggs and sausage. The staff was very helpful and they accommodated my request to store a bag while we made a side trip out of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: mariannaen mark v
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights in this hotel, this hotel is very clean, quiet rooms. All the people who’s working in this hotel are very nice and friendly. ( Molto simpatico) And when we going back to Rome , we shall book your hotel again. in 10 minutes you walk to the ancient city, For us it's was a great weekend. Thanks for Emilio, Alvin, Valentino and the lady's from the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Arrivederci Aroma”
Reviews.Author: hgoldman77
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a variety of unpleasant odors, worst among them, the towels which smell foul. The first floor has its own scent, and then the corridors and breakfast room each have their own, too. The hotel's location, some 1,000 meters from the train station, further if you intend to take a train to the airport, means one must drag one's luggage through crowded sidewalks and busy roundabouts, dodging vehicles and people. So where's the advantage in that? Better to take a cab from a neighborhood that has some charm and amenities. The staff upon our arrival couldn't have been nicer or more helpful. The desk manager literally left his post to guide my car through one-way streets to the hotel's front door. Upon our departure, however, another desk manager (Saturday a.m. Oct. 28) charged us 6 Euro saying we owed room tax. Later I saw on my pre-paid receipt that I had already paid for the room "and all taxes and service charges." Our room, about $350, was small, also a bit smelly, with a view of neighboring walls and roofs, and an electric transformer within a wall emitted an annoying buzz that the hotel engineer took care of after we couldn't take it any more. Do yourself a favor...

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for Our Last Few Days in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Ruth27
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 weeks in Europe, starting and ending our trip in Rome. Hotel Diocleziano was our last hotel before flying home. I chose it because of its high ratings on Trip Advisor, and I wanted a US style hotel for our last few nights so we returned well-rested. Pros: Impeccable service. Clean, quiet rooms. A lovely shower. Free beverages. Lovely breakfast with real coffee, capacchinos, etc. We had a very nice stay there. Not my favorite part of Rome. I prefer to be closer to the ancient city, but still an easy enough walk to things. And the neighborhood is certainly safe, if very touristy. It was about a ten euro taxi ride to get to the places we didn't want to walk to. It was easy to walk to the train station, less than 5 minutes. We used the train to go to the airport at the end of our trip. I'd probably get a car service to take us to the airport next time, though. It would only be a few more euros than the train and much more convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Standard Hotel within Easy Reach of the Main Events”
Reviews.Author: richierich6573
Reviews.Content: A great choice (helped by Trip Advisor!) over many options. Don't let the immediate surrounding streets put you off - they look a little rough around the edges but is very safe at night. The hotel itself is a wonderful standard and spotlessly clean! Free mini bar which is really very handy when you've been pounding the streets. Breakfast was wonderful and fresh with a wide choice. Staff very efficient and will perform all concierge services for you in a timely manner. The nice quiet side street makes sure you have a great nights sleep. Very handy for tourist activities etc. The only thing I would say is that high quality restaurants are around 15 mins walk away as there are none that really stand out nearby. But exploring and discovery is part of the fun! Extremely good value given the price of Rome hotels and the standards first class. Free internet is very handy when planning your activities in the beautiful city of Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff, lovely rooms, handy location.”
Reviews.Author: Tonyc187
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a five night stay on our first trip to Rome. Two of us travelling alone, having managed to leave the kids with their grandparents. We had booked on the strength of Trip Advisor reviews and booked through the hotel website, getting about €400 of a saving for web booking direct. We only noticed the negative comments about the hotel location just before we left so we were a little nervous. Starting with the location, we got a train direct from the airport to Termini station and then had less than a 5 minute walk from the station doors to the hotel (just make sure you walk out the correct door). Some people have commented that the area is very dangerous etc. All I'll say is that it's a city centre location and is exactly the same as any other city in the world with the usual odd types hanging around drinking etc, not too many of them either. I work in a city centre and once you walk around with your eyes open watching out for yourselves you'll do fine. The hotel itself is fantastic. I have never seen a city centre hotel this clean and well maintained. The rooms are clean and will be made up whatever time of day suits you. There is a free soft drink mini bar in the rooms, free wi-fi and decent tv. Could be a few more English tv channels but overall not bad at all. Also, there is a new gym opened with 3 cardio machines and a half dozen free weights. Not going to do for a hard weights session but will let you stretch out. I was going to drop a point for a buzzing noise from the circuit board in the room but once the key was out of the slot the electrics went quiet. inconvenient but not too bad. Finally the staff. Before travelling I sent a couple of emails to staff looking for help with booking restaurants and stuff. They really couldn't do enough to help at every stage of our visit. I could go on all day about them, assisting with booking tickets, restaurants and making a genuine effort to make sure our visit went as well as possible. Breakfast every morning was pleasant with fresh fruit, cereals, pastrys, tea, coffee and juices. Overall I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel and would definately stay again if returning to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel at Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Nomad413
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located about a block north of Termini Station and is an easy walk with luggage. Due to the spread out nature of most of the attractions in Rome, this is a perfect home- base due to the convenience of having buses as well as the subway station so nearby. Upon arrival, we were checked into our hotel room, which was fairly small and crammed with beds. I was traveling with my two sisters so the room, a standard triple, was litterally two twin beds with a folding bed in a row with just enough room at the end of the beds for a little desk. It was tight! The only way out of bed was to scoot to the end, there was no room between the beds to get out, and of course no nightstand in which to place a clock or water or even my glasses. By far, the smallest room we had on our trip, and among the smallest I have stayed in while traveling in Europe. The bathroom was spacious and the room was clean. We didn't come to Rome to stay in a hotel room so overall the small size was laughable, especially when we were trying to get up and having to scoot down the bed. Breakfast was the best we had while in Italy, plenty of fresh tasty pastry, yoghurt, coffee, fruit and the breakfast staff was extremely friendly. The morning we left my sister went to go get an apple and she was handed an "on the go" prepacked breakfast which was very thoughtful. The hotel booked a car service to the airport since we were departing from Rome and the cost was 45 Euro for all three, which was very reasonable. Due to the close proximity to the train station there is a population of homeless people with obvious mental illness, one of which came up to the car window as we were leaving and babblling. One of my sisters did not like having to go past them on the dark street to the hotel, but the area was populated enough where I never felt we were in jeopardy. Overall the staff was extremely pleasant and the price was excellent and I would recommend without hesitation. Room was also very clean. One last thing, not related to the hotel, beware of taxi drivers trying to rip you off. One driver cleared the meter then asked for almost double the fare. When questioned he claimed it was his English...which was pretty good. I asked the hotel for a number to report him, but even with his license number it was obvious the officials could not be bothered. Tip: Baths next door are being restored and while they will be a remarkable attraction one day and may be good if you have a little time to kill, they are not really worth your valuable time in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Clean comfortable hotel. Super nice staff.”
Reviews.Author: Libby M
Reviews.Content: Close to Termini Station but otherwise a bit removed from many attractions. Overall this didn't bother us as we needed the exercise after 2 weeks in Italy. Clean, comfortable, and QUIET hotel room facing front. All of the staff, and I mean all, were super nice - from the front desk staff, to the bellman, and the breakfast room ladies. Items in minibar are complementary. My spouse asked bellman to have regular Coke replaced with Diet Coke which was done without question daily.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff and Fantastic Facilities”
Reviews.Author: JoeandMary1
Reviews.Content: The staff at this Hotel are absolutely exceptional! They were all very helpful and kind to us during our stay in Rome. Nothing seemd like it was too much trouble. The location is excellent - very close to Roma Termini from where various tours depart including the hop on hop off buses. An easy and safe walk to Trevi fountain and surrounding restuarants. Excellent Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: Jenniferd12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived at this hotel on Monday October, 17 for the start of our honeymoon and from the moment we arrived we felt right at home! There is always someone to greet you at the door with a friendly smile. We are staying in a standard room and it is a very nice size with a king size bed and perfect size bathroom for two people to get ready. The breakfast is very nice and there is plenty to chose from, although you don't want to fill since you will want to eat all day :) the beds are a little on the firm side but still very nice. Whatever you need the staff will never say no...they are very helpful! For a tip on restaurants near the hotel go to resturante famigla ...it is so great and always packed with locals which is a good sign! Also we are about a 15 min walk from almost everything yet it is on a quite side street...just perfect!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Rome Trip”
Reviews.Author: picmic91
Reviews.Content: In Rome for 5 days (Sept 25-30), for honeymoon. It was a good hotel, good location, very good breakfasts included in price, and helpful staff. Not a lot of good places to eat dinner close by, really just one, recommended by hotel staff. Had to venture further out of area to find some more restaurants. Still, we would recommend the hotel, it's very close to Termini.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: BEN-ZEEV
Reviews.Content: the hotel is close to evry atraction in the old sity of rome. the room was very clean and the free internen and free ninibar were a life savers. we will be back at this hotel for sure/

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - bad location”
Reviews.Author: Barbara F
Reviews.Content: After our walk from the train station, we were quite surprised with this hotel. We walked through a terrible part of town to get to this hotel and while we were walking, I was afraid of what kind of hotel we would be staying at. We were extremely and pleasantly surprised when we reached the hotel. It was beautiful and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The room was very nice, the breakfast was good,and the staff very good. However, because of it's location and the neighborhood, we will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: 4travelmore
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a reasonable walk from the train station and the metro, yet is not in a sleazy area as some train station hotels are. The hotel is small and friendly. Very good breakfast each morning. Comfortable beds. Free internet with 3 good laptops in a small area off the tiny lounge. On our last day we returned to the hotel to pick up our luggage before heading to the airport and the staff offered us coffee as we were resting from a busy day sightseeing. We asked the staff to make recommendations for reasonably-priced local restaurants and were not disappointed. Be sure to eat at La Lampada for wonderful pasta, a tasty antipasta bar and cheap (but great) local wine. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Sandgatetraveller
Reviews.Content: We looked at a number of highly rated hotels on Tripadviser and settled on Hotel Diocleziano because of its location and were extremely happy with our choice as the Hotel was every bit as good as the reviews said. We stayed 3 nights and have no trouble in recommending this Hotel to all. We booked the top floor suite because of the outside terrace and found this to be worth the extra euro as the view of Rome rooftops was serene especially at sunset even though the AirCon plant was a little noisy and smelly. Breakfast was included and served in a delightful dining room setting. The service provided by staff was excellent and food of a very high standard. The Managers and staff were extremely helpful. We travelled to other areas in Italy and returned some weeks later to catch our flight home and needed a place to stay on the day of our departure. As we had been previous guests of the Hotel, the Management of the Hotel were kind enough to allow us to leave our bags at the hotel until our flight left later that night. They even organised our transfer to the airport. Thank you to all staff, we really appreciated your assistance. I would also recommend the Ristorante De Famiglia which is located approx. 100 metres up Via Gaeta, gud restaurant with budget prices and great food. All in all, a wonderful stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service and a respite from crazy Rome”
Reviews.Author: bckpckrau
Reviews.Content: We had two stays at Diocleziano over two weeks and both were brilliant. Customer service is flawless. All of the staff remember you and often your room number. Every request from printing our boarding passes to enabling use of a shower before we left for the airport were met with a 'yes' and a smile. The breakfast staff were extremely cheery adding to the feel of the wonderful bright atrium eatery. And the food was varied and ample. The gym was adequate for weight work but a little warm and of course, the location is perfect for metro and bus access at Termini which is not as grotty or sleazy as some would have you believe. There is in fact good eating and shopping on offer there making Termini a great base. But importantly, Via Gaeta is a silent side street so coupled with carpeted halls and rooms it's a recipe for good sleep. But, our first stay was in room 107 and the plumbing from other rooms ran down inside the wall behind the bed heads noisily and often.  Then at 9pm our neighbours in the hotel next door would start making noise that travelled through. Not great. Our second stay in room 103 was notably better. The room had a massive outdoor patio and was flooded with natural light. The room was completely silent at night and so we had terrific sleeps. I guess it's pot luck roomwise. The only other issues I would note are uncomfortable lumpy pillows filled with chunks of foam and some strange log out issues with the wifi from time to time. When working though, the wifi was strong in each room. Otherwise, this is a great hotel in every respect and a perfect choice for escaping the filth and craziness of the Roman streets at the end of each day!! Watch for special offers too because it's not cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: IndySafari
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights during first week of Oct. Pros: 1) Location- 3 min walk to Termini Station & main bus stand making it easy to take public transportation anywhere in Rome. 2) Location - on quiet side street. 3) Service - everyone was exceedingly helpful and friendly. Front desk personnel helped us with restaurant reservations, calling cabs, providing advice on best transportation, etc. 4) Room - We chose the deluxe room on the 5th floor which was great. It had a large private balcony which we used extensively. 5) Internet included in our price. 6) BF included; quality was standard; the BF room was nice & bright. 7) Has exercise rm which we didn't use. Cons: 1) The lift goes only to 4th fl. 2) An ac unit near the balcony of the 5th fl rm kicks in often. Must add that neither con bothered us enough. Will take same rm if we stay here again. This is FYI only.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Paula440
Reviews.Content: Had a difficult first day in Rome. Had pocket picked, lost guide on tour at Vatican, so Anna sent a bottle of bubbly to our room. Room rather small but very clean & convenient to most of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Khalid”
Reviews.Author: Khalid A
Reviews.Content: Great experience, location closes to Rome termini, staff are so friendly and food is excellent! personally would like to have the same experience once again in the near future

Reviews.Title: “"Home away from home - a little gem - we will be back"”
Reviews.Author: pacificholiday
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 6 nights at the Hotel Diocleziano in September and our stay was excellent on all accounts. We would like to give some context to our comments. Diocleziano is a small boutique hotel in a major city. If I stay in a similar CBD hotel in my home town of Melbourne the tarrif would be similar if not more (unlike Diocleziano where breakfast, mini bar, internet, gym are included this is not always the case in all city hotels). Lets face reality, central CBD hotels cost, no matter where you are. Having stayed in European Hotels we found the room size to be quite spacious compared to other European Hotels. I know rooms are bigger in the USA, Asia and Australia. Again, the bathroom in our room was fantastic and again spacious for a European hotel. Our room and bathroom was spotlessly clean. It was made up beautifully each day. However, most importantly the service & welcome we received at Diocleziano was wonderful. All staff were friendly, welcoming and no request was too much. When we checked in our room was not ready (we knew this would be the case). We were shown to a sitting area to rest and organise ourselves. Shown the restrooms incase we wanted to use same. The concierge tagged and stored our luggage in a locked storage area. It was explained that our room would be ready by 2:00pm. The staff provided us with suggestions on sights to see nearby, provided us directions and a map. We set off to explore. We went to a nearby museum not returning to hotel until 3:00pm (time escaped us). When we returned there had been a change of shift & Valentino greeted us at the front desk. He made sure we had been shown everything, answered any questions and provided us with our internet access codes. He arranged for us to be shown to our room, where our luggage was waiting for us. We were very impressed on first sight of the room. If Diocleziano advertises a room with its description, it is accurate. The bed was described as a large double (in Australian terms this is a King Size bed) upon checking in our bed was a King Size and it was very comfortable. In contrast at our London hotel they advertised as having a King Size bed, but we found the bed in our London room was infact just a double. At Diocleziano we were shown how to work everything in the room. The room came with airconditioning which was wonderful and a room safe. We rested and freshened up. Valentino suggested places to dine and made restaurant bookings for us. Everyday of our stay was wonderful. Always greeted in a warm & welcoming manner by all at the hotel. The breakfast staff, the front desk staff, the housekeeping staff, porters etc. Everyone was always helpful. My husband wanted to have a haircut & shave and the staff found a suitable barber for him. He also wanted news where to see Australian Football (as it was our finals series at home) again, the staff investigated and located a Bar where this could be seen. The staff could recommend were to get the best gelato and provided directions on how to get places. We wanted to check in on line for our flights to London. When checking in we requested that the email be sent to the hotels reception desk - but there was a problem with the airline's system so no emails were being sent out. Valentino said, you have tried enough this way, now you come and use my computer. So we checked in online again using the reception computer where we could print the boarding passes directly. Staff provided warnings about personal safety. Lets face it no city any where in the world is 100% safe. I never felt unsafe anywhere we went. Staff would ask what are you doing today, and would give tips on personal safety if they felt there was anything we needed to be concerned about. The hotel is well located to the Termini (for trains, buses etc.) and we were able to walk to many of the sites. We do like to walk, but public transport travel was so readily available if we wanted to use it. The hotel arranged for private transfers for us from the curise terminal in Civitavecchia to the hotel and from the hotel to the airport. These were of a high standard. We decided to take a day trip to Florence. We were booking online our train tickets but having difficulty understanding some of the website. Valentino was busy but asked Anna from the office to come and help us. After all the help they provided, we then realised the cost of train tickets would be more than taking a tour but Anna and Valentino were not bothered, they recommended a tour and booked it for us. As I said all of the staff were friendly, professional, welcoming and helpful. One day we were out seeing the sights and we heard, "hello mame, hello sir" when we looked towards the voice it was one of the staff from Diocleziano on his afternoon off, walking past - he took the time to stop and say hello and wish us a good day seeing the sights of Rome. Each morning at breakfast we were greeted warmly and enthusiastically by the breakfast service staff. they were always chirpee and helpful. We sent items to the Laundry. One item i ticked to be dry cleaned, but the Laundry sent word it could not be drycleaned. Immediately the front desk staff came and found us in the breakfast room and explained this and asked if we wanted to launder the item in the regular way. He then adjusted the cost in our presence. Staff are very aware of who is a guest at the hotel or not. If there is a staff shift change new staff enquire discreetly as to whether you are a guest. Another aspect of making sure we safe. There are so many more examples I could give of the wonderful service and helpfulness of the staff at Hotel Diocleziano. We did not feel like we were in a hotel, but that we had made a home away from home. We will be visiting Rome again in 2 years time when we will travel with our children. Without hesitation we will return to Hotel Diocleziano. The dollars spent are worth it, it is a hotel when one considers the inclusions, it provides in my opinion good value for money. The following are the items which are included in the tarrif at Diocleziano and these should be remembered when thinking of the room cost, that is, what you pay is not just for the room, your room charge is inclusive of: 1. The tariff includes breakfast and what a fantastic breakfast it is. Breakfast buffet at Hotel Diocleziano is a traditional Italian Breakfast buffet. Pastries (to die for), cold meats, cheezes, breads, cereals, yoghurts, fruit (both preserved and fresh), tea, coffee (including cappaccino, cafe late, expresso etc), juices - the breakfast staff will squeeze you a fresh orange juice), a selection of hot foods - eggs, bacon, mushrooms etc). The breakfast at our London Hotel consisted of Toast and boxed cereals, no name brand tea & coffee. 2. Free Internet. There was a free internet station with 3 computers. When you book in you are provided with a password & user name for 'free' use of the internet for the period of your stay. If you need to print something, simply send an email to the hotels info email address and the staff will print for you (free). After our stay in Rome we had time in London. The hotel we stayed at charged 5 pounds for 3 hours use of the internet. If you clocked on at 9:00am your 3 hours was up at 12 midday, even if you only used 1 hour of it. The London hotel would not print for you free of charge. 3. Free Mini Bar. The mini bar has bottled water and soft drinks which are replenished daily. It was wonderful to return to your room at the end of a day knowing there was a cold drink waiting for you. We didnt even have a fridge at our London hotel, so couldnt even chill bottled water if we wanted to. 4. Small fitness centre and sauna - whilst we did not make use of this it looked great. People we saw using were happy with it. 5. In room coffee/tea station with biscuits etc. 6. Airconditioning, room safe, lift. (not all European hotels have a lift or airconditioning) We recommend the hotel Diocleziano to all. Thank you Hotel Diocleziano for making our stay in Rome a truly memorable one. Lisa & Barry Thomas (Melbourne, Australia)

Reviews.Title: “good choice”
Reviews.Author: navypop
Reviews.Content: location was great, staff very friendly, breakfast filled us up; a bit on the expensive side, and not quite 4 stars in my opinion, but the pluses certainly outweighed the small minuses - small room, no room service, things like that; overall would recommend, but not the best value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “We Will Return!!”
Reviews.Author: loulou3110
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel. Service from ALL staff was first class - we were always acknowledged with a smile and a Good Morning/Afternoon/Evening and felt extremely welcomed and valued. The bedrooms and public areas were spotlessly clean. Breakfast was excellent, with convenient times too - with lots of lovely coffee, hot food, cheeses, toast, eggs, cereal, juices and fruit. A great way to start your day before exploring the fabulous city of Rome. The good sized bedrooms were very well furnished with modern fittings (beds comfy!!) and large bathrooms - nice tea & coffee making facilities were in the room too (unusual for Italy!!) The mini bar in the room also had complimentary soft drinks, replenished daily - what a fabulous touch!! The hotel also had free Internet with 3 PCs and a small sauna/gym (we did not make use of this, but had a look and were impressed). The hotel is in a quiet street, beside other hotels, 5 minutes walk from the main Termini Railway/Bus/Metro station, so is very well placed for getting around the city. We mostly walked to see most of the sights and got the Metro/Bus back - very easy and convenient to use. You are best to buy a "RomaPass" travel ticket for public transport. (To get to The Vatican/St Peters from the hotel, you will need to get the Metro or Bus) Lots of nice restaurants/pizzerias in the area - try the Ristorante/Pizzeria "Da Dino" in Via dei Mille - excellent value, no frills, just authentic Italian food and good service. Overall, we would stay again at this hotel and have no hesitation in recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, handy location - A true gem of Rome”
Reviews.Author: gemski88
Reviews.Content: All we were looking for was a central, no frills and convenient hotel- a good ground base to discover the wonders of Rome. However, leaving the hotel, it certainly felt that we had made home away from home. Fantastic service from all the staff of the hotel. The hotel was located conveniently across from the train station, with all of Rome right at your fingertips. A long walk to main tourist attractions but well worth it as you can discover many hidden beauties of food, fashion, architecture and hospitality. The staff were overly accommodating for some specific requests, the rooms were cleaned daily and housekeeping even folded our clothing and placed it on the end of our freshly made beds. It was the little touches like these, along with the complimentary mini bar and the 'more than happy to' attitude from the staff at all hours of the day/night. We felt safe and secure and were undisturbed from any street noise. Breakfast was adequate, great variety and yummy pastries. This hotel was definitely a great contribution to our amazing experience of Roma. Returned to Rome at a later part of our trip and stayed elsewhere (Hotel Diocleziano was booked out) and it just wasn't the same. Definitely recommend to travellers of all ages, particularly families with older children. Will definitely stay at Hotel Diocleziano again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Great Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ken R
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within 3 blocks of the Termini Station and right next to the Baths of Dioclesian, Basilica of Our Lady of the Angels and the National Museum, the latter two of which are an integral part of the original baths. Connection to both Metro subway and buses is most convenient. The hotel was completely remodeled 5 years ago. All rooms are first class. Morning full breakfast, internet access, complimentary mini bar and exercise equipment are all included in the room rate. The hotel is located on a quiet street even though the surrounding area is very busy. The staff is courteous, pleasant and helpful. We would not hesitate to stay at the Hotel Diocleziano again. Ken R. Palm Desert, CA

Reviews.Title: “Best service in Italy”
Reviews.Author: Priscilla S
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I stayed at the Diocleziano for 5 nights on a recent "tour" of Italy. This was our first oversees experience and did not start off well but Tomasso and the other front desk guys at the Doicleziano made everything so much easier. We had booked a "shared" transfer from the airport to the hotel. There were 15-17 other people in this van. The driver went hotel to hotel dropping off guests. We were the next to last to be dropped off. When we got out to retrieve our luggage I noticed that my husband's suitcase was missing. The driver insisted we did not load it in the van while we were the airport.
