We knew we had and that he had mistakenly left the suitcase on the sidewalk at another hotel while unloading someone else's luggage. The driver, who spoke very little english, went inside the Diocleziano and spoke to Tomasso who was on duty at the time. After an overnight flight, we were all exhausted and upset about the situation. Long story short, Tomasso and the concierge, (I'm so sorry I can't remember his name), made several calls and two hours later our luggage showed up !! The entire staff at the Diocleziano went out of their way every day to make our first stay in Rome wonderful. Everything from their restaurant suggestions to their daily freshly stocked mini frig was great. The last morning of our stay there, we decided to sleep in for a bit. My daughter and I missed breakfast so I went down to the bar area and asked for a cup of cappucinno. I was going to take them both back up but the bar tender said he would bring them up for me. A few minutes later, he showed up with a beautiful tray of pastries, toasts and nutella, and our cappucinno ! What great service. It was also the only hotel in Rome that offered a coffee/tea maker in the room. Very close to the train station, but very quiet location. I would definitely recommend the Diocleziano to anyone travelling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very well located”
Reviews.Author: euro1013
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights a few days back. Had a great stay. Very well located hotel. Rooms are clean and good size. Would definitely recommend. Great buffet breakfast. Most tourist attractions are walking distance. Bus and Train Termini is a 5 min walk. We took a private taxi back to the airport. Mercedes Benz with a great chauffeur, only Euros 45. The concierge will be able to make a reservation. Very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Amenities Galore”
Reviews.Author: Donkeysaurus
Reviews.Content: This hotel had everything you would normally expect from a 4-star hotel: clean rooms, friendly staff, decent breakfast and good location. However, the important factors are the extras that they feature. First, the minibar is complimentary with soda and water and restocked daily. If you're travelling in warm months, that's going to save you $10 per day on drinks you would buy. Also, they had a gym and a sauna. And finally, upon checkout, we received a complimentary pair of glasses with Spumante at the bar. Combine the bonuses with the short distance from the train station and this one has great bang for your buck.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Tony C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night after our cruise ended, planning to leave the next morning for the airport and home to the USA. The staff at this hotel is outstanding. Very friendly. The room was very clean and included complementary drinks (non-alcoholic) in the minibar in the room, and a nice breakfast in the morning. The hotel is tucked away in a quiet side street just a few minutes walk from the train station and central bus station. The desk clerk arranged a limo to take us back to the airport for only a couple more euro's than the horrible, and expensive Leonardo Express train service to the airport. If we go back to Rome, we will stay at this hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: lillesten
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before returning to the airport. Close to Termini and the sights of Rome. We wanted to stay for one more night as we came in to Rome one day early. Diocleziano was fully booked, but they were very helpful and provided us with accommodation at one of their partner hotels nearby. The best breakfast we had on our trip in and around Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jayou98
Reviews.Content: what a great place to stay! nice clean room, friendly people, nice breakfast and locattion is just great, only few mins from central train staion.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and ideal location”
Reviews.Author: europhile05
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel after reading reviews. It suited our purpose exactly. It is a few minutes from the Termini rail/underground and bus station. It is also the only point on the system where the two metro lines meet. The hotel is tucked away in a quiet side street and there is no noise disturbance whatsoever. The free mini bar (soft drinks/water) filled up every day was an added bonus after a day sightseeing. We will cetainly use this hotel again when we revisit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean honeymoon spot with airconditioning and wi-fi”
Reviews.Author: Annie B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here last week during our honeymoon for all seven nights. The rooms and bathrooms are especially large for a European hotel room. Free mini bar that is refilled everyday (with water, coke, fanta, juice...no alchohol, but still a very nice touch! ;-) Our rooms was always nicely made up with fresh sheets and towels when requestedand the staff even folded some shirts we left out for us. There is also a free breakfast buffet which was a great money saver (eggs, bacon, yogurt,granola, fresh fruit, croissants, coffee cake, espresso, cappucino, American coffee, and fresh squeezed juice served by a friendly staff) . Directly across from the main "Termini"- metro and train station so is very convinient for metro travel in Rome and for day trips by train. A little bit away from main tourist attractions (20-30 min walk) but this is nice as the hotels on main streets can be very loud all day&night. Also, they have a car service from the airport to the hotel for 100 Euros round trip (its about 40 each way for a taxi...and this is a locked in rate&garaunteed ride, which was totally worth it for us). If you stay here, check out Cotto restaraunt...it was the best meal we had in Rome& is right around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jsr28
Reviews.Content: Made very welcome by reception staff especially as we travelled with a wheelchair for my daughter which we left next to reception throughout our stay. Room was spacious, new and had all amenities including large tv, free mini bar and wifi. Well worth a visit

Reviews.Title: “Good service and location”
Reviews.Author: Small_BuG_123
Reviews.Content: 1. ..The room is good 2. The bathroom is good 3. The services is good 4. The location is good which very near to the Termini station (approx 5 mins walk) 5. with free high speed internet 6. Car parking at nearby garage (appox 150meters) only cost me EUR 38 for 3 days 2 nights 7.Surrounding with a lot of shop 8. Very quite at night 9. Breakfast is good 10. Helpful frontdesk We spent 2 nights in Rome, and this hotel is lovely and located very near to the termini station, everything is good for us,

Reviews.Title: “perfect homebase”
Reviews.Author: Paul B
Reviews.Content: My wife and daughter spent two weeks at the Hotel Diocleziano for my daughter's first trip overseas. She's 15 and my wife wasn't used to traveling without me either, so there was a little nervousness. Thanks to picking the right "home base", everything went perfectly. We couldn't have asked for better care from the staff. Polite, professional, and above all helpful, the holiday went off without a hitch. Two major considerations for choosing this hotel were it's location in regards to walking distance to the places they wanted to see, and it's location in regards to noise level from the street. They had no problems at all walking to the furthest points in their plans: Piazza Del Popolo to the north, St Peter's/Vatican to the west, and Circus Maximus to the south. They didn't have to take a cab, bus or metro once, as everything was within walking distance. And plenty close to shopping and restaurants but tucked away half a block from major streets makes all the difference; it was extremely quiet and a great place to relax in the evenings. The price was very reasonable for being in City Center, and for anyone wanting to use buses or metro it's only a block away from the terminal. From airport pick-up and drop-off, to information about the city and where to shop and eat, to addressing all requests immediately, this hotel and it's superb staff get top marks. An outstanding continental breakfast was included and worked perfectly into daily plans. I'd absolutely recommend this to any friends or family planning a trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: To_Far_From_Paradise
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Diocleziano for 4 nights based on great reviews. We were not disappointed. We subsequently stayed in 4-star hotels in Florence, Venice and Sorrento. This was by far the best value for the money. The staff were very pleasant and helpful especially Valentino and Tomasso?? at the front desk. We got several dinner suggestions from them and all were close by, not expensive and very authentic away from the tourist traps. The rooms at the hotel are not large but are very nicely decorated, very clean and many have a great view over the Dioclesian Baths. The hotel is close to the train station - easily walkable with rolling luggage which makes it a great place to catch the metro to see the sights. We would definitely go bake again. Very highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Thoroughly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Suzibk
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with very welcoming and helpful staff. Our family room was spacious and clean. Free wifi in the room was much appreciated by my teenage children. Complimentary soft drinks were a nice touch. Breakfast was fantastic. The hotel is in a quiet side street yet only a 2 minute walk from the Termini where you can get a train/bus/metro or you can walk to the Trevi Fountain/Spanish Steps

Reviews.Title: “It's just a perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Wolfy223
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just the perfect place to stay for everyone who is seeking for a great service, beautiful and clean rooms, pretty decent breakfast, and wants to make his trip to Rome memorable. There's nothing bad I can say about the hotel. It's just a perfect place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ticks all the boxes.”
Reviews.Author: PPAinsworth
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here toward the end of August 2011. This was our third hotel stay in Rome, the previous two were Capo D'Africa and the Hotel Forum, both very good hotels. We chose this hotel for a few reasons: Firstly, breakfast....., not a great priority amongst Romans, but for someone brought up in Scotland and the North of England, something of a priority. On this count, The Diocleziano comes out tops. Bacon,sausage, beans, scrambled egg, toast and any type of coffee you require, will set you up for the hike around the monuments. Secondly, we wanted to concentrate on the museums and sites around Termini, plus a trip out to Ostia, so being close to the station was helpful, but think twice about using the train from Fiumicino to this hotel, it is a stiff trek from the Fiumicino train platform and in 100f temps and the gauntlet of shady characters (at Termini), you would be better advised to arrange a shuttle bus from the airport (56 euros for 2 ,both ways,as of 2011). Incidentally, a single taxi fare is still around the 45 euro mark (fixed rate). The hotel staff could not be more helpful, we were booked in a standard room with Expedia, but on arrival asked what upgrades were on offer. We were shown room 103, which had a large terrace with brolly,table and chairs. The room also had a 2 seater whirlpool bath/shower (fun), a safe, fridge (with free water and pop), and daily replenished coffee/tea maker. This room was described as superior with terrace and was an additional 100 euros for four nights. There was no view to speak of, but still worth the extra, as far as I as concerned. There is a VIP room on the top floor which has a fine view of the cloisters at the back of the Diocletian Baths/Museo Nazionale Romano. Within 100 mtrs on Via Marsala, is La Famiglia restaurant, not bad and quite reasonably priced. There are other decent places nearby and there is a handy asian run shop (on Via Marsala) selling chilled wine and beer,plus bizarrely, cameras and TVs , but we did return to Angelino al Fiori, at the bottom of Via Cavour, directly across the road from the entrance to the Forum, it is still very good. I could not fault this hotel, if it were situated near the Hotel Forum, it would probably be No.1 on TA, having said that, it would be twice the price and booked solid, so there has to be a trade off between location and popularity.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, rooms relatively small”
Reviews.Author: bauwens
Reviews.Content: We spent a night in Rome before flying back next morning, having arrived by train. Decided to stay in the city, since we arrived relatively early, and we wanted to have a decent dinner. So, looking for a hotel close to Termini, Diocleziano did the job. We spent a good night, hotel was fine, good service. Rooms not very big. Breakfast OK but not outistanding This said, we have stayed in nicer hotels elsewhere. This hotel is fine, and I understand that hotels in Rome are not cheap. But Diocleziano is not particularly cheap either.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with great service from the front desk team”
Reviews.Author: glees99
Reviews.Content: Hotel Diocleziano is a great hotel located in a quiet street and very close to Termini station From the hotel it is easy to get around Rome on foot, bus or Metro. Valentino and the front desk team did all they could to make our stay wonderful with helpful suggestions for restaurants, easy booking of tours and other general help. The rooms in the hotel are a good size, wifi to all rooms, included breakfast great and generally a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and recommend it”
Reviews.Author: familywithpet
Reviews.Content: Our whole experience with Hotel Diocleziano was great. Even prior to arrival, they arranged for us to be picked up at the airport and sent information (upon request) about tours which were available for us to take. During our stay, the entire staff was attentive, friendly and helpful. I cannot emphasize this enough. They were always willing to help with anything we needed or asked about. The breakfast had something for everyone's taste from meats, cheeses and breads to cereal, fresh fruit and yogurt. The free mini bar was a life and budget saver with water, juice, coffee and tea. I loved having the safe in the room as I did not have to worry about leaving valuables in the room or carrying them with me. The mattresses were more firm than I like; however, after walking most of the day everyday, we did not have a problem sleeping. The room was very clean and the staff seem to try to clean and re-stock the minibar when you are out during the day instead of disturbing you. We did have a minor problem in our bathroom one day, but it was taken care of immediately. The location is very close to the termini; trains, metro and bus stops. However, it is on a quiet side street where there is not a lot of noise. It is within easy walking distance to many restaurants, shopping areas, a grocery store and a laundromat. If you like to walk, most tourist attractions are within walking distance. If you prefer to ride, the buses do stop nearby. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant surprise ...”
Reviews.Author: Oliviu
Reviews.Content: Good location, excellent facilities and very helpful and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay, quiet and great location near termini station.”
Reviews.Author: Katex4
Reviews.Content: Our stay was great. The breakfast was lovely, and rooms new, very clean. Felt like they really cared that you enjoyed your stay. We had our children in a room across from us, value to us was fine. Nice and quiet after a day of sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Very high quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan S
Reviews.Content: Excellent service in a great location - handy for Termini Station but in a very quiet backwater. I really appreciated being allowed to freshen up using the shower facilities that accompany the gym after a long day of sight-seeing, even though I was due to hop on a train that night after sleeping at the hotel the night before.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient, in so many ways”
Reviews.Author: Rich_Bron
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our Europen Adventure, and very very pleased with it. Friendly staff, clean rooms, close to train station, good breakfast, close to all public transport, free Wifi. Nothing wrong with this place actually, very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alison H
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at this hotel. The room was large enough to be comfortable as a resting place after sightseeing, with great air con, complimentary soft drinks and wi fi. It was immaculately clean, with excellent bathroom facilities. The location is perfect, very close to the train station, Via Nazionale, and an easy walk to all the sights. We can't compliment the staff enough, they speak great English, a without exception were friendly and so obliging. The breakfast was delicious and plentiful, and the cappuccino made freshly, the best we had at any accommodation on our stay in Italy. Would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location wise, and staff couldn't be more helpful.”
Reviews.Author: Bertina78
Reviews.Content: We knew that the hotel was close to the train station (which is why we picked it) but didn't realise HOW close -you can practically SEE it from one of the exits. Very convenient for getting about -being so close to the main station means it was easy to get from the airport (when you're in a hot, foreign country) and easy to get to the tourist attractions when you're going about your day. For what it is, I think it's expensive -but I accept that you're paying for the location and the convenience. If you think of Rome as being like London, then you need to accept that you're going to be paying a bit extra. That's just Rome. Staff are VERY friendly and helpful and spoke perfect English. Room was tidy and clean, invaluable airconditioning, (bed was very hard though!), breakfast was ok.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: phillipsfamily5
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a quiet street within easy walking distance of Termini station. The rooms are clean comfortable and well sound proofed. The bed was very comfortable with a firm mattress. The hotel provides soft drinks and water in the fridge, which are restocked every day. This was a real plus point. The air conditioning in the room was very efficient which we were very glad of. The breakfasts were excellent - with nice touches like homemade cake and freshly made coffee. All the staff were friendly and very helpful, with advice on where to eat and how to get to sites of interest. There is also free access to 3 computers in the lobby and free wifi in guest rooms - which worked well. We didn't use the Gym, but it looked new and state of the art. We do not usually write reviews but we felt that the hotel deserved it.

Reviews.Title: “Charming room, well located”
Reviews.Author: AKJCalgary
Reviews.Content: Located only 5 minutes walk away from the main Terminus train station (trains to Florence and other main cities) this compact hotel is on a very quiet side street, almost next door to the very interesting site of Diocletian's baths, which if not one of Rome's most famous tourist attraction, is still well worth a visit. Our room was very charming:the bathroom was small but well appointed and the bedroom was very clean, nicely furnished and had patio doors onto a lovely tiled terrace, complete with a few plants, table, chairs and an umbrella for shade. It was very restful after a day's sightseeing to sit on the terrace, with a cold drink and snack from the room, enjoying the dusk hour, The staff recommended good local restaurants for dinner - better ones than we found by ourselves! Tours can be booked at reception and will pick up guests at the hotel. Computers with internet access are available on the ground floor. Breakfast was simple but fresh and tasty. I would happily stay again at this very pleasant, good value hotel. This hotel, like many Italian hotels has the "waffle weave" towels rather than fluffy terry towels. Give them a try - they dry well and you might like them

Reviews.Title: “Hidden, quiet gem”
Reviews.Author: noemiSummerHill
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a hidden gem, the staff and service were excellent and friendly, always ready with helpful advice no matter what time of day or night. Being able to walk to your hotel from Roma Termini is a bonus and the view from our room was beautiful over the Dioclesian Baths, quiet and restful. The free WIFI a bonus, the free bar fridge wonderful and our air-conditioning worked very well. The bathroom was sparkling clean with all the products necessary for travelling. We found a great ristorante due their advice and a lunch place for take-away just up the road as were laundries and small supermarkets where you could buy everything you needed. They stored a large cricket kit for us while we drove round Toscana. There was nothing we asked for that wasn't answered with a smile. We will definitely stay again... and again.

Reviews.Title: “Thin walls, but a very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmilli
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel a week ago and it was quite nice. The staff was very friendly and helpful, they even provided us with a map and sightseeing suggestions. We stayed in the "superior room" and it was very nice, the rooms were large for a central hotel. The bathroom was also nice and large. Some things to be warned about the walls seem to be very thin. I also think that we were in a bad area of the hotel with our room. We were on the first floor of the hotel over looking the air-conditioning unit, which was quite noisy when you are trying to sleep. Also there must have been a bathroom from another room right beside us because you could hear everything! It was not just the people using the water or flushing the toilet, you could even hear them putting on lotion!! This made it very hard to sleep. The beds are also ROCK hard, which was ok for me, but I know it may not be for everyone. They did have complimentary soda and water in the fridge for you which is refilled daily. A very nice touch! The "Superior" room was an upgrade we choose to do because we thought it would be on a higher up floor and would there for give us a better view. Clearly I was wrong about that. When we first went into the bathroom it looked like the bathtub was dirty but it appeared to just be run down, there were marks all over it. This really did not help make you want to take a bath. So I would say the upgrade was a waste of money. The breakfast was ok. Nothing special. As it is a small hotel there was not much selection. Typical Italy the bread/buns are hard but the coffee is great! The staff in the breakfast room were nice, but I did not find things replenished quickly. The staff at the front desk were also very nice. They arranged a car service for us to take us to the airport for 45 Euros. The Taxi was there early and got us there in plenty of time. The hotel is located near the train station. This is the reason that we booked this hotel as we took the train in from the port in Civitavecchia (a VERY bad idea with your luggage). When we arrived at the train station (which is huge) we went out the only exit we could find. This left us with a very long walk to the hotel. We have done this many times in other cities and not had a problem, but I think with all your luggage this was just too far to walk. The area may be a bit sketchy at night but during the day it was fine. We did not return to this area, we instead took the streets north of the hotel and it was fine at night. The hotel is central and is easy to walk to everything. We waked from the hotel to Piazza Navona without a problem. It is also fairly close to a metro station. I would recommend this hotel because the rooms were nice and the staff was friendly. But I am not sure if I would rather stay there again or try something new. I would not do the upgrade to the "Superior" room, I do not think it was worth it. Also if you are on your honeymoon this hotel does not do anything extra for you. But get out and enjoy Rome!!! I have been many times and it is a city like no other! :)

Reviews.Title: “Clean and cosy boutique hotel with extremely friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: HannaKH
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in Hotel Diocleziano during our trip to Tuscany and Rome. We selected the hotel based on TA ratings and price, and because breakfast was included. The hotel was very clean and nicely decorated. Extra points to the friendly staff who gave us good restaurant tips and were very helpful in every possible way. On our departure day we checked out and left our luggage to the hotel for the day, since we had a late flight back home. The staff let us use the gym's shower after a hot day in the city, and gave us towels to use -> excellent service. :) And last but not the least: the air conditioning in the room was excellent: not too noisy or blowing too hard, but just perfect. (Temperature in Rome in that time was about 38 Celcius.)

Reviews.Title: “Quiet beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ken_Jan411
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only a few blocks away from the Coliseum and within walking distance of may other attractions. Just 2 blocks from the train station. Excellent restaurants are very close by as well. The staff are exceptional and more than willing to assist!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel helpful”
Reviews.Author: CuthbertK
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped through the door, Hotel Diocleziano's staff couldn't have done enough for us. Query about train times to Florence - timetable printed out within the hour. More milk for our room tea tray - there within 5 minutes. Help at 2am trying to re-book a flight as the ash cloud threatened our return - Theo on the front desk helped me for over an hour as I pulled out my hair. We were offered a room upgrade when we got there ( took it - v large balcony) Free wi-fi in room; mini-bar re-stocked with juice, water, beer FOR FREE every day. Room spotless, breakfast extensive, hotel near main station. A great choice, well worth its good TripAdvisor reviews

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: lavog
Reviews.Content: My wife and I began a 12-day trip to Italy to celebrate our 20th anniversary and decided to stay at Hotel Diocleziano based on TripAdvisor reviews. This boutique hotel lived up to its billing. It's a short walking distance from Termini, but on a lovely, safe street. The rooms are not large, but are very comfortable and clean. The air conditioning worked perfectly in a very hot spell. The beds are wonderfully firm and the bathrooms are sparkling. They supply some free beverages in the room's refrigerator each day. Breakfast is served in a friendly room that allows guests to either remain private or join in conversation with fellow travelers. Valentino at the front desk deserves special commendation for his willingness to "be there" for his guests and help with recommendations and reservations for sites and restaurants. One caveat: although the hotel recommended Babbo's as an excellent local restaurant, we were very disappointed (poor service, small portions, overpriced) and would suggest heading up to Via Flavia to La Pentolaccia or even further to Ai Fienaroli or one of many restaurants a bit further from the hotel. Let me add that although we benefited from a fairly low rate because we made our reservations early, we were still given a very nice room with a good view, just as we asked for. Thanks to Hotel Diocleziano!!!

Reviews.Title: “The good and the bad.”
Reviews.Author: hardrock95
Reviews.Content: The Good: When we arrived the front desk was inviting and courteous. The room that we received was clean and modern and provided the amenities expected from a 4 star hotel, even had a bidet. No need for shampoo, conditioner, body wash, q-tips, or hair dryer it was provided. Additionally, you are provided with a refrigerator with a complementary Coke, Fanta, water, and a juice box daily which was great. FREE WIFI INTERNET. The shower was great with excellent water pressure. The morning buffet was good and had a decent selection of meats, cheeses, eggs, cereals, fruits, and juices. Additionally, if you ask the attendant for an espresso or cappuccino it is free of charge. The hotel also has a sauna and a gym, although we did not use these amenities. It is also really close ~ 2 blocks to the Roma Termini Station, no cab needed, walking distance. The Bad: The air conditioner took a really long time to cool the room. The room required the key card to activate the electricity so I'm not sure if it controlled the AC and the mini fridge but both were sub par. It took hours to cool a drink. I will admit that the weather was hot ~ 95 degrees Fahrenheit daily but a cool shower and ice bucket from the bar downstairs was necessary to cool off. The bed was also supposed to be a queen but were two twins pushed together, and were very stiff. It is also very expensive to get drinks at the hotel bar ( around 9 Euros for a shot of Jack Daniels). Overall: The hotel was nice and service was exceptional, the location is good but you will have to walk ~15 minutes to get to places like the Fountain of Trevi and other main attractions which isnt bad but not optimal, but being close to Roma Termini Station may be a plus to others so make your own decision about that. The free WiFi was a major plus along with the other complimentary amenities, however to receive an excellent rating, the AC and refrigerator is a major player and just didn't meet our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't say enough good things about this place”
Reviews.Author: LiveStrong83
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for 4 nights at the beginning of our recent 4 week holiday and it was a great experience. Out of the 6 different hotels we stayed at throughout our trip, Hotel Diocleziano in Rome was our equal favourite (the other accommodation being a resort in Croatia that we paid a bit more for). What separates Hotel Diocleziano from the other hotels that we stayed at was the service provided by the staff. Tomasso and Valentino made us feel extremely welcome and helped us out with every request, and every query. At no point were we ever made to feel like an inconvenience and our expectations were often exceeded (like when we were provided with a drink and snacks at the bar free of charge while waiting for our airport transfer - I wouldn't expect this though!) The location is great, only a quick 5 minute walk to the main transport terminal and 20-25 minutes walk, if you'd prefer, to most of the fantastic tourist attractions such as the Colosseum, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Pantheon, etc. The rooms are very clean, reasonably spacious and the bathroom was better than most other hotels that we stayed at. Breakfast was great- each morning we enjoyed an array of scrambled eggs, cold meats, cheese, yogurt and cereals as well as the service staff happy to accommodate coffee requests (even those made by some rude American visitors, "that's no coffee- I want American coffee...") One for the girls- like many European hotels, there are no irons in the rooms. You can however borrow an iron and board from reception without a problem. Overall, I'd recommend this place to anyone visiting Rome and will stay there again next time in Rome. Hopefully with all of these positive reviews, they'll still have some vacancies! :) Thanks Tomasso, Valentino and HD staff. Cheers.

Reviews.Title: “Best place in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Stefano L
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly and extremely helpful: despite we arrived much earlier than check-in hour, they immediately arranged a suitable accommodation. Room was amazingly big and comfortable, bathroom was great. In general, everything was clean and perfectly working. Breakfast very good, location perfect. The only bad thing of this hotel was... To leave it! :) We would have loved to stay longer. For sure it's not cheap, but for such a place you really won't regret spending a bit more. We would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay..”
Reviews.Author: tukre
Reviews.Content: very clean and comfortable room, friendly staff, amazing ammenities, perfect location... Thank you for making our honeymoon unforgettable... hope to see you next time!

Reviews.Title: “A excellent choice in central Roma”
Reviews.Author: cxahmed
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. This is not so big and not so tiny hotel. The service is very good. Rooms are clean and fresh. We got free minibar with drinks and snacks to munch on. We had booked a stadard double room but at arrival we were offered a larger rom for the same price. You cant complain on the breakfast either. Internet was free and fast enough. If you r young you can walk to most attractions. The Terminal is just 5 min away by walk. Also u have many eateries nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous city – Hotel Brilliant Location”
Reviews.Author: IssyBell
Reviews.Content: Hotel Diocleziano has a really good location in the centre of Rome and not far from the major attractions. Near to the bus and train terminal. Most Hotel’s in Rome are small and this one is no different, however the rooms are nicely furnished and the hotel was very clean, lovely breakfast and best of all the staff – Everyone one of them was helpful and friendly. We met up with family from another country in Rome and we were all happy with the hotel, service and food. There is a restaurant ‘Babbo’s’ just around the corner and I would highly recommend this as well….yummy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in everything!”
Reviews.Author: Sergei_and_Valentina
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for five days. First of all, we would like to thank tripadvisor.com for giving us a possibility to learn about this great hotel. To cut a long story short, here are some pros and cons: Pros: 1. Great location. The hotel is situated in a very calm street (there is practically no traffic) with a view of the Terms of Diocleziano (it was interesting to find out that the embassy of our country, Russia, is located on the same street). On the other hand, it’s only 7-8 minute walk to Termini railway station (the junction of the two underground lines of Rome), 5 minute walk to Piazza dei Cinquecento (the biggest bus terminal in the city), 8-10 minute walk to Reppublica underground station, and 6-7 min walk to hop on/hop off bus stop of the main city lines, including 110, Archeobus, Roma Christiana, etc. The walking distance between the hotel and the Forum is approximately 20-25 minutes. 2. Outstanding staff. We couldn’t but appreciate the professionalism of the personnel who did their best to make our stay in Rome most pleasant (our special thanks to Valentino and Tomazzo). On our arrival, Tomazzo informed us about good restaurants near the hotel (when I checked this information on tripadvisor.com, all the mentioned restaurants had perfect references) and the ways of travelling in the city. Any questions that arose during our stay in the hotel were solved quickly and professionally (for example, we failed to make a preliminary registration for our flight, and Valentino did his best to solve this issue very quickly). Thank you very much, guys! 3. Very nice rooms. We got a room on the third floor, and we loved it very much. It was not our first visit to Rome, and we know that to find a normal room (in size) can be rather problematic there. Diocleziano can really boast of rooms of good size, with big bathrooms, and a nice view. We were a little bit afraid that the beds would be too firm to sleep normally, but they were quite OK (see the photos attached). 4. Good breakfasts. Cold dishes: three types of ham, salami, various cheeses, vegetables, fruits, yoghurts, etc. Hot dishes: scrambled eggs, beans, mushrooms, bacon. The breakfast starts at 6.45, and this early start really helps to enjoy some pleasant moments of calm atmosphere in S.M. Maggiore (or even S. Pietro) (the “tourist hour” in Rome usually starts at about 10.00 a.m.). 5. Wi-Fi connection: perfect in our room. Cons: No visible The hotel really deserves its high place on tripadvisor.com, and our family now knows well where to stay to make the trip to Rome really unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: rozmont
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of this hotel. It is within 10 minute walk to Roma Termini which the airport train leaves from, the Leonardo Express. The hotel staff were helpful and friendly. The room was small but comfortable with a beautiful bathroom with spa. There is a small lift and disabled access as well. Buffet breakfast was plentiful and varied. Fresh brewed coffee and freshly squeezed orange juice were appreciated, as were the drinks in the minibar We would recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Singap0reanTraveller
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff and very clean rooms. Conveniently located near the main train station. Excellent breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: utah_man
Reviews.Content: The hotel stafff are very friendly and accomodating. The room is very comfortable and clean. The free breakfast is very good. Free mini bar items (drinks) was a very nice touch. The phiysical location of the hotel near the Termini is great, but the area around the Termini is not that great. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a 2 nights stay”
Reviews.Author: travelwonders1234
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on all the positive reviews and surely we were not disappointed. It was perfect for a two night stay before embarking on a 10 days cruise. Hotel staff from the front desk to the dining room staff is very friendly and helpful. They really make you feel welcome. Another thing we like about this hotel is it is located on a quiet street but very close to the Termini and centrally located to all the major attractions. Room is not fancy but clean and comfortable and daily two free bottle water is a nice touch. The free internet is a plus too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paul93
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here while visiting Rome. It was clean, friendly and had most amenities. The breakfast buffet was good with nice fresh squeezed OJ and capacinio. The staff was cheerful and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sam_n_Beth
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Dioceziano in June 2011 for 3 nights and had the best experience you can possibly ask for in Rome. This hotel is just off Termini, on via Gaeta, which is a very quiet street behind Piazza Republica. It is easily accessible to the Metro (even though we did not take it) and taxi cabs. We walked everywhere, and the major attractions like Trevi, Piazza Spagna and the Colosseum are not more than 15 minutes away. Cabs are not that expensive in Rome, comparable to NYC or Chicago prices and they are readily available in designated taxi stands across rome. The rooms were fantastic, super clean and filled with amenities. Very quiet, a full and great bathroom/shower and the service was just excellent. They have a fantastic breakfast spread and the front desk will arrange a cab or private car for you (for airport etc). They also booked the Vatican tour for us (totally worth it - do not stand in line, joining a tour is the best way to see Vatican Museums) and turned out to be fairly cheaper than other tours I researched online. There is in-room coffee machine, snacks and soft drinks/water. Hair dryer is included in every room and the beds are comfortable. They made our stay an absolute pleasure. If we are in Rome, we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bernie10
Reviews.Content: Friendly, informative, helpful staff. Very clean and well maintained. Centrally placed, but set back from main streets and so quiet - necessary after the mayhem of Rome! We had a room on the top floor overlooking the historic baths - lovely. Liked the complementary soft drinks in the fridge - nice touch. Lovely big clean bathroom with linen changed daily. Breakfast perfectly fine. The only downside was the area wasn't the best and we wouldn't have walked around some of the surrounding streets here very late at night. Having said that we had no problems whatsover and like all visits to big cities, keeping safe is mainly using common sense. Would definately stay here again and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: sezmjc
Reviews.Content: much nicer than we expected, friendly staff, well appointed, good location, breakfast was acceptable --not cheap, but won't break the bank either, and good quality for the price. We would certainly stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and convenient!”
Reviews.Author: kimschechter
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews. We were definitely not disappointed! The staff at the hotel are very helpful and charming. They happily arranged our pick-up from the airport, tours,and restaurant reservations. We were very impressed with the level of service. The rooms are modern,very clean and well appointed. Most importantly,this hotel is in a quiet little cul de sac so a good nights sleep was had every night we were there. The Diocleziano is just a few minutes from the train station and buses so was convenient for getting around. We would definitely return and highly recommend it ! Ciao! to Giordano, Valentino , Tommaso and the rest of the staff at Hotel Diocleziano.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic didnt want to come home”
Reviews.Author: catmorri
Reviews.Content: Cannot fault this hotel. From arrival at reception we were treated so well and our cases taken to the room. The room we had was the VIP room and it lived up to its name. The terrace was superb and we sat out every evening after our meal. The room and the hotel were spotless. I would recommend this to everyone and it is so central. A 5 min walk to termini and the metro. the metro cost only 1 euro for 75 mins and we were able to go the vattican , trevi fountain etc by this mode of transport. Breakfast was varied and the bread and croissants lovely, i especially loved the coffee made to order. Thank you for our lovely stay and i hope i am back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Had a lovely time”
Reviews.Author: rmg88
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and had a lovely time. From check in to check out, the staff were so polite, friendly and helpful. The room was very comfortable, although a little bit on the small size, but, as to be expected in Rome hotels. Had a Tv with plenty of english channels, good shower and plenty of space for clothes, bags, etc. The breakfast they did was excellent. Maybe not the biggest assortment of food, but certainly as tasty and fresh as any good hotel. Location was fantastic as it is literally around the corner from Termini, making any trip or excursion were accessible, and getting to/from the airport. All in all, we had a great time at this hotel. The friendly staff and comfortable rooms gave it a very homely feel. Would certainly stay again and recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Stay No were else”
Reviews.Author: epitcher2
Reviews.Content: We had a week in Rome with Friends on the way home to Australia. Usually book Europe trips with Travel agent but have been using Expedia the Last 3 years so booked this hotel, the ones through the travel agent for Rome (3 times) were ok but this one was just wonderful, our friends have never been to Rome so I prepared them that the hotel might not be good, what a shock. The service was amazing, from Front Desk, Bell Boys, Cleaners, the rooms were a great size for Rome, the bathroom was big and the Breakfast was wonderful, they even made a latte if you wanted one, freshly squeezed orange juice while you waited, hot and cold buffet. I would not stay anywhere else and have already given the name to a few friends going over. The hotel is also in a very quite street next to the museum and 5 minute walk from the main station

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: genlovestotravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with my parents last week. The staff was nice, spoke english. The rooms were clean, however very small, and the amenities inside the room doesn't make it seem like a 4 star hotel. They do give out shampoo, tea, mini bar, tv ect, but I have been in 4 stars hotel that had more to offer. This being said, it is still a good place to stay if you want to be close from the Termini. However, some consider this area as being ghetto. There is a small gym, sauna, and breakfast dining room which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a last night in Rome”
Reviews.Author: RoomZoom
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located very close to the train station. Plenty of restaurant options. Room was a bit on the small side when compared to our other experiences in Italy for the money. The bed was very firm. The bathroom was a let down. Touted as being one of the room's highlights, it was difficult to operate the shower and the tub enclosure was very creaky and uncomfortable. The elevator is small and slow so better to take the stairs sometimes. Breakfast was very nice. Wouldn't want to stay here for more than a day or two but fine for a last night in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Perfect stay.”
Reviews.Author: welshraz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights during May 2011. We could not find one fault with our stay! We were made to feel exceptionally welcome from the moment we stepped through the door. The hotel was clean, quiet, well decorated and within easy reach of public transport and several sights. The staff were friendly and helpful and always made us feel special. They allowed us to check in early, which was great after a long journey. Our room was bright, with a fabulous bathroom with a jacuzzi! I love the complimentary soft drinks that you get every day - a nice touch. There was a good selection of food for breakfast, too. The best bit of all...after arriving back at the hotel after a long day sightseeing, we hear a knock at the door. Upon opening the door we find a member of staff with complimentary champagne and nibbles for us to help celebrate my 30th birthday! What more could you ask for?! An amazing stay at a great hotel. We will be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarahrc6
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in May. It was a convenient location, just a few minutes from the main train station. The hotel was spotless and comfortable. The shower was small, but we got used to it pretty quickly. The breakfast was really good. They had scrambled eggs, fruit, cereals, meat, cheese, toast, and great cappacino. The staff was friendly and helpful. There are several good restaurants within walking distance. Overall we thought this was a great hotel to stay in Rome. The only thing that made us uncomfortable was one day when we were coming back in the evening we saw some people doing drugs on the sidewalk across the street from the hotel. Unfortunately you can't control things like this in a big city. Great hotel though; nice and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay but a little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ams784
Reviews.Content: We are a couple in our late 20's and early 30's on our honeymoon of 4 nights. We had got married a couple of days before and were very excited about our first trip to Rome. We were very pleased with the location of this hotel. It was very close to Termini station which was very useful to get to and from the airports. When we first arrived we were not happy with the room so we moved immediately. The room was fairly large with a very large bathroom area but no windows and right next to the entrance and lift area. There was no problem with us moving. However, our next room was very small and had a very small shower cubicle. We were very disappointed as this was our honeymoon after all! After the first night we were able to move rooms to a much bigger room with a bigger bathroom and 2 windows, therefore bright and airy. But still no bath after I had requested one and we were lead to believe we would have one from booking online and talking to the receptionist before moving again! Although we were not in Rome to spend alot of time in our hotel room we were disappointed that we were not able to have a bath. After walking all day it would be a god send to have a little soak before heading out again for the evening. Also the staff were aware that it was our honeymoon (after we told them when we arrived and my husband had emailed before hand) but we had no little touches to make it extra special. Breakfast was fine and again the staff were very helpful. The concierge staff were excellent too. It was great to have wi-fi in your rooms and the free refills of soft drinks was fab too. The hotel was very clean and again the staff were very friendly and helpful!! We were able to walk to all the sights of room (with sore feet at times!).The red hop on and hop off bus was a good experience (but avoid doing this if it is the weekend or raining as sometimes you may have to wait a long time to get on. There was a great restaurant right near the hotel (as you walk out it's to the left la fambilia i think) which was excellent. Also in the spanish steps area there is a great little restaurant called numbs and another called enoteca capranica. Overall, the hotel was in a fantastic location if you're able to walk around easily and the staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, convenient, cool!”
Reviews.Author: meenakshidharpatel
Reviews.Content: Great location... across Roma Termini, Rome's main station, tucked away in a lane so not crowded or noisy. Rooms a tad small but comfortable and clean. Free colas everyday! Free wi-fi. Helpful front desk. Good buffet breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Diocleziano - LOVED IT! And definitely will come back”
Reviews.Author: mzapple
Reviews.Content: We went to Rome in July 2010, stayed at this hotel for 5 nights (before a cruise). The staff was awesome! They spoke English and they were very helpful. They helped us get a limo from the hotel to the cruise ship. The room (twin beds) was nice and very clean. The hotel is located on a very quiet street, it felt very safe. The Termini is a short walk (about 10 minutes) from the hotel. Lots of places to eat near by. Breakfast was awesome...deli meat, toast, eggs.. yum! I would say the only negative is that the shower stall is super small. I'm 5'3, and petite and I barely had any room to move around. I noticed that in some of the photos on this site, the shower stalls are bigger so I guess it depends on which room you get. So make sure you ask for a shower stall that's big. I highly recommend this to anyone and everyone looking for a nice and affordable hotel in Rome. I will definitely come back to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Diocleziano is a fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LA-CATraveller
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at Hotel Diocleziano from June 2, 2011 through June 6, 2011. This was my second time at this hotel. Every aspect of this hotel is perfect in my opinion. First, the location is ideal in that it is just a few minutes from Termini station. Second, the hotel staff is incredibly professional, helpful, accommodating and friendly, especially Tommasso and Giordano. The rooms are quite spacious for European standards and very well kept. The breakfast is quite good and the service staff does an incredible job. Having a gym facility was really a nice touch for someone like me who enjoys working out. The stocked mini-bar (at no charge to the guests) pleasantly surprised me again as you just don't see this at other hotels. Simply put, Hotel Diocleziano is a perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Above all Expectations! - Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mieleone
Reviews.Content: Small friendly Hotel - Exceptional standards of cleanliness throughout - Quality additions were free including - mini bar- room safe - newspapers- wi fi - Gym and Sauna etc .Quality breakfast. Excellent Service. Very well located for City trip -Walking distance to Termini .Hotel will arrange Sightseeing Tours etc. We would go again....

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bubelero
Reviews.Content: If all roads lead to Rome, all Roman public transport leads to Termini. This hotel is located withing a 100 metres or so of that famous station so getting around from here is easy. We found the hotel has all we needed with very kind staff, quiet rooms and good air conditioning. Priced above some of the bargains we have to say we have no regrets; we had a busy schedule and each evening we had a comfortable place to return to with good breakfast to start the day.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay made our Rome holiday special”
Reviews.Author: BorderMan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Diocleziano from 16th to 22nd May and can't praise it enough ! This small (ish) modern hotel was ideally situated just away from the hustle and bustle of Terminii station in a quiet renovated area. Metro, bus and train facilities were a short walk away and the hotel staff provided excellent recommendations for local restaurants, bus tours and guides. All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful, and helped to make our stay in Rome special and memorable. We would love to visit again one day and would recommend Hotel Diocleziano to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Teresawh
Reviews.Content: Excellent location near Termini station where metro and buses are cheap and easy to get to anywhere in Rome - saves your feet. Hotel pristine, Staff very friendly and helpful, particularly Tommasso on reception. Breakfast plentiful and good quality. Hotel very quiet no road noise or horn honking. As for Rome, mad and vibrant the only down side it was exorbitantly expensive £70 for a two course meal with house wine for two, not in a central location either. Also in 1/2 an hour spent in a street bar three lots of "musicians" passed by with hands out plus a rose thrust in the face and a sunglass seller we gave to the first but it really was a bit much. If you are happy to smile and say no and be prepared to suck up the prices you will have a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Easy in Roma”
Reviews.Author: hg6649
Reviews.Content: Perfect for an overnight in Rome. We landed in Rome on Friday morning and were headed to the Amalfi Coast via train the next day, so we needed quick and easy accommodations for one night. This hotel was perfectly located. Although it's close to the train station, it's on a very quiet, clean street. No taxi required. The hotel staff was excellent and the service was better than we've received at more "big name" hotels in Rome. The room, while compact, was scrupulously clean. We had a large jetted tub and shower. Plus, free WiFi and minibar. Two thumbs up. A great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great base to expolre Rome from. Hotel is basic, but hard to fault.”
Reviews.Author: TIMreddoor
Reviews.Content: Located in a quiet street close to Termini station, meant easy access to metro, buses & plenty of cabs. We found it a great base to explore Rome from. The hotel is small & quite basic, but it delivers an efficient and high standard of service. Our room/bathroom was fine in terms of size and furnishing, although the bed was a bit hard (we asked for a softer one, they provided it without any fuss). If you are planning on spending more time "out" in Rome rather than "in" a hotel, I would highly recommend this hotel as a base. The staff were all helpful, and responded without any fuss to any of our requests. For what it offered, and based on our stay, it is hard to fault.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, friendly hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: BWL1949
Reviews.Content: Ver nice hotel located within 2 blocks of Termini Station. Excellent, friendly, helpful staff, esp. Tomasso. Good buffet breakfast (they will make you fried eggs if you ask them!). Rooms are clean and efficient (read small) but very typical of European facilities. Would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, wonderful location, very clean!”
Reviews.Author: gina876
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel before heading to Italy on Trip Advisor and wanted to say how fantastic it is. It is close to the Metro - both Termini and Repubblica, and is one stop away from Trevi Fountain and Piazza Navona and a couple of stops before the Spanish Steps. The service is fantastic. The staff go out of their way to help you with anything you need. The rooms are spacious and very clean as is the whole hotel. It looks like it has been recently refurbished. Breakfast was huge. Could not fault this hotel. Also within walking distance to some restaurants - one of the best was La Campagna. Food was fantastic and reasonably priced. The hotel recommended it and we had some of the best food there. Would definitely stay at this hotel again when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: DaytonaDave1
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews and it did not disappoint. It was a short walk from Termini Train Station, the Metro and Buses. Very convenient. Our superior double interior room was clean and quiet and I enjoyed a nice hot bath in the jetted tub each night after long days of walking and sightseeing in Rome. The front desk staff was excellent. They promptly answered all of me email questions before arrival, gave good restaurant recommendations and otherwise accomodated all of our requests.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bill_strachan
Reviews.Content: central but quiet location, friendly staff, cleanliness of Hotel, good breakfast, free mini bar (soft drinks) a nice touch, great restuarant nearby Babbo's, made a memotable trip to Rome even better

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, clean and good view from our window”
Reviews.Author: patti4866
Reviews.Content: We looked at Trip Adviser before we booked a hotel in Rome. This one was highly rated. We could walk everywhere we wanted to go without a taxi. We did take the subway to the Vatican. The subway was only two blocks away. We could also walk our big suitcases to the train station that was three blocks from the hotel. They had a good breakfast each morning. The rooms was always clean. I went with my daughter for a visit to Italy and we had a great time. I may go back with my husband. He is interested after he heard what a good time we had.

Reviews.Title: “A must stay for anyone traveling to Rome!”
Reviews.Author: diamondstella
Reviews.Content: Excellent 4 night stay! The complimentary non-alcoholic mini bar was a treat after a long day of sightseeing. The hotel location is ideal as it is within walking distance to most major attractions. Pick up for the hop on, hop off tour bus is right around the corner. The service from the hotel staff was top notch as they provided excellent recommendations for restaurants and local attractions and provided assisted with transport services. Breakfast was filling, and a great start to each day. We would most definitely stay at Hotel Diocleziano again. Our highest recommendation for anyone looking for a comfortable stay in Rome!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base to explore Rome from”
Reviews.Author: M44SEL
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here in May, excellent location, walking distance from Termini. Hotel in quiet street, staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms clean, comfortable and fabulous bathroom with jacuzzi. mini bar stocked with water and soft drinks daily at no charge. Breakfast buffet very adequet. We choose on the basis of trip advisor positive comments and they were all true.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: fmck49
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. This is an excellent hotel with which it's impossible to find fault. It's spotlessly clean, the rooms are very comfortable and the location is in a side street so it's very quiet at night. The rooms have a free non-alcoholic mini bar which is restocked daily and all guests have free internet access. It's 5 mins walk from the Diocletian Baths and Termini Station and just around the corner from an excellent restaurant, Babbo's, recommended by the front desk and so good we ate there every night. All the staff are very friendly and efficient and are always happy to help. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again and recommend it unreservedly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Quiet Location”
Reviews.Author: FunTimes030
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Diocleziano is excellent and we would recommend to anyone visiting Rome. All the staff are extremely helpful and friendly. The front desk staff, Giordano and his colleagues, are wonderful. They arranged airport transfers for us via email before we left home; all went very smoothly. The breakfast is excellent; Emily is a gem and makes wonderful coffee. On leaving, while waiting for the car to the airport, the manger offered us coffee, which was most appreciated. Could not fault this hotel. It is very quiet; the rooms are tastefully decorated and spotless. Location near Termini in a very quiet back street is ideal, walking distance to all the major attractions. Would recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “Rome: Quite, Soft and Very Confortable!”
Reviews.Author: MMatos
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel in a quiet sidestreet near, the staff was very helpful and always kind. The buffet breakfast is great and plenty of cakes, bread, cheeses/met and expresso/capuccino very good. They have organise our transport to and from Airport (€100...very confortable, safe and very good driver) after the reserve in the Booking.com. Always answer my doubts before my stay. The location is fantastic, because we can walk anywhere and are also so close to Termini Station if you need to catch a train, bus or metro (We buy 7 days card for € 16 with unlimited travels). We stayed in the VIP room w/ private terrace, and this was amazing for enjoying some. They offer every day the minibar (water, juices, coca) and tea with cakes. Near there is a very good restaurant (Gallina Blanca). Please, stay in the hotel...and we will not forget!

Reviews.Title: “Nice getaway”
Reviews.Author: Fireblader
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff upon arrival. Room was extremely small. Due to an unfortunate event we were moved to a larger room. Air con in the room either works, doesn't work, or is noisy. Free mini bar is very helpful (no alcohol). The soft drink or water is much appreciated at night, or in the morning. Tea/Coffee facilities is also present in the rooms with biscuits (topped up daily). Breakfasts were delicious! Lots of fantastic croissants with hot/cold food buffet. Close to the Termini Station (handy to grab an open top bus, 20 Euro per person ticket is valid for 24hours, hop on/off service). The Trevi fountain is about a 20 minute comfortable walk. A handful of restaurants within walking distance. Clean rooms, great breakfasts, friendly staff. It's just a shame the hotel doesn't offer or cater for inhouse Dinners (only breakfast). Free gym is also helpful. The showers are phenomenal at the inhouse mini gym.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome - stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Gregg60
Reviews.Content: This hidden gem is a 5 minute walk from the Central train station and is on a quiet side street. From the minute we arrived the hotel staff made us feel welcomed and important. The staff was very attentive and helpful with anything we needed. They arranged tours and provided good tips on where to eat. The room was small but well appointed and the mini bar and daily snacks were complimentary. The daily American breakfast was the best we experienced in our Italy travels. There is free wi-fi in the rooms too. The hotel was in walking distance to many sights and an easy walk to the underground for trains to anywhere in Rome. We would recommend this place to friends!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: ClaudiaM0510
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in March 2011. Very convenient location, the staff is very friendly and helpful. We really felt very cozy and safe there. The breakfast was very good and fresh. Our thanks to everybody for the great stay! We would highly recommend this hotel to everyone who plans to visit Rome. If we ever in Rome again, we would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service from friendly knowledgeable staff”
Reviews.Author: FLYINGDOC
Reviews.Content: After a minor issue with our room, quickly sorted out by the manager , we settled into this base for our Rome trip. It is convenient for the railway station but of course , as with any city centre station location, be careful at night ( common sense). The standard rooms are great , the beds are usual for Italy as we found , ie firm but comfortable. Breakfast was great & includes bacon and eggs as well as excellent continental choice. The bathrooms are clean and modern as is the rest of the hotel. Wifi patchy on higher floors but there are free computers next to Lobby for all to use. Airport transfer is certainly worth it for 4 or more gusts as the train is more expensive than a private car transfer .

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful 3 day stay: Great hotel, clean, convenient with very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: jockmcgrumpy
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay for 3 nights. Great hotel. Highly recommended. Room was beautifully clean with great facilities, good bathroom and great shower. We arrived early but they had the room ready at 11am and allowed us to check in and freshen up so we could make the most of the first day. Quite small room for 4 star but very reasonable price. Close to Termini Station, great for trains and metro. Perfect for all the major sights, we walked everywhere and tooks metro to Vatican. Staff very accomodating and looked for any info we needed. Willing to give advice on any sights etc but not pushy. Able to organise transport to and from Airport. Top tip for Rome: book Vatican online before you go.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing”
Reviews.Author: GSP_Mom
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for three nights with my mother and sister in April, and I cannot stress enough how impressed we were with the hotel, the staff, location, etc. Valentino and Theodore (front office) both helped me plan a private guided tour of the Vatican (from the US before we arrived), and the guide they arranged for us was terrific! We couldn't have been happier. Valentino was amazing - he gave us perfect restaurant suggestions every night, and hotel management even noticed it was my birthday when we arrived and had a bottle of champagne and treats delivered to our room to say 'happy birthday'. The breakfast buffet was one of the best we had during our two week, four country trip. The location is fantastic - you can walk anywhere and are also so close to Termini Station if you need to catch a train. Overall, the hotel and staff paid attention to the details and I would recommend them to anyone coming to Rome. We stayed in the VIP room w/ private terrace, and this was amazing for enjoying some wine at night after a long day of sightseeing. I will definitely be staying there again when I return next time!

Reviews.Title: “Spotless and very friendly”
Reviews.Author: xxx1234
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel in a quiet sidestreet near the main rail terminal. Very nice breakfast supplied with a selection of cold meats and hot stuff (bacon, sausage, home-made baked beans, scrambled egg). Free soft drinks in mini-bar and free wireless. Good restaurants nearby especially Babbo's (quite expensive but good food and friendly service!) There is a small bar area with service provided by the bell-boy. This works surprisingly well and we never had to wait long - quite cheap too for a hotel (4Euro for a beer and 7euro for a very, very large whisky ) The Trevi fountain (and all the shops near there) is about 10 to 15 minutes walk away. We even walked across to the Vatican one day. This hotel is highly recommended, we were very sorry to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel out of the hustle and bustle!”
Reviews.Author: redrose046
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Diocleziano in April for a few nights. This hotel is just a 10 minute walk to Termini Train station as well as Piazza Repubblica and Santa Maria Maggiore. It is on a side street in a quiet area. You will not find the hustle and bustle of the Spanish Steps or Pantheon areas staying at this hotel. If you are not comfortable with taking the Metro or walking a bit (20 to 30 minute walk to some attractions) you may want to look for something more centrally located. The hotel staff and service was very pleasant and even provided us with a restaurant recommendation in the area which we enjoyed. They have complimentary wifi, breakfast, and mini bar with water and soda's free of charge. For those looking to stay out of the craziness of central Rome I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful and serviceminded staff in a hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: Helldesk
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful and serviceminded (great tips about restaurants). Excelent breakfast, by far, the best I've had in Italy. Location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: me1962Uk
Reviews.Content: Upgraded to the deluxe suite for one night as it was our anniversary. Central location wwith easy access to public transport. Rooms spotless, breakfast very good. Staff all polite and helpful. Gave good advice on restaurants etc. Definatley stay here again and would have no problems recommending it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “If we stay in Rome again we will definitely be going back to La Diocleziano !”
Reviews.Author: hicksid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on the basis of TripAdvisor recommendations. Our room on the third floor was very clean and well presented. Also reasonably spacious given there were 3 adults sharing what is essentially a two person room. The beds were a little bit too firm, although the firmness of the third “z-bed” was perfect as I had a bad back. The air-conditioning was effective and this was important as the building works across the street were quite noisy in the early morning, so we had to shut out windows. I guess this will be temporary though. Valentino, the concierge, and all the staff were really helpful, spoke excellent English and made us very welcome. Breakfast was good and the breakfast staff were friendly and helpful. Excellent cappucino ! Valentino recommended the “La Lampada” restaurant and it was very good with a pleasant, calm atmosphere and not too expensive (48 euros for two courses, wine and for three adults). Also, only a ten minute walk. The “La Famiglia” is only a one minute walk from the hotel. Same price to eat as the “La Lampada” but the food was not as good quality and the ambience is more noisy and fast-paced. I would only go there if nowhere else was available. The “Babbos” was also recommended to us but we didn’t try it as it seemed a little too expensive at approx 40 euros per head for evening meal. And for really cheap food “on the hoof”, try the “Fantasy Pizza” around the corner. The location is not particularly central, however, only five minutes walk from the main railway station, so if you don’t feel like walking, there are options for the metro and buses close by. Walking to nearby sites like the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, etc was only 30 minutes away at a leisurely pace. If we stay in Rome again we will definitely be going back to La Diocleziano !

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: crook_lisa
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent. Staff were friendly and helpful. Close to all sites and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “I'll come back !”
Reviews.Author: Vivian_P_07
Reviews.Content: Third time in Rome but first in Diocleziano . Very good hotel, near Termini (metro + bus) , clean and quiet room, large bathroom, free mini bar and excelent breakfast.We would definitely stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “First class location and very friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: kwars0123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so well located that had I discovered it before I would have stayed here on the other occasions my wife and I visited Rome. The place was spotlessly clean and the staff really enjoyed helping the guests. I can add that breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!”
Reviews.Author: Max-Max-44
Reviews.Content: I really had a very good experience at the "Diocleziano". The hotel's location was great, my room very clean and comfortable, and the staff fully available. Breakfast was excellent and varied. Truly a wonderful experience in the heart of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Paulina_1111
Reviews.Content: My sister and I just returned from a week's stay at Hotel Diocleziano. I booked it based on the reviews here and was not disappointed. We were greeted by very friendly hotel staff and the first class service continued throughout our stay! The room was spotless and a pleasure to return to every night after a full day of sightseeing. The little fridge was a nice touch with complimentary juices and pop refilled daily! The location of the hotel is pretty good as well. It is a five minute walk to the train station which is very convenient if you are planning to make a day trip from Rome. We took the high speed train to Florence for the day ( 1 1/12 hrs each way , 90 euros return ) and didn't have to worry about a cab ride back from the station. Most major attractions are within walking distance. The Coloseum and Forum are about a 25 minute walk, Trevi Fountain takes 15 minutes and the Pantheon 20 minutes. The Vatican is a 15 minute metro ride ( from outside of Termini). The free wi-fi and the breakfast at the hotel were both fantastic features as well. The breakfast was not extravagant but good enough to fuel up for the day! Overall, both my sister and I agreed that we will definitely be returning to this hotel the next time we are in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: westfish
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Outstanding service. Bellhop escorted us to our rooms and brought the luggage. Everyone is smiling and bends over backwards to help. The rooms are charming and quiet. You will get great value. La Familia is a hearty restaurant nearby. Train station very close.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marducita
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, strategically located near Termini Station with all means of transportation (trains, buses, subway). The area felt fine, not unsafe even by night. The hotel is very new, cozy and comfortable, big room and bathroom, good bed, great shower, good towels and carpets, very nice and helpful staff. Excellent breakfast in a very large room. Also the content of the minibar (drinks) was free, very nice touch. And the room had a kettle to make coffee, and some crackers and honey. They had an internet room with 3 pc for clients, besides the wifi connection in the room. The room was also very quiet, I could sleep all night without a noise. This hotel is not cheap, but it's worth every penny. I didn't feel like at home, I felt BETTER.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: johng032
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 nights with my girlfriend this past week. The hotel was very well kept and clean. Our room was a bit small by US standards but fine for our needs. The complimentary mini bar and wifi were huge plusses. The complimentary breakfast was very good and has a nice variety of meats, fruits and yogurts. The hotel staff were excellent and responsive. They booked dinner reservations for us and were more than happy to show you the way around the neighborhood. They also sent a complimentary bottle of champagne to our room on my girlfriend's birthday. A very unexpected but classy touch. Location is dependent on the traveller. It is very close to Termini (train station) and if you do not mind the subway/metro, it is an excellent location. If you prefer the hustle and bustle of Piazza Navonna or Spanish Steps, you will be disappointed in the quiet neighborhood off the main street. If you do stay, I recommend going to the Salumeria around the corner for a nice bottle of wine, salami and tellagio cheese. Nice mid day "snack".

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in perfect location for leisure or business in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Tom186609
Reviews.Content: Both of us just loved this hotel which had exactly what we required for our short three day trip to Rome. Room was perfect , absolutely spotless, all the facilities , really quiet which meant perfect sleep ! Breakfast was also really good . As it was close to Termini it also really suited us for travel as we used both Metro & trains & ideal for Shuttle bus from Airport ! However, over & above was the superb service offered by ALL staff & particularly those on front reception! I found this hotel on Trip Advisor & really glad I did because everything recorded there is absolutely correct !

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: jacoby1
Reviews.Content: My wife and i were staying at this hotel for 5 nights. The hotel haS a fantastic location: 2-3 minutes walking from Termini bus and metro station, yet located in a small-sided and quiet street. The romm was big, illuminated, well furnished with a big comfortable bad. The bathroom was also big and cossy. A big plus is the mini bar with the free drinks (water and cola) and the free of charge wi-fi internet. The stuff was alaways attended to the visitors, very helpfull as well as gentile and kind. We sure recommend this hotel for all Rome visitors! Jacoby family, Israel

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Millie2345
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff are first class.The rooms are spotless. There is a superb choice of food available at the breakfast buffet .We had a thoroughly enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews are accurate, great stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: azroyalsfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week on a vacation to Italy. Hotel is Clean and Cozy. Rooms are on the small side, but it's Europe after all! Breakfast had a decent variety. Bed was ok for sleeping but not necessarily for relaxing. Location is perfect if you plan on using the Termini for accessing Italy or the city of Rome. Walking is ultimately the best way to experience Rome, and this Hotel is accessible to everything. What really impressed me about this Hotel was that they didn't nickel and dime you. The mini fridge has COMPLIMENTARY soft drinks that are replenished daily. They have loaner umbrellas for complimentary use. They also have ac adapters available for use at no charge if you happen to forget yours. To top it off, they prepare sack "breakfasts" for people who are heading out before the breakfast service starts at 0645. This is an excellent hotel for the price. Tip: the leonardo express is $14 Euro per person one-way from the airport and takes 30 minutes. If your not in a hurry, you can take a motor coach from the airport for $8 euro per person and takes abou 60 minutes, but gives you a nice overview of the city on the way in.
