Don't be concerned about walking from the Termini pulling your luggage, you'll be one of hundreds doing the same thing!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and helpful, excellent accomodation.”
Reviews.Author: mb3023
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 days in this hotel and most impressed with staff and accomodation. All very freindly and extremely helpful and all staff spoke good english. Very tidy gym but due to heavy schedule and lots of walking never tried it out. There is a bar but only downside is there is no actual bar service but drinks are availableby asking reception staff if you want one. That being said it is not an issue as there is an abundance of nearby resturants. One big plus is location of hotel very close to temini (Main train/bus station) so when we return will be able to aviod the cost of taxi or limo transfer but having seen the crowds and crushing involved, it is sometimes worth the extra expense.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: kmunro28
Reviews.Content: Well situated, very close to main station and one of the stops for the 'Hop-on Hop-off buses'. Reception staff extremely friendly and helpful. Room was very clean, comfortable beds and nice linen. Breakfast was more than adequate to start the day, good selection of drinks, fruit, hot and cold breakfast dishes. Also dining room staff very friendly and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “terrific small hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: honestreviewer50
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 4 nights - all staff very helpful and friendly. Rooms comfortable and quiet. Good local restaurant. We would strongly recommend this hotel - one of the best we have ever stayed at..

Reviews.Title: “fabulous”
Reviews.Author: asverrill
Reviews.Content: We spent our last night in Rome at the hotel. They gave us the room at the top which was incredible with its own patio! The staff was polite and professional!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the hotel Diocleziano”
Reviews.Author: Markku1951
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations. The rooms are not big but really comfortable. It is very easy to sleep at night, because the hotel is so quiet. The staff treated us politely. The breakfast is much better than in other hotels in Italy. During our trip we visited also Venice, Naples and Pisa. The fittness center of the hotel Diocleziano is very good if you want to relax and you can also take a sauna bath. Indeed, this hotel should have 5 stars because of the comfortableness and wonderful service

Reviews.Title: “great staff, very friendly and helpfull”
Reviews.Author: deepaworld
Reviews.Content: must stay there...great breakfast and very close to the main railway station. a great cafe just a minutes walk from the hotel that was open till midnight :)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Zeynzeyn
Reviews.Content: I have enjoyed my visit at the hotel. The rooms are very comfortable and clean. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. The location is central. The breakfast is good.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Perfect”
Reviews.Author: moniTT
Reviews.Content: Very helpful personnel with excellent command of English. Great breakfast. Impeccable room. Perfect location - within walking distance to major historic sights.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service!”
Reviews.Author: MsKittykins
Reviews.Content: Rome is a city flooded with hotels so you have to be wise in your choice of places to stay. The "star" quality of a hotel is loosely defined here and may not fully represent what you are used to in your own country. This hotel was fantastic. It is small (with only about 35 rooms), within walking distance of the Metro, and has some of the most pleasant staff we've ever encountered. The room was clean and well-fashioned. It was of a good size (especially for being European). The bathroom was a bit small but. again, a standard European size. Totally workable. Honestly, the staff always went above and beyond to make us feel welcome. We would definately stay here again. Ciao! :)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely clean hotel, fantastic helpful friendly people, great food - fantastic stay!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: N4T4L1E
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from 11 - 15 February and it was my first time in Rome. Prior to arriving in Rome, I had already spoken to different people from the hotel (mainly Valentino) who assisted me with confirming room details, recommending and even booking restaurants for me, as well as providing details on tours and costs( and I had even booked this all via a third party) just generally giving an initial feel of the service I could expect to receive on my stay there. I actually had my birthday there, and the hotel kindly brought up a bottle of champagne, a lovely note and some crisps to my room, which was such a lovely gesture! Everyone there; from hotel front desk (Valentino and Tomas), to porters to catering staff were all so friendly, incredibly accomodating and helpful. The hotel was incredibly clean as was the room and the breakfast bufet had a huge selection. Location wise is that it is close to the station and not far away from the main attraction. I would deffinitely recommend the Coloseum tour, Vatican museum and St Peters tour (both times get queue jumping tickets as you will need), view from Vittoriana (wedding cake monument) is amazing. It is a must see to go to the top as you see the whole of Rome! Beautiful! We were recommended Hi Res restaurant; food amazing, not horrendously expensive, it is not an Italian style taverna restaurant but more of a trendy restaurant but is incredibly intimate and feels like a members place. The trip was topped off by a chauffeur driven merc to the airport which the hotel organised, this is much nicer (and cheaper) than a taxi to / from the hotel! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel spotlessly clean. comfortable. excellent staff helpful and polite, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: bluenose43
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Rome for the first time for 3 nights 11-14 February to celebrate our Ruby Wedding Anniversary. The hotel upgraded us to a Superior room that included a jacuzzi bath. The hotel is situated only ten minutes walk from the Central Terminal in a quiet road. The hotel is extremely clean and comfortable. The staff were excellent and were helpful and polite. Main attractions and restuarants are within walking distance. The breakfast was excellent. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, clean, friendly, good breakfast, good location, reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: Hardy1976
Reviews.Content: Dont hesitate, book it. About 4 mins from the station, use the buses and tube to get around. VERY GOOD!

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable weekend stay.”
Reviews.Author: deanie756
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights (fri-mon) in February.The hotel is conveniently located within a short walk to the termini, Repubblica piazza and a 20 min walk to Colosseo and most tourist attractions. Our room was on the 3rd floor there is a small lift which was out of action duing the last days of our stay. The room was a twin bed which was spacious and very clean. I found the single beds very firm with crisp sheets and a blanket. I personally missed not having a duvet and mattress topper! We overlooked the street which we did experience some traffic and pedestrian noise but only when the windows where open.The hotel provides breakfast, soft drink mini bar ,tea and coffee, Wifi and safe free of charge. Which was most welcomed. The staff are professional and very helpful. Would highly recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: probativev
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week during the X'mas holiday and enjoyed it very much. Valentino was very friendly and attentive to all our needs, inquiries, etc. Room was small but comfortable. Bathroom actually had a jet tub. Hotel was very close to subway station and bus station, and taxis were easy to get. The little gym actually had adequate equipment and not just for show, even has a TV. Free internet. Biggest problem for women is the hair dryer, it's that kind that are found in smaller European hotels sometimes that is a tube that blow very little air but gets too hot to hold. Absolutely impossible to use so bring your own hair dryer and ask hotel for a converter instead. Hotel provides a breakfast but it was very basic and seem to cater to Brits and Americans. We were here partly for the delicious Italian food experience so even though breakfast was free we skipped it and went to a very popular cafe about 5 mins walk away from the hotel every morning. No longer remember the name though but if you walk around the area there are other breakfast options for sure. Hotel also conveniently close to a pharmacy and convenience store run by Indians so no problem if you forget any toiletries.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: ILoveEurope67
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Diocleziano in February 2011, having read the superb reviews of the hotel. We were not disappointed! It is an absolute gem of a hotel and we had a fabulous stay. The rooms are very comfortable and the manageress (Anna) and her staff bent over backwards to ensure we enjoyed our stay. On arrival we were upgraded to a room with a terrace and jacuzzi by Valentino who looked after our every need. We were given much help and advice on how to make the most of our visit, including great recommendations of restaurants. The breakfast is very extensive and caters for all tastes, including offering sausage, bacon and eggs. The hotel is situated near the Termini and we saw nothing whatsoever that made us feel uncomfortable in the area. I would recommend this hotel to everyone; you will not regret staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great service in a good location”
Reviews.Author: lanneNL
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Diocleziano hotel in oktober. It is conveniently located, a 3 min walk to Termini station (and bus and metro) but quietly. A little bit further one of the more major shopping streets, and close by smaller shops and bars for coffee or lunch. Service was great: the staff helped with advice on where to eat, go or how to arrange things, and they also were very accomodating in trying to give my parents wedding anniversary a special touch! And when leaving, they arranged a private cab for a good price back to the airport. Rooms were clean, with free minibar, good bed and clean bathroom. Breakfast did have quit a choice, at least enough to get a decent and nice eat before going into the eternal city! There is a small bar as well, but that's nothing special. Free wifi available, and a gym as well. All in all very happy with the hotel. Really every hotel has some negative points, but here I can't mention more then the loud flushing of water through the drains from the room above, but that didn't bother me. And only few rooms have a balcony, but then, are you going to Rome for sitting on your hotel balcony or visiting the eternal city? I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel with excellent staff.perfect location”
Reviews.Author: travelleristanbul34
Reviews.Content: excellent hote with excellent staff.perfect location

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: AntonioMariscal
Reviews.Content: I recommend that hotel to anyone travelling to Rome, Good location and helpful employees. I'll be back again !

Reviews.Title: “Great little gem”
Reviews.Author: Farleigh
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a romantic weekend away and were very happy with our choice. Lovely, clean hotel in a great location. Fab staff ! Also, could not get over the prices in the bar were cheaper than anywhere else in Rome! Breakfast was massive , but I do agree with one reviewer that there wasn't any decent fruit - but that's just me and really wan't important. Bathroom very well equipped and extremely clean. Free soft drinks in the mini bar and free wifi which was a real bonus. Tea, coffee and biscuits in the room all free. The Locatiion is a couple of minutes walk from the Station and Repubblica - so easy to get around. The buses all run close by to everywhere , but we chose to walk everywhere. I really recommend this hotel for cleanliness, location, staff and value for money. I will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: cornelia88_23
Reviews.Content: A nice. cosy hotel near Termini station, the public transportat hub of Rome and relatively close to all tourist attractions. We went for a leisure vacation and found the hotel quite quiet, clean with a great, great staff and extra services for free ( which you usually dont receive in a hotel): free minibar, free wireless internet in the room and sometimes free coffee at the bar. A great value for money

Reviews.Title: “Four star hotel Five star service”
Reviews.Author: spennyhut
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic, tucked away on a quiet street but a few minutes walk from Termini station and Republicca metro station. Although the best way to see this fantastic city is to walk and take it all in. The hotel provides an excellent buffet breakfast serving a mixture of cold and hot buffet and an expansive selection of fruit. The hotel staff are extremely helpful and Tomasso and Giodarno on Reception will give you their expert knowledge of where the best places to eat, drink. If you like Ice Cream then follow Tomasso's Advice and head for Fassi, The oldest and best Gelateria in Rome. Great experience and out of this world flavours. The Rooms are clean and spacious and also provide a nice touch of providing complimentary soft drinks in the mini bar. If sight-seeing doesn't wear you out then you can try the hotel's Gym, if the sight-seeing has worn you out then head for the sauna. The Gym and Sauna are free of charge, another thing free of charge is the internet usage, the hotel has computers in the lounge area but if you want information on Rome then ask Giodarno and Tomasso. This hotel is excellent and probably the best i have stayed in Europe and without a doubt the best i have stayed in Rome. Thank you Diocleziano Hotel you made our holiday perfect

Reviews.Title: “Worth every star!”
Reviews.Author: Sirpad
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights in this wonderful hotel at the end of January. Must say I liked 'everything' about it. Room was spotless, bed very comfortable, mini-bar with free soft drinks very welcome after a long day walking around Rome as was the option to have cup of tea/coffee. Room also came with small safe, free wi-fi and hair-dryer. Breakfast was a treat - good coffee with choice of breads, croissants, fruit, yoghurt, scrambled eggs, cereal - enough to energize us until dinner. Staff (not just the front office staff) were very friendly and helpful. Location good too - few blocks from train station and/or shuttle bus to airport. Would (will) stay there again without doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: jkfchan
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel Diocleziano for 3 days during CNY. The comments from fellow member are correct. The rooms are clean and spacious (in European standard) in a quiet neighborhood just outside Termini. The breakfast is enormous with hot dishes but not much fruit. Will stay at Hotel Diocleziano again if coming back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service at a top notch, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: BFK072
Reviews.Content: The service at the Diocleziano is absolutely first rate. The staff is smart, friendly, helpful and really made us feel like they were there to make our stay as pleasant and effortless as possible. As frequent business travelers, we have high standards about the hotels we stay at (and frankly, we have been at hotels that are much more expensive that did not offer the amenities and service that this one does.) The room (we had a double superior) was well equipped and very comfortable (jacuzzi bathtub a plus!). The reliable, fast wireless internet service was a big help to our work, and the lovely gym and sauna helped us unwind after a busy workday. We were given excellent recommendations for dining, and the staff always knew what bus we should take to our meeting points (or when a taxi was in order). The location near the Termini station was excellent, yet the hotel is very quiet since it is on a small one-way side street. We hope that we will have the opportunity to come back to Rome soon, and would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: barbara_lehany
Reviews.Content: the staff and hotel was the best we had stayed in location was great easy access to all transport. rooms not huge but dont expect them to be, both rooms were spotless and we would certainly stop there again

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value”
Reviews.Author: jojsz
Reviews.Content: For travelers this hotel is a good pick. A few minutes walk from Rome Termini + the subway station, clean, spacious room and bathroom, nice staff and great breakfast for acceptable price.

Reviews.Title: “Professional in every way - a real gem”
Reviews.Author: rocket17
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in December 2010. Staff was friendly , helpful and professional in every way From the manager down , they made you feel appreciated in very way . When we returned for one more night at the end of touring Italy, knowing that we would be at this hote, was a well needed relief. Hotel was a little hard to find at first but when we did we realized how central the location . Even with many pieces of luggage, it was a very short walk to the the main train station and metro. I am a travel agent and we travel a lot thru out the world and have seen it all . This hotel is one of the best for service and a caring attitude. Tip - be very aware of pick - pockets in Rome . Despite precautions , we had our wallet stolen on the metro and lost 400 euro , credit cards and they wiped out our bank account for another $2,000 . Despite this , returning to the Hotel Diocleziano every night was like coming home . Thank you for our enjoyale stay.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't wished for more”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiyZ
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the location. it's 5 min walk from Termini station so train to airport, busses, metro are all there. If you are in Rome for sightseeing you would find it very convenient to get to all the major spots. Hotel is nice and clean and has a good value for money. The only thing we wished for is a bit variety at breakfast - after staying here for a week it became a bit boring.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience for a long time”
Reviews.Author: b_vinel
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying 6 nights at Diocleziano hotel in Decembre. The rooms are really comfortable. The price is competitive. The staff is very friendly and efficient. The breakfast was excellent. Free wifi connexion and free soft drinks in the room a plus. The location next to the Termini station is very convenient. Definitively will return at this hotel next time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Best Rome Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: edyl
Reviews.Content: The service and hospitability was exceptional. Valentino and the other members of staff were extremely helpful, informative, and generous in recommending places of interest and making us feel comfortable. Everything is prompt and with a smile. It shows that the personnel really enjoys working there. A great value for the price...with free breakfast included, very comfortable rooms, wi-fi, English newspapers, free mini bar, tea & coffee facilities, gym and sauna etc. This would be my first choice next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice small hotel”
Reviews.Author: phgarbis
Reviews.Content: Very nice, warm, small hotel. People working here are very anxious and interested in our needs.I would like to thank all of them. Excellent condition of building. Be prepared of a little bit walking to visit monuments and main sights of Rome .Otherwise take the metro or even a taxi which is not that expensive.Unfortunatelly too many rain showers in Rome at mid of November.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem indeed!”
Reviews.Author: slaandfrances
Reviews.Content: What a discovery this small hotel is – perfectly situated for visiting within Rome and traveling around. Tucked into a quiet side street very close to the main railways station, Termini, and subway and bus stops, and check-by-jowl with the ruins of the Baths of Diocleziano, this delightful hotel is just steps from everything! The hotel is cozy, very clean and comfortable; size of the room and bathroom was very decent (for Europe); a buffet breakfast offered tasty and fresh food for every taste; free Internet and free soft drinks in the mini bar were pleasant surprises, etc. Manager Ana is both professional and charming and expects the same of her delightful and helpful staff. Btw, a laundry and a supermarket are just round the corner. Also, there are several restaurants around, and we recommend the closest, La Famiglia, a neighborhood restaurant packed with local people, where nobody tried to overcharge us, where vino di casa was cheap but not bad, and where food was well priced and really good, from great pizza to locally raised lamb.... I think we found our place in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Little gem in Rome”
Reviews.Author: DMurphy13
Reviews.Content: This is a little hotel in the centre of Rome. It was the ideal location for sightseeing close to the main transport connections and many of the sights are within walking distance for the energetic. The staff were wonderful and couldn't do enough for us, they even did things without being asked having worked out our pattern. The rooms though not the biggest were clean and well maintained. The breakfast was good and plentyful with friendly helpful servers. There are also lots of local restaurants within short walking distance. If you are getting a taxi from the airport though make sure you have a map with you as our driver had some challenges in finding the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Diocleziano,relaxing hotel to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: bpbiff
Reviews.Content: Service excellent , especially all the female staff/cleaning breakfast staff brilliant nothing too much trouble, all the staff made the hotel feel warm and out of the ordinary .The breakfasts,were much better than we expected, they were great value, fresh orange juice, good coffee.Room spotless,bathroom also. Our first trip to Rome - it was monsoon weather all our stay, so getting back to a great hotel and spending every evening in the room ,we didn't want to go out in the evening rain and cold, so what more can we say great value for money, loved it! 10/10

Reviews.Title: “Great trip started with a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: asuharsono
Reviews.Content: We were picked up at the airport by the limo service that we requested when we booked the hotel. When we arrived, Giordano, the hotel staff helped us and explined things about the charges, the free stuffs and the surounding areas. Giordano and the rest of the staff were excellent, always smile and greet us coming and going. The breakfast was excellent, the room was great and spacious, free wifi was a plus. I would love to go back and stay there again - the location is just perfect. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Rome I have ever been”
Reviews.Author: Spina24
Reviews.Content: My colleagues and me booked this hotel because it's very close by the Termini Station. We experienced very friendly staff of the hotel during the whole stay. We liked the rooms. Very clean and comfortable. The breakfast is nice too. The Internet is free. The hotel is situated very close by the Termini Station and Metr. There is just walking distance to Via Nazionale. it takes only half an hour walking to get to for example to Fontana di Trevi or Piazza Spagna... We liked the best the comfort, cleanliness, friendly staff and the location of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small but beautifully formed hotel, with a service 'out of this world!'”
Reviews.Author: KatrinaVM
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in some grand hotels before, we went on trip advisors scoring when booking this hotel. Compared to others it does not have a grand entrance - in fact unless you knew you were going to this hotel you could walk straight pass it. Once inside, you experience the 'Diocleziano ' experience - Exceptionally clean, sparkling in every way including the breakfast, gym, the service and welcome you recieve. In particular receptionist Valentino was superb. Nothing was too much trouble. His suggestions included Resturants, where to buy Handbags and where & when to visit places. He should recieve a big pay rise as he is such a credit to the Hotel. The gym was clean and had a variety of machines and free weights. The breakfast room was kept clean and replenished by the two ladies who worked in it. The breakfast had everything you would expect and more. The bar prices were not cheap but that is normal. The bedrooms were clean and functional with limited TV channels in english - but being tourists we did not need to watch TV. The bathroom was lovely and had shower gel & shampoo on offer - no conditioner though - something they should offer.... The bedrooms were small in size and had only side cabinets with drawers - clothes had to be stored in the wardrobes. To finalise - if you are looking for a central location, in quiet area with good resturants nearby and want the service of a four star hotel without any of the pomp and circumstance BUT with elegant style -THIS IS THE HOEL FOR YOU! Well done Hotel Diocleziano - all should experience the Hotel Diocleziano experience!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique Hotel -we felt like family”
Reviews.Author: Antlau
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Rome. We stayed at this boutique hotel for 6 nights. My spouse and I travelled with our 2 children and a friend (3 teenagers) and the grandmother.We had booked 3 rooms. From the very first minute we stepped into the hotel lobby we were treated like family. Special thanks to Valentino and Giordano at the front desk. They were more than helpful and provided us with thoughtful tips, suggestions and recommendations . The breakfast buffet was excellent. The rooms were very clean and spacious by European standard. We would have no hesitation whatsoever in returning there and recommending this hotel to family and friends. Finally we would also recommend Babbos restaurant just around the corner. Friendly staff and excellent food. We ate there twice ! Also try the mom and pop snack bar called - Fantasy Pizza just a minute away. They make a mean Pizza.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations.”
Reviews.Author: prc78
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was a lot better than we expected. The staff were extremely helpful with any questions we had regarding places to visit, directions, where to eat, tours to take. Room was very clean and tidy, however we could hear everything outside of the door in hallway. eg. people leaving/entering their rooms. Our expectations were low going to Europe, but I would recomend this Hotel to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Good Times”
Reviews.Author: SandK1350
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in Rome. The hotel staff were wonderful, hospitable, warm and very helpful. The hotel and room was very clean. Breakfast was delicious. The location in a quite street with termini station only a few minutes away. All in all we had a great time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and friendly staff, great location.”
Reviews.Author: SLEMONS
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights at hotel. Staff very helpful and friendly and gave good advice on places to visit and on how to get there. Room very spacious and mini bar provided soft drinks without any additional cost. Hotel situated down a side street so no noise from traffic. Great location - less than 5 minute walk from main underground station. If you like a walk through the city it only took about 20 minute stroll to the to the main sights such as Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and Pantheon. Breakfast was lovely with a great variety of cerels, fruit and hot and cold selections. In the evening there was a great place to eat around the corner - 'Babbos', reasonably priced serving great Italian food of pasta and pizza dishes.

Reviews.Title: “It was fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Franky030
Reviews.Content: It was my second time in Rome and the first for my husband. Rome is the city which you want to visit again and again. And every time you open something new and exciting. We would come again and would stay at Diocleziano. I think that our stay there was a plus to this wonderful trip. Thank you for your hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Everything everyone says it is”
Reviews.Author: cassidymatt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful and the location was perfect. We spent considerable time on TripAdvisor researching the best hotels to stay at and of course we heard so much about this place and had to give it a try. Staff were terrific friendly and helpful, especially Valentino - nothing too much trouble for him. We are not just another guest checking in or out, and they actually remember our faces. Every time we walked in and out of the front door, we were greeted with "welcome back" or "have a great day!" Perfect hotel, perfect staff thoroughly deserves its rating. Ps there is also a small Fitness area, 2 treadmills plus weights etc. We hope to return very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great start to trip”
Reviews.Author: jhnhearn
Reviews.Content: Our Italian trip began w/3 nights here & the staff,breakfast & room were great. We had a knock on the door & there was a waiter with a bottle of Champagne for my wifes birthday. We figured out that they got the date from our passport. Great touch to a fine hotel & staff!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, great staff, highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: tamsinjames
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have asked for more from this hotel. A 5 min walk from Rome's Termini main train station. I shared a twin room with my mum. Our window overlooked a courtyard tucked away from the main roads so the room was lovely and quiet. Air conditioning was great and still required in November! It was great value for money with a fab buffet breakfast included in the price and a great selection of food. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The room wasn't huge but we had everything we needed and tea/coffee making facilities were included. Plus free soft drinks from the mini bar! What more could you want? Was fab to have somewhere comfortable, clean and welcoming to come back to after long days of sightseeing. I plan to stay here again on my next visit to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel, great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: SandKinVA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in November 2010. We found the hotel to be everything that we wanted in a 4-star establishment, and would recommend it to friends and stay there again. The staff was very helpful and the rooms we're impeccable. We enjoyed the breakfast each morning before heading out to a day of sightseeing. We have only good things to say about the Hotel Diocleziano.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: waterman
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Hotel Diocleziano, near Termini station and enjoyed a very welcoming and pleasant stay. Chose the hotel on recommendatons from this site and its proximity to Termini as we had decided to use the Leonardo Express from the airport. Everyhing went like clockwork and although its not the greatest area, it was very convenient to walk to all the major sites, we managed to cover pretty much everything in two and a half days. The room was very comfortable and its in a great quiet location, you will appreciate this when you encounter the Rome traffic which I can only describe as interesting!! Great stay throughly enjoyable, the The Familia, restaurant around the corner was very nice and affordable if you had a long day sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel and staff probably the best ever encountered!”
Reviews.Author: BOBLiverpoolEngland
Reviews.Content: It probably wouldnt be possible for the staff in this hotel to be more courteous or helpful. From the moment we arrived our luggage was taken care of, Simona and other reception staff happy to assist with any query with a smile from providing extra pillows to trying to sort out a problem we had with internet access (which is free at the moment by the way!), dining room staff extremely pleasant and efficient. Rooms cleaned without fault, in fact the whole hotel is spotless. The hotel is an absolute credit to the staff who work there and they should be very proud of the service they are providing. The hotel is about five minutes walk from the Termini station and about 15-20 minutes from the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain, whilst this was not a problem for myself and my partner as the quality of the hotel was so good, it may be an issue for people wanting to be in the thick of it. We pre booked an open top tour bus which was excellent but watch the route changes on a Saturday and Sunday as they can be confusing! Although we did our sightseeing independently if I was to return I would probably use a guide for the Roman Forum as it got a bit confusing for us! We had however left this till the last day and were perhaps therefore in a bit of a rush, which is not the best way to visit such an amazing place. If you like Pizza I would recommend Dar Poeta in Trastevere for quality and value this is exceptional, It is tucked away in a little street but well worth seeking out.

Reviews.Title: “Compact Comfort”
Reviews.Author: Celtic_Owl
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights at this hotel during October. The hotel is on a quiet side street and well located for the main tourist sites. It's within 5-10 minutes walk from the Termini station and Plaza de republica leading to the busy shopping streets of Via Nazionale and Via Cavour. The hotel is extremely clean and serves an excellent buffett breakfast in the morning. However it is very compact with the smallest lift I've ever seen in a hotel of this quality. It has a small bar area which is a bit hit and miss for service. For two succesive nights there was no ice, light bar snacks are advertised but when I asked about this the reply was 'I can make you some toast'. The staff are friendly, helpful and all speak english. The bedrooms are cleaned daily and towels also changed daily.There is free internet access and free italian daily newspapers. Overall a clean comfortabe and efficiently run hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - very clean and modern”
Reviews.Author: VikkiMak
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very close to Termini train station and easy reach to main attractions. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful and made some good restaurant recommendations. My husband and I both commented on how clean to hotel was, perhaps the cleanest we've ever stayed at it was absolutely spotless (and this is very important to us!) We spent a long time researching hotels in Rome and we were delighted with our final choice - would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply confortable”
Reviews.Author: eddy71
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with my wife during September for 3 nights while attending a congress. i picked it because of the positive revews on trip advisor and i was not disappointed. the hotel is well located 200 m away fromTermini station and from Piazza Republica, however it was quiet enough for a good night sleep. the rooms were rather small but i guess they were commensurate with the standards for European room sizes. they were clean and the bathrooms well rennovated. The breakfast was nice, nothing out of the ordinary but well done and the food was tasty, the atmosphere was warm. we had booked pick up from airport through the hotel and it was perfect, no issues there. the most wonderful thing about this hotel other than the typical Italian atmosphere is the quality of the staff. they all went out of their way to help you, special regards to Anna and Simona, they were very nice. The complimentary free internet is a nice plus as well as the soda filled minibar. The only minor remark i have is regarding the view, it was inexistant, but that's OK because we didn't stay much in the room. In general i highly recommend this hotel and would stay there again if in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: the_savman
Reviews.Content: Nice small hotel in a good location for exploring Rome. The Termini station is very close which has you well connected for wherever you need to get to. The rooms are small but clean. The bed was not comfortable unfortunately, akin to sleeping on concrete and we couldn't seem to get a good night sleep during our stay. The breakfast is excellent, everything you could need both hot and cold and the staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The in-room wifi is pretty poor and comes and goes with a weak signal, to be fair to the hotel they did take the issue seriously and it did improve a little. The lift to the higher floors is tiny and was out of service twice during our stay, so having to negotiate multiple stairs is a possibility if this occurs, perhaps something to consider for some travellers. All in all we had a very nice stay at the Diocleziano and would recommend it of course, I'm not so sure I would classify it as a "four star hotel" but perhaps the standard in Italy differs to what one might expect. We have stayed in 3 star hotels that were just as good and nowhere near as pricey, but let that take nothing away from this hotel which does a fine job for a short City break. The main plus is the proximity to the bus and train station so you can venture off sightseeing which is the main thing in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “When we return to Rome, we will stay at Hotel Diocleziano.”
Reviews.Author: 12junebug
Reviews.Content: The location, the room, and the breakfast was great. However, the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff were far beyond our expectations and this is what sets the Hotel Diocleziano above others.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Base..................”
Reviews.Author: ralstonranger
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed an excellent 4 night stay 8th-12th October. Had some trouble finding hotel from Termini when we first arrived. Easy to locate when we found out where we were going. Cooked breakfast is basic, dont expect a full English fry up. Most of the reception staff are pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel covers all requirements for an excellent base in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Margaret186
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel ideal for all of our requirements as an excellent base in Rome. The staff were always welcoming, helpful and cheerful. The standard of fittings and furnishings is high and they have tried to cover every requirement. The hotel bar is very reasonably priced and free soft drinks are provided in the mini bar. The buffet breakfast was good with fresh fruit available each day. The location is within walking distance of many interesting places. The station is not far away and from there we took the Metro to other sites in Rome and beyond. This hotel suited our needs very well and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: wbeitz
Reviews.Content: Wonderful four day stay in the excellently located hotel (walking distance to train station). Fresh variety of breakfast items. I real gem of a hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: edinburghlover
Reviews.Content: On a brief visit to Rome in late September I stopped by at the Hotel Diocleziano, a hidden little 4-star gem tucked away behind the train station in Rome. Calm, professionnel, the particularly friendly receptionist Simona, showed me around. Loved the spacious room and impeccably clean bathroom. Highly recommended. They even had a tea tray, which pleases the Brit in me.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and good!”
Reviews.Author: Grrl1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night and the room was very clean and the bathroom renovated and very nice. I especially liked the free mini-bar and the free internet. The front desk were kind enough to print my boarding passes without any complaints and booked a cab for me to go to the airport in the morning. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: jenny068_9
Reviews.Content: Small, very well appointed Hotel in a quiet street just of the main Station. Room was spacious enough, extremely clean and comfortable. Staff is wonderful, very helpful and knowledgeable . Breakfast was plentiful and always served with a smile. Hotel Diocleziano is the place to be when you are in Rome! Just perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Superior service”
Reviews.Author: NewYorker03
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in the VIP room which is a junior suite on the penthouse level (room 501). Throughout our stay, we encountered consistently superior service. From Termini station, the hotel is about a 5 minute walk to one of the smaller streets in the area -- Via Gaeta -- which actually has 2 other hotels on each side of Hotel Diocleziano. Since this is the main bus hub, there is a lot of traffic to navigate, but it became a simple, quick jaunt for us after one day. (Since the hotel is north of Termini station, we didn't find the location to be problematic and we felt comfortable walking to & from at night, 9pm-10pm.) During check-in, the front desk gives you a map without asking and writes down what transportation options are available to get to the major sights in the city. The hotel elevator can comfortably can fit 3 adults with accompanying luggage. To get to the penthouse suite, the elevator stops at the 4th floor and you take a short flight of stairs directly to the room door. The junior suite is not large, but can work for 3 adults like we were. In the immediate first room which is a small area that connects with the terrace and bathroom, there's a bed (daybed twin size) that can fit someone who is not bigger than let's say 5'8''. The bedroom is more spacious and there's a king bed (2 twins together). Closet space was adequate, though we could have used more space for 3 adults (unfortunately the first room with the daybed has no closet space). The TV is a small 20 inch in the bedroom with various international channels, though we didn't use it heavily. Underneath the TV is a little refridgerator that is stocked with complimentary drinks. We used it everyday when we headed out and it was restocked everyday. The bathroom does give you plenty of room with shelf space and I was greatly relieved to get a true bathtub. The bonus in the package is the terrace with an umbrella table that seats four. Bun and her cousin took coffee out there one afternoon. It was a pleasure to enjoy some fresh air. The view from the terrace looks towards the Terme and we could peope-watch tourists milling around below. Breakfast was complimentary throughout the stay and the girls ate heartily -- the selection was fantastic. The ground floor of the hotel is definitely 4-star quality: to the right of the check-in desk is a bar with plenty of seating, then the breakfast room is a large space that can pretty much hold every guest in the hotel if they decided to eat at the same time; to the left of the check-in desk is a library with comfortable couches and a large flat screen TV, then there's an area with 3 computers for guest use and then there's a gym for light exercise. The free WiFI service signal was strong in our room. The staff were always friendly. I had to check-out at 5am to catch a flight and the front desk person kindly and quickly put together a breakfast bag for me without my asking. It was a pleasing touch of service emblematic of this hotel after a fantastic 4 days at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly hotel - excellent value”
Reviews.Author: ghos
Reviews.Content: Reviews are true. We stayed in a superior room with terrace for 2 days at the start of our trip to Italy. Concierge gave great dinner recommendations in the vicinity. 5 minute walk from Termini (be sure you walk on east side of the piazza as you walk out of the train station). Breakfast was generous and free snacks and drinks were a great plus. Terrace was beautiful. The room had a kettle and you can make your own tea/coffee. Internet was free. All in all, great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “To the Rescue”
Reviews.Author: Joheark
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome & found out that the hotel we had booked had overbooked. They sent us to the Hotel Diocleziano for a night & it was lovely. The staff were very helpful & friendly & the breakfast was one of the best we had in Italy. The room we were given was very small but that was our only dissatisfaction. The hotel is very conveniently placed & we found a great Eritrean restaurant nearby.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel with exceptional staff, slightly let down by its location.”
Reviews.Author: AndrewPate
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the VIP Junior suite for 10 days, and so got to know the hotel and the area quite well. The patio of the suite is well worth the extra money, though you might not think so in poorer weather. The quality of the facilities was excellent, and the staff were exceptional in their attention to detail and their willingness to help in any way and at any time. They were unfailingly cheerful, from the moment the door was opened to us on our arrival to the moment our bags went into the car at the end. The neighbourhood is excellent for transport connections, for historic sites and eating places, but a little on the seedy side. Do try La Famiglia for the quality of its food and the sheer buzz of people enjoying themselves looked after by a very efficient, if sometimes unpredictable team. The hotel is small enough to feel friendly whilst having the facilities you would expect of a larger establishment. We would have no hesitation in recommending it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: hoochga
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Diocleziano for 5 nights based on TripAdvisor reviews and we couldn't have been more pleased. The hotel was in a great location, tucked on a quiet side street, steps from the terminal and walking distance to all of the places we wanted to visit. The room was modern, clean, and a perfect size for the two of us. I can not say enough about the incredible hotel staff (especially Valentino and Giordano). They went above and beyond to ensure we had a wonderful trip. I would recommend Hotel Diocleziano and without a doubt stay there again if we're lucky enough to go back to Rome in future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and customer service”
Reviews.Author: timodeoro
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night while seeing Rome. The hotel is just a 5 minute walk from the Termini Train/Bus station which is really nice. The room was very clean and comfortable. Hotel rooms in Rome are small, and I thought our room was good sized when comparing to others we've stayed in. The best part for me was the customer service. We needed to get up early to catch a flight. The hostess offered to prepare us a boxed breakfast to go, since we were going to have to leave before they had breakfast ready. She then made sure that the car service would be there on time to pick us up, and offered to make us dinner reservations at a local restaurant (Babbo's) that would have good food and service. It was so nice, and she even had them decorate the table with flowers for us, as my wife and I wanted to make it a romantic evening. Next time we go to Rome the Hotel Diocleziano will have our business.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: freddu98
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here 2 nights with our friend and we had a wonderful stay from beginning to end. The hotel is conveniently located 3 blocks from Termini station in a quiet dead end street. It is modern, clean and has great central air. Also, the staff is superb. As soon as we got there, we were greeted by the bell hop who immediately took care of our luggage with such enthusiasm and care while we checked in. The concierge were already aware of our reservation and were extremely helpful and attended to our every need, including packing a breakfast for us the day we checked out because we left very early in the morning and offering us free refreshments before we moved up to our room. The rooms are small for American standards but typical for Europe and are clean, quiet, and modern. Yes, the elevator is very small (can only fit 3-5 people max) but we didn't find this to be a problem and it seems to be commonplace in Europe. The minibar is complimentary and restocked daily which was such a nice perk! You can use the wireless for free or go downstairs to the computers and use the internet there for free. If you need to go to the airport, they arrange a Mercedes Benz (their private car service) to take you there for 48 Euros (vs. taxi is 40 Euros plus 7 Euros before 7 AM). We have absolutely nothing bad to say about this hotel and would definitely stay here again. We highly recommend this place to others.

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Choice in Roma!”
Reviews.Author: hnymnr68
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Diocleziano was a perfect location for our 24 hour stay in Rome. We took the Leonardo Express from FCO airport straight to the Termini Station. If you walk out front of the station, you are just 4-5 minutes walk to the hotel...much cheaper than taking a taxi or private car to the hotel. In the short time we were there, we were able to easily walk from the hotel to places like the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Colleseum, Pantheon (all about 20-30 minutes depending on your walking speed), Trastevere, etc. We even hopped the metro a few times when we tired of walking. We walked back from the Trevi Fountain area at midnight and never felt unsafe in any way. The hotel is definitely a solid 4 star. You'll find it tucked into one of the side streets, away from the noisy traffic of the Termini area. When we arrived to the hotel, we were upgraded to the top floor suite - a nice surprise. From check-in to breakfast, to check-out, the staff at the hotel were wonderful. The European breakfast was plentiful and delicious - a bonus was that we were able to get cappucinos at no extra charge. They even stored our bags for us while we ran around Rome until our ride came at 2 p.m. You don't need to hesitate booking the Hotel Diocleziano. The money you save over staying at the hotels closer to the sights is definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure you can beat the total value”
Reviews.Author: mdh95070
Reviews.Content: No surprises. Which is very good. The front desk was outstanding... The rooms were clean... The breakfast staff was cheerful... Very close to the the high speed trains and subway. Highly recommend La Lampada restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, good location, wonderful friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MumsieDevonUK
Reviews.Content: We only spent our last night here before returning to the UK but were greeted by surely the most welcoming staff in Rome. Bedroom was excellent as was breakfast. The bar is basic. The hotel is good for termini, buses and metro-we would have liked to stay for longer

Reviews.Title: “You won't find a quieter hotel in Central Rome”
Reviews.Author: bunterWicklow
Reviews.Content: This was our second time to stay here. It is excellent. Staff very friendly and helpful. Quality rooms with nice touches like tea and coffee making facilities, free soft drinks in minibar. There is also free internet access. Breakfast is decent. Although only a stones throw from Rome's main railway station it isin an exceptionally quiet location. This is a thoroughly nice experience

Reviews.Title: “Will be back!”
Reviews.Author: jlyttle
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after trawling through trip advisor to pick the perfect hotel for our budget and seeing the great reviews on here! First, the hotel was easy to find on leaving Termini station and the staff were more than welcoming on first arrival (later in the evening), and very friendly. We were shown around our room and told how to use everything (safe, TV, Air Con...) (we were staying in the standard double) which was more than spacious for our needs. We were given our username and password for the free wifi in the hotel - we didn't use this as we don't bring things like laptops or our blackberries on holiday, we want away from the world of work!!! The bathroom was big (bigger than our one at home! But then everything is relative) and sparkling clean. The bed was large and comfortable (two singles pushed together - but the single beds were a good size, not tiny like you sometimes find in hotels). Air conditioning worked very well - to the point we were cold if it was was on 'full blast' - a welcome relief though coming in from the humid heat of August in Rome. The mini-bar is FREE! They give you 2 bottles of water (1 still and 1 sparkling), a can of Coke, a can of Fanta and a carton of juice everyday. This was brilliant - as each morning we took out a bottle of water each and were able to simply refill it at the numerous drinking fountains around Rome for the rest of the day - no need to fork out 2 euros a bottle each time from street vendors. And the water from the fountains is freezing cold! Even in August :) The windows are sound proof - there was some building work going on nearby during the day, and if we were having an afternoon kip (recommended if you are in Rome during August - we did most of our walking in morning and evening) you could not hear a thing with the windows closed. Silent nights every night :) Breakfast in the morning was more than enough to keep us going until dinner time, bar a sneaky gelato in the afternoon ;) There was a wide selection of bread, pastries, cheese, fruit, meat (including boiled eggs), yoghurts, cereals and a small selection of hot food (eggs, sausages etc). Ask one of the lovely, friendly breakfast staff if you want coffee other than Americano and they will make it for you :) The food was constantly replenished, so whether we were down for 8am or 9.30am there was always a full selection available. As for the area, you really are only near the front of Termini and you can avoid the darker streets of that infamous area by simply not going near the actual station and beyond at night. We always felt perfectly safe walking around during both the day and at night. We loved sitting out at the fountain at Piazza della Repubblica (2 mins from the hotel) in the late evening, watching the cars goes by :) On the day we checked out we were able to leave our suitcases at the hotel until the late afternoon before we caught our evening flight - on picking up our suitcases we were offered a towel and the use of the gym shower facilities (which looked very nice - wish I had investigated them during our stay but we had no time) to freshen up before our flights. I want to thank all the staff - the front desk, porters, breakfast staff and cleaning staff for being helpful, friendly and for making our trip the best holiday we've had :D

Reviews.Title: “Star quality staff”
Reviews.Author: HenryXKnight
Reviews.Content: Friendly and attentive front office staff, clean rooms, nice big bed, great shower, very good AC, conveniently located near to Termini and Republicca for bus and train for short journeys to Colosseum, Vatican and Villa Borghese. Within easy walk of shops, restaurants and opera house in Nazionale. Fantastic brekkie as well to start each day.

Reviews.Title: “Great plave”
Reviews.Author: bts_going
Reviews.Content: Great place. Location near the train station is good for getting around but not much culture in the area. Good size room by European standards. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel very near Termini station”
Reviews.Author: keekeeM
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 1 night in this hotel before boarding a cruise ship in Civitavecchia. We chose this hotel because it was very close to the Termini train station and we were only staying one night in Rome. It was very close to two metro stops and walkable to many sites. It is right next to Santa Maria della Angeli. It is very close to the metro--we walked there easily with two bags and two rolling suitcases. We arrived around noon, and were happy to find the room was ready and they let us check in--we really needed to take a long nap after being jet lagged. The room was rather small, but not unbearably so. The bathroom was also rather small, but we had a huge jacuzzi tub and shower that took up most of the space. The staff was very friendly and accommodating, and gave us directions and a map of Rome. There are not a lot of restaurants near this hotel (and most towards Termini are "touristy"), so we did find we had to walk around a bit at night to find a nice place (which we did, a few blocks over). there was also complimentary breakfast the next morning--it was average, nothing special. We at some yogurt and croissant, and quickly left to find a good espresso at a cafe. This was an affordable hotel that satisfied our needs for one night in Rome very close to Termini. If you are looking for something with a bit of nightlife, more restaurants, or close to ancient sites, or you have more time to stay in Rome, this might not be the location for you. But if you are looking for a comfortable, easy stay with friendly staff, and near Termini, this hotel was a good find.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service, not a great location”
Reviews.Author: OC_Adventurer
Reviews.Content: This is a very small hotel but the service of the front desk staff is what sets it apart. The service was 1st class. The location - not walking distance to much of anything but still in the city. The neighborhood is fine w/ a few restaurant options. The bad: wifi was shut out a few times due to too many users on the system; i am 6'1" and my feet hung off the end of the bed

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and great service!”
Reviews.Author: ine_stijns
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly and did all the possible to make our stay at the hotel a success. The hotel is perfectly located nearby Termini.perfect. Hotel and room were kept very well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Warren63
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the recomendations of reviews on Trip Advisor and so glad we did as what a lovely quiet hotel only minutes walk from the train termini station. The rooms were lovely, clean & comfortable, the staff wre extremely helpful and friendly. Plenty of choice for breakfast. A great place to stay and explore Rome with attractions only 20 mins walk such as the Colliseum & Trevi fountain. Would definately recommend to family & friends. Thank you for a lovely stay in Rome & for marking the map with the all the sites that must be seen.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Comfort in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Tannedoz
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on a stopover , we chose the hotel because it was in walking distance to the Termini Train staion. We arrived early after diembarking from a cruise and catching the train from te port, our room was ready and we got room 1 which is set up as a diabled room , we had a private terrace and a massive bathroom with shower cubicle. The room also had tea and coffee making facilities which is rare in Rome. The room was very clean and quiet and the staff were fantastic supplying details of places to visit, directions and reccommending a restaurant for dinner ( BABBOS just around the corner was fantastic)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice (four star) small hotel”
Reviews.Author: ochibell
Reviews.Content: We chose Hotel Diocleziano after reading many reviews and noting its high popularity rating on TripAdvisor. We were very pleased, and I echo many of the other sentiments expressed in other reviews: good A/C (not to be taken for granted in Rome in August); very helpful and accommodating staff; clean, decent-sized rooms with natural light; free wifi; fitness center; free drinks in the minibar; and hearty buffet breakfast. We had two rooms: a regular double room, and a "twin" room for our kids (their room, with two single beds, was actually slightly larger and had the benefit of a real window in the bathroom). Regarding location, I disagree with those who say this is a "bad" location. Admittedly it is not in the center of town, but given the hordes of tourists who invade Rome during the summer, we actually liked being slightly outside the main "sightseeing" areas. The hotel is on a quiet street off the main drag, and we found with the combination of subway and buses available at the nearby Termini station, it was extremely easy to get anywhere we wanted to go - and for all the "main" touristy areas (Trastevere, Vatican, Piazza Navona, ancient Rome) it was never more than a 15-20 minute trip. Our only disappointment about this particular neighborhood was that there wasn't as much of a concentration of good restaurants as some of the other neighborhoods, so we did travel to eat each night. However, we thought Hotel Diocleziano more than made up for that through its other features and benefits. We enjoyed our stay at this hotel very much.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: CgyTraveller_10
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at the Hotel Diocleziano after coming in by train then had to fly out the next day. Very, very clean, good size room for Rome, spot less bathroom, great buffet breakfast and very friendly and helpful front desk. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a hotel near the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Bad Location”
Reviews.Author: liswal
Reviews.Content: Overall I thought the hotel was nice - good amenities (free internet, drinks in bar included, air conditioning, free breakfast). Also the hotel itself was clean and service good - however, we had 3 nights in Rome and the location of the hotel wasn't ideal. If you are anxious about being close to the train station - not a bad choice. However, ideally I would suggest staying closer to the main sights near the Campo Di Fiori.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and location”
Reviews.Author: kordvan
Reviews.Content: Quiet hotel in the city center near the transportation hub. Very helpfull staff. The rooms were clean. The breakfast included was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: TomH_Ghent
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem. Very helpfull staff. Great airco, controlable per room that gave us a chill out place (outside was 40°C). But above all: 100m from the termini station and very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Quick hit to Rome via train”
Reviews.Author: kenny000
Reviews.Content: Excellent service and location. Only a couple of blocks from Roma Termini train station, so very convenient. Staff allowed us to store luggage prior to check-in and after check-out. Staff is very accommodating, helped arrange a local bus tour. Included breakfast was superb with everything you can imagine including fresh squeezed OJ, although the breakfast room was a little warm. Rooms were very comfortable and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel-Good Service”
Reviews.Author: Jorget7
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a good location, close to the train terminal with a very good service and very good staff, ask for Valentino in the front desk and he will help you with all yours inquiries. Small hotel (35 rooms) but with all de services you want, free internet, sauna, gym, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful rooms, GREAT staff”
Reviews.Author: c2traveler128
Reviews.Content: My family and I were very impressed by this hotel especially the service! When we arrived we found out that the website we booked the rooms through had cancelled our reservations without us knowing. The staff was SO helpful and did everything they could to make sure we were still able to stay there. The rooms were clean and large. The breakfast included was great. Also the location is close to the metro that takes you to any popular tourist spot you'll want to see.

Reviews.Title: “Your Hotel search is over.”
Reviews.Author: Desertstormvet
Reviews.Content: Two New Yorkers, My wife and I stay at Hotel Diocleziano in Rome for 7nights last week. Great Location, near Termini St. It gives you great public trans options. Hotel D, is clean, modern, great staff, excellent breakfast (eggs, bacon,cappucino,etc),and safe. Many say Termini st area is so-so... Not true..Trust me its hard trying to pick a place to stay..But this Hotel is a true SOLID choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: annase
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, very good location. Very, very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: presse111
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel July 2010 they were very helpful and the rooms were nice and clean . Our bathroom was huge our room size was moderate. They let us check in early as it was a long flight so was much appreciated. It is close to the main station (terme )so very easy to get anywhere. We can thoroughly recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - staff and location excellent”
Reviews.Author: massiebm
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with this hotel. Stayed for 5 nights and were very impressed. Staff were excellent, they gave us lots of information on what to see and do when we checked in. Room is as expected for large city but the free mini bar which was a welcome touch. This hotel is so much better than similar priced hotels in any city.

Reviews.Title: “Congratulations”
Reviews.Author: imeira
Reviews.Content: to all staff of this excellent hotel. Nice acommodations and very kind people always available to give you the best support for whatever you need.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel if you need to be near Termini train station”
Reviews.Author: ketel_always
Reviews.Content: We had an evening and a day in Rome before flying home after 5 days in Tuscany. We arrived at the Termini station and it was nice to walk only 5 minutes the hotel instead of cramming into a cab. We chose the hotel because we needed to be near the train to the airport for our early morning flight home. If that's what you need, then a stay here would be a success. Everything was as advertised, good clean room, nice size, good AC, good bathroom and a very good breakfast. It was a really good value in my view considering the free drinks and breakfast. If you want to be in the heart of things then you'd be surpried how far the walk is to the more interesting points. Metro is an option, but there was a strike and at any rate, we prefer to walk and explore. There was just too much walking through uninteresting commercial areas that were a bit rundown. Not totally unexpected because it is near a train station and it wasn't our key reason for choosing the hotel. However, if we had more than our brief stay there, I think I would have been disappointed. Ironically, they recommended an independent driver service to the airport that was only slightly more than 3 train tickets to the airport. So we really could have stayed more centrally if we had known about that service. The location makes it hard to give it the "very good" reccomendation it probably deserves.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, walking distance to Termini station!”
Reviews.Author: OMGitscokes
Reviews.Content: My mum and I had an amazing stay at this hotel. Was conveniently located to Termini station (we took the metro to all the tourist sites) in a quiet street away from the noise surrounding Termini. The room was small, what you would expect for Italy, and the bathroom was extremely clean. The staff were helpful and friendly - especially Simona. Breakfast was good, one of the best we've had in Italy out of all the other hotels we stayed in. Free drinks in the minibar along with a kettle in our room were much appreciated. All we did was fill our bottles in the numerous public fountains Rome has to offer...delicious water!! Would definitely stay at this hotel on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Agree with all the positive reviews ... but very firm beds”
Reviews.Author: jbhaber
Reviews.Content: I agree with the positive reviews here about the location, staff, cleanliness, etc. So rather than repeat everything already said, I'll just add that our bed was very, very firm. We tossed and turned all night because it was difficult to get comfortable. Our teenage sons reported the same thing in their room across the hall.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient to train station and metro”
Reviews.Author: Vivaldis
Reviews.Content: Traveling by train through Italy, we chose the Hotel Diocleziano due to its close proximity to Rome's train station (Termini) and easy access to the intersection of the two metro lines serving the city. We realize that the hotel is not close to most of the city's archeological attractions, but Rome is fairly spread out, and you would need to take public transportation regardless from anywhere, unless you were willing to walk a half-hour or so to your destination. We were also aware that this section of Rome was not considered as savory as others, but in our 4 days there, we never experienced a single problem, so don't let that stop you from choosing to stay near the station. The hotel was easy to find, and the room was very comfortable, providing all of the necessities as well as a large (enough for two) whirlpool tub to take away the day's aches and pains. A minimally stocked complimentary minibar was appreciated. The staff was helpful, although a bit formal for us. They provided good recommendations for local restaurants, as well as other services (banking, laundromat) in the neighborhood. The hotel requires you to leave the key with the front desk, whenever you leave the premises, which we found a bit odd for this modern age. We found that all of Rome's hotels were pricier than other Italian cities, and this one is no exception, hence the average value rating. It was not meant as a specific negative for the Hotel Diocleziano. All in all, a very acceptable place to stay if you want to have easy access to public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!!”
Reviews.Author: scientist03
Reviews.Content: the staff here are very friendly and helpful, nothing is too much trouble. The rooms are clean and tidy and the hotel is quiet. The hot tub bath and the shower in the superior rooms are worth it. It is very well located being only a few minutes walk from the Termini station and the Metro. The free drinks in the mini bar are great as is the free internet (useful when you want to check in for your flight online)

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again in a heartbeat!!!”
Reviews.Author: craigkatmads
Reviews.Content: Having been intrusted with organising the accomodation for my husband, myself and our seven year old daughter during our 5 night trip to Rome, I was nervous when we arrived, but my worries were shortly put to rest upon being met at the door to assist with our luggage and entering the Hotel. We were quickly and efficiently checked in, and ably assisted to the 5th floor VIP room which was a joy. By European standards, we considered it to be quite a decent size given that they were catering for three of us, and one of us was a child. A small alcove inside the front door had been amended to fit a small single bed, which was brilliant as this meant that Maddy could go to sleep at night without being overly distracted by us watching TV - the world cup on TV is the world cup no matter what language the commentators are speaking!!!. Our room was beautiful and the bed, while on the harder side, was till completely comfortable for aching bones at the end of a full day of sightseeing!!! We made full use of the complimentary breakfast, which was a wonderful spread, and the complimentary mini bar was handy for filling our bags with drinks to take sightseeing. All the staff, from the front desk, to the wonderfully polite ladies in the breakfast room, were wonderful, and did anything they could to assist with any enquiries that we had during our stay. I would definately recommend, and in fact already have raved to our travel agent about, the Hotel Diocleziano, and having such wonderful accomodation made our Stay in Rome that little bit more special!!!

Reviews.Title: “good place, nice people but not close to the center of the city”
Reviews.Author: ahoughton
Reviews.Content: don't get me wrong, we liked this place and there were six of us. and i booked it based largely by the reviews here. however, it is not particularly close to anything other than the central rome termini (not bad if you are moving around italy by rail). its a four start, which means no real lobby and generally small common rooms. bedrooms were small but fine. bathrooms are good. in hindsight, i would have preferred to be slightly closer to the action. we had to take a subway, bus or taxi basically everywhere we wanted to go. i will say that within the bustle of rome, its very quiet there.

Reviews.Title: “Peace & Relaxation at the end of each Very Busy Day”
Reviews.Author: DerekandNicola
Reviews.Content: My wife and i celebrated our 39+1 birthdays with a trip to europe for the first time in 15 years. Our nervousness in travelling to the metropolis of rome was extinguished upon finding our stay for 4 nights. We had trawled trip advisor to find a recommended hotel and we were not disappointed. Easy to find, only five mins from termini, yet a lovely quiet side street away from the noise. The room was simple but very clean with basic amneities including kettle. We had upgraded to the superior which was an added bonus with a lovely hydrobath/shower. The air con was fab and an absolute must after the temperatures outside. Breakfasts were really good with a full choice option to stay traditional or go continental. All the staff were very helpful and couldn't have been friendlier. At the end of each day's intense sight seeing it was a joy to return to the hotel - top marks to trip advisor reviews and the Hotel and its staff - thanks for helping make our 4 days so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommend!”
Reviews.Author: bigintangibles
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Diocleziano in Rome for four nights to attend a friend's wedding and would definitely recommend it. It was very well located, close to Termini station, and about a 20 minute walk to the Trevi fountain and slightly longer to the PIazza del Popolo. The rooms were not massive, but the location made it an easy trade-off. Hotel service was excellent, the reception staff were very helpful and friendly, and they really thought of everything -- from complimentary water and free wi-fi to electricity adapters, and also provided a handy map of central Rome when we arrived. There were Internet-enabled computers in the lobby area, breakfast was basic nice and a small gym was also available. The hotel, in general, was fantastically clean and we never felt like they skimped on any details. Overall, this hotel is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “I really want to recommend this place, but I can NOT – the bed is awful, terrible – a rock hard complete failure”
Reviews.Author: bquiet
Reviews.Content: VIP room (My Scale: failure – below average – average – above average – the best) About my point of view - 6ft, 270lbs Texan - who travels all the time and all over the world }Bottom Line – I really want to recommend this place, but I can NOT – the bed is awful, terrible – a rock hard complete failure for getting any sleep. }First Impression from the outside – [average] - it looks like the photos. Simple outside on a small street. The sign is hard to see as it is over 6ft up from the sidewalk level. (not sure why – they need to lower it) I checked google street view before we arrived – just remember “green shutters that are round on top”. }First Impressions of the lobby – [above average] - very nice, better than I expected from the pictures online. It is shallow in the front, with rooms going back on each side. Felt like a quality hotel once we stepped inside. }First Impressions of the room – [above average] - (keep in mind, we got upgraded to the VIP room, since we paid for a superior room). It is what I expected for a quality hotel in the city. Small space, but nice. (more on the bed/bathroom/extras below) The private patio that comes with the VIP room is well beyond expectations. You are thinking to yourself – oh some 2foot patio to barely stand on – not in this case – it is large – very large – 3 times the size of the room (yes really). But just for the VIP room – no other rooms have this. All the other items are there – safe, small tv, refrig, coffer maker. }Room – The Bathroom – [average] - medium sized but nice. What you would expect from this level of hotel. This VIP room has a whirlpool bath (we did not use that). The Shower/bath is one unit that takes up half the bathroom. Had a bidet. Note – there was not tissue/Kleenex in the bathroom (just a little travel size pack). Seemed odd at this level of hotel. Note – it is a long step down/over the whirlpool bath side – with not much to hold onto. }Room – The Bed – [failure] – this is unfortunately where this hotel falls down flat. The bed is the usual 2 twins pushed together. Ok fine – you will be used to this after some time in Europe. (and this was no problem at the hotels we stayed at in Paris and Florence). BUT THIS BED IS ROCK HARD. If you like to sleep on your side – your arm will be asleep (from lack of blood flow in a few minutes). The first night was very very disappointing. So we asked for options the next morning. I was offered one options, and they said they would make a change. They basically added a small top mattress (more like an outside bench seat pad). This was not much help – and it created 2 new problems. It was thinner than each side of the bed (so a small bed was now super small – less than twin). Also, this new mattress had a vinyl cover and they do not use a mattress pad (something to let the air move between you and the mattress). So while your front is cold from the AC, your back is sweating from lack of air flow. I did not sleep for 3 nights. (my wife complained as well) My neck/back was stiff/sore all day from this. For what you are paying – you expect the bed to be very comfortable – not perfect – but comfortable. }Noise – [average] – most hotels in Europe are noisy. We could here every foot step on the main stairs as people walked down past our floor. (not sure why they do not close the doors from the room hallways (which are small) to the stairs to cut the noise.) Noise from room to room was low/good. }Heat/Cool – [average] – it has the usual +/- dial control you see in europe. So you have to figure out where on the +/- dial you need to set it for day and night. It certainly can make the room cool at night. When the AC kicks on it does make some noise. }Service – Housekeeping – [above average] – they did a good job and did not miss anything. Never intruded. }Service – Front desk and Concierge – [average] – it was good and what I expected from a quality hotel. They are not easy fluent in English at all times at the desk, but you can manage. (hey – you are in Italy – and you don’t speak their language – so just relax) }Service – Food – [average] – we had the included breakfast – it was good – Orange juice is made fresh right there (they have a machine – drop oranges in – get juice) - if a bit lacking in warm food options. (eggs or toast) }Service – overall attitude from mgmt through to the staff – [below average] – I found the front desk people to be good.
