We had to talk with the managers (yes 2 different people) about the bed. The first time to ask for help, and then upon checkout when I had really had enough from 3 days of no sleep and wanted them to know they had an issue and I would not recommend them. (I did not want anything from this – I paid my bill in full – and just wanted to leave). The desk person at checkout of course called the manager to talk with me. I explained my issue and expectations. To be fair we was trying to do his job, but while I explained and offered advice on how to make things better – I kept hearing those phrases that tell me they don’t understand the hospitality business mind set: “we have had good reviews about our beds” – has he read trip advisor about his hotel “did you tell us” – yes – but as I explained to him, I should not have to tell you – this is a 4star/quality hotel – the basics should be good – only the little things (can I have a different pillow) should need to be requested by the customer. “it is hard since we have to try and make everyone happy” – this shows they don’t understand - of course you do – this is your business – making each customer reasonably happy – welcome to the services/hotel business. He was trying to explain, but really missing the point. He did pay for our car to the airport – which was nice – I did not ask for this and told him it was not necessary – but he insisted – so I would like to say Thank You for this. }Little Extras – [above average] – )There is a refrigerator in each room, and they put a few drinks in for free each day (coke, orange, water, juice). )Bed slippers for each person. ) There is a power adaptor built into the bathroom wall. Can pick 120 or 230, and it has the us (non grounded) plug. Very handy. }Other Notes – ) It has 3 PCs with internet in the lobby (for those of us on vacation that do not want to even think about dragging around a blackberry or laptop) ) It has a nice workout room with sauna (we did not use it) ) We were asked to leave our key at the desk when we left, since it had the name of the hotel and room number on it. This was fine. ) As mentioned, it is very close to the ROME Termini train station (just out the front door and across one main street) – which is very handy. Both for arrival AND for jumping on the metro. (as the 2 main metro lines cross/junction at the Termini) }Would I stay there again? – NO – I need my sleep. (which is too bad, as the rest of the place is quality) (they would need to show me the beds were fully replaced – OR I could pick before I arrived what bed type I wanted – and I mean a real bed change – not some mattress on a mattress) }Would I recommend this place to a friend? – NO (not attaching photos of the nice patio - since I can not recommend)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent All Around”
Reviews.Author: JM92009
Reviews.Content: My family completely enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Diocleziano. The location is great--walking distance of many attractions and the Metro and Termini, so it is ideal. We traveled with our 8 month old son and the staff was very kind and helpful. In fact, the staff were all around excellent, friendly, and made our stay very enjoyable. The computers with internet access are an added bonus not found in many hotels. The breakfast was good, room size was great, and again, you can't beat the location. We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Would return in a Roman minute...”
Reviews.Author: MaveriQ
Reviews.Content: Can't beat this combination of location, location, location... and comfort plus fantastic service in Rome. We have stayed in other hotels in this city some more expensive, others less expensive but none where we felt we got value for our money as much as we felt after staying at Diocleziano. A stone's throw from Train Station so VERY convenient for travellers and daytrippers but without the grunge of the Termini ghetto since it is neatly tucked away behind the age-old Terme. Great sound barrier - we slept like babies, completely immunue to the hustle and bustle of the city outide. The complimentary breakfast by Rome standards was varied and hearty enough to last you easily to noon, and offered comfortably in a quaint & sizeable dining area to get your day started. The free internet - what a plus ! Last but not least, the people who work there are fantastic - thanks to the breakfast staff, the Manager, and of course, the 3 Musketeers at the Reception- Giorgio, Hicham and Valentino - for their recommendations and right-on helpful hints to make the most of our stay. Forget the 5* hotels or the Haunted Discount Hotels in Rome - the way to go are the boutique places - intimate, comfortable, clean as a whistle, amenities, that does the job and then some without breaking your bank - save your dollars for the shopping! I would highly recommend Diocleziano. We stayed in a clean/comfy/cozy superior room and not less than what we needed, and given that you are only sleeping in it, it doesn't really need to be gargantuan. We wholeheartedly enjoyed our stay and would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel service i'v seen”
Reviews.Author: amir215
Reviews.Content: my wife and i spend our honeymoon at this great hotel. we spend 5 nights in june 2010, sleeping in the superior room. the hotel is very clean. our room (room number 103) was spacious and very nice. the hotel is located in a quiet street, (there was no noise from the street at night) just 5 minutes walk from Termini station, which is the main transportaion station in Rome. the mini bar drinks are free! really... there are new soft drinks every day. there is free wireless internet connection in the room, if you have a laptop. if not - there are several computers in the lobby, connected to the internet, and it is also free of charge. the breakfast is very nice, with good choise of food and drinks and even coffee machine. but the best thing about this hotel is the staff, and the wonderfull service they provide. a few examples: 1. at the day of our arrival, we were surprised with cold champagne and snacks, as it was our honeymoon. 2. we needed an electricity adaptor for our laptop. the staff had many adaptors but no one matched to my needs. the next morning one of them gave me his personal laptop cable for the rest of our stay!! 3. when we left the hotel on our way to the airport, we forgot at the reception a poster with self portrait. when we got back home, we got an e-mail from the hotel, asking for our home address in order to send it to us. we recieved that item today! everybody in the hotel were so friendly, always smiling and asking about our traveling in the city. for me, just being able, today (a week after leaving the hotel) , to remmember most of the names of the staff members says it all. so... Simone,Anna,Melanie,Hicham,Theodore,Giorgio and Valentino - thank you so much!!!! we will definitely come back! Amir and Inbal

Reviews.Title: “Great start to a fantastic Rome vacation”
Reviews.Author: Robotpedlr
Reviews.Content: Hotel Diocleziano is conveniently located near the main train and subway station in Rome which made access to all of our attractions a breeze. Although, like all hotels in Rome, the rooms are on the smaller side.....it was very clean and the staff was great. Our room also included a great breakfast buffet. The hotel also had free wifi and a nice fitness area if walking through the city is not enough exercise for you.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: Pepperie
Reviews.Content: Our room was very clean but small. Fortunately it came with a terrace that was even larger than the room! The bathroom was roomy and had a huge bath/shower with multiple heads. The staff were very helpful and made us feel welcome from the moment we arrived.The breakfast buffet nice with a good variety......even fresh sqeezed orange juice. Located within a 5 minute walk from Roma Termini and walking distance to all the major sites ( the Vatican being the furthest was maybe 30 minutes) we would definitely staff here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent service and an overall great...”
Reviews.Author: Sverrho
Reviews.Content: Excelent service and an overall great hotell, combined with a gips location and prices you can live with! We will return if we visit Rome again!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: BarryandJackie
Reviews.Content: Great staff. The whole experience starts with the folks who check you in and welcome you and everyone in this place is cheery and helpful and responsive. We put them to the test with requests about restaurants, driving, taking cabs, changing car reservations, train schedules, storing luggage, fixing drains (these things happen), and solving computer software problems. We would return here again just because of all of them. Now, the rooms are pretty good sized with a comfortable bed, reasonable size bathroom, closets, and complimentary waters and soda in the mini-fridge. Complimentary Wi-Fi, which generally worked well in the room, but they were quick to respond with any challenges, and also offered three PCs downstairs that could be used 24 hours per day. They have a room set aside with fitness machines and a small sauna and shower. The breakfast buffet has a number of choices, fresh croissants and rolls, fresh squeezed orange juice, cappuccino/espresso made to order, and the like. While eggs are scrambled, they are fresh and the meats (bacon and sausages) plentiful. They do have a bar in the event one needs a drink (as we took advantage of one afternoon for several beers). And we enjoyed the location, across the street essentially from the Train Station (terminus). Some people think this area is sketchy and certainly so on several fronts but not this one (indeed, there are other hotels on both sides of this one). It was great to so conveniently hop on the train, metro, or catch a taxi (and to easily do the same on the return). There were a few good restaurants in the nearby area, but not as plentiful as cold be found in other areas. One restaurant we would avoid down the street is La Familigia, as the wait staff is unpleasant and short-changed us on the tab.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value. Convenient location and professional staff.”
Reviews.Author: cpedge78
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for the final 2 nights of our 3 day stay in Rome. We originally booked in a nearby bed and breakfast for the length of our visit but decided to seek another establishment after a less than stellar first night at the B&B. We wandered over to this hotel after reviewing the submissions on Trip Addvisor and were impressed with the lodgings and the professionalism of the staff from the get-go. We found the room to be very comfortable and couldn't believe how quiet the room was at night. The hotel is well kept and my wife and I were both pleased with the breakfast arrangement. The location is very convenient to the Metro, which I found to be the prefferable way to get around the city in view of the generally unpleasant experience of walking around the city amongst the hoardes. In summary, we found this hotel to be a great value and recommend this hotel with enthusiasm.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - cannot praise it enough!”
Reviews.Author: jack_75Perth
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 10am after our flight from Australia expecting to drop our bags and kill time until check in, however the staff sent us off to have a complimentary coffee and cappiccino while they readied our room. We were in having a shower and freshening up by 11am. The room was very comfortable and clean, MiniBar, Internet, English newspapers, Gym and Sauna, it all was complimentary. The included breakfast was terrific, couldn’t be more plentiful than it was. The staff were very helpful and smiling, all of them, no exceptions and their English is better than mine... Everyone was nice and helpful. Valentino is exceptional! He helped us out with dinner reservations and gave us good advice about sightseeing tours and shops in the area. This could very well be your home away from home in Rome, I vouch for this Hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like HOME”
Reviews.Author: akinzu
Reviews.Content: Very clean, very friendly and centraly located but very peacefull. Iwould stay in this hotel again whenever i go to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good!!”
Reviews.Author: missylee28
Reviews.Content: Stayed at room 403 for 3 nights on the 2nd week of May. Room is slightly small ....but the bathroom is huge and very clean !!. The hotel is located about 5 mins walk (without luggage ok..) from Roma Termini. However all tourist spots are a bit far..so if you are not a walker there are plenty of taxis and it cost less than 10euros. Staffs are very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Choice”
Reviews.Author: karleigh10
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a five night stay at the Diocleziano Hotel in Rome. The staff bent over backwards to ensure our needs were met and that we were comfortable. The hotel is newly refurbished and immaculate. Our window overlooked the ancient Diocletian Baths which is now a sort of mini-park with shade trees. The location was quiet and perfect from a transportation standpoint - just a walk up 1/2 block and across the street to the main bus station and train station. I would recommend this hotel highly and I would certainly book here again.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem in Rome”
Reviews.Author: foxysclady
Reviews.Content: My husband, our friends and I just returned from France and Italy. Our last 3 nights were spent at the Hotel Diocleziano and we found it to be a wonderful hidden gem. Not much to look at when you drive up to the front door, but it's a lovely, clean, unpretentious hotel with fabulous staff. Rooms are clean and comfortable, breakfasts were the best we had in Italy. Showers that work with plenty of water--no trickles from these showers! The staff make you feel as though you are part of their family. The front desk, the bellmen, the bar tender, the breakfast attendant--all very warm, welcoming, helpful and willing to go the extra mile. Two recommended restaurants turned out to be great finds, the staff sent a bottle of champagne to our friend on her birthday. We truly enjoyed our stay. Plus it's a short walk to the main transportation square for bus and metro travel, and not much further to the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, updated rooms, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: cag19
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my elderly cousin (80) four nights at this hotel, located less than two blocks from Termini station. The room had been updated and the bathroom was clean and modern. The location was perfect for getting around to the sites on either the hop-on-hop-off tour buses or the subway and local bus service. The breakfast offerings included pastries, cereal, yogurt, fresh fruit, cheeses, ham, eggs,coffee, juice . The hotel staff was so pleasant and very helpful with all our inquiries. The only knock is that we could hear s traffic noise at night from our our room which was at the front of the hotel. All in all this is very good value and I would stay here again, but might ask for a room facing the back.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific!”
Reviews.Author: okieOKC1
Reviews.Content: Staff was absolutely terrific. They arranged for our pick up at the cruise port, arranged for transport back to the airport and helped with tour arrangements and all kinds of extra guidance. They could not have been more helpful. Room was great with free minibar and free internet. Full breakfast was included. Close to train, bus and metro. Outstanding feature was the hospitality and helpfulness of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Judy025
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from Italy and this hotel was our first stop in Rome. After flying through the night we were lucky to get checked in at 9 AM to nap and get settled. That was a huge bonus. Aside from the lift (elevator) which is tiny, the room was excellent...clean, spacious with a fabulous bathroom.The staff was always friendly & helpful and the breakfasts were delicious. Aside from eggs, cheeses, meat, pastries, bread, croissants, there was always fresh fruit. My favorite was the fresh squeezed blood orange juice. Fantastid! I would highly recommend this boutique hotel to anyone visiting Rome. We also took the double decker bus for 48 hours which turned out to be a wonderful way to get around and get an overview of the city,

Reviews.Title: “Our Anniversary Trip”
Reviews.Author: Lamar20
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Diocleziano the last week of April. We were celebrating our 40th Wedding Anniversary. We searched Trip Advisor several times and finally decided upon this wonderful small Hotel. It is located near the Terminal Station and therefore excellent for gettting anywhere in Rome. There are several good places to eat nearby. The Hotel Staff was always Smiling and eager to help with questions. The American breakfast served every morning was good and a great start to each day of exploring Rome. The room we had was small by American standards but was very adequate. We had a nice spa tub which we took advantage of every night. The room was very clean and was kept that way by the housekeeping staff each day. I can say we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Diocleziano and it will be our choice again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great service,very central, some flaws but at this price”
Reviews.Author: gracesheraton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Diocleziano for the weekend and would make the following comments: + The service is great, especially Simona on reception who is worth her weight in gold in terms of giving advice especially on restaurants etc + The location is very central and all the main sites are within easy reach. The area around the station is a bit dodgy so you need to watch your step but this is reflected in the price of the hotel + The rooms are large and very clean and the restaurant is perfectly OK considering the price + We had a noisy airconditioning unit in our room which the hotel was unable to turn off - my advice would be to avoid room 002 which is on the ground floor of the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Old, but well kept with charming service”
Reviews.Author: volleyballgirl88
Reviews.Content: Good: - Free mini bar replenished every day - free breakfast - staff that greets you everytime you walk in and out. They also helped with calling and booking restaurants, spa treatments etc. Bad: -Internet was on/off. - The room is very warm, the good thing is we can open the window to cool it off. - There was no room service option, and because my husband was sick I had to run out to get food at night, rather than just calling room service I would actually give this hotel a 3.5 out of 5 if I can, overall the service was excellent and with the free daily mini bar and breakfast it is value for money. The hotel looked quite old though (look, some would say 'charming' and maybe if you like the old world feel it would have been nice. But for a couple who like sleek, modern design it's probably not what we are after) but it's very well kept.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and a great stay in rome”
Reviews.Author: patny8
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nites at the Diocleziano and had a great time in rome. Staff were friendly and genuinely helpful. Room was very comfortable, clean and quiet. Free in-room wifi and complimentary softdrinks in minibar are nice touch. Buffet breakfast also good (with cappucino and espresso/fresh squeezed orange juice). Location is close to Termini rail station. Would definitely stay here again -- thanks to the incredible staff for their suggestions and warmth.

Reviews.Title: “Fab little hotel, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: bugley600
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after reading the reviews on this site and we weren't disappointed. We had a superior room and although not large, it did have a large terrace and was spotlessly clean with a very comfy bed. We stayed for 2 nights and slept really well, no noise from other bedrooms or traffic. The breakfast was fine and served in a very pleasant dining room, the first morning (SUN) there was no tea or coffee offered us and we poured our own from a large urn which tasted horrible, however the next morning, lovely coffee and tea was brought to our table, so much better. The hotel proved to be pretty good location wise, very close to the train station and buses. We ate at Babbo's the first night, which was fantastic, I hadn't been able to book on line and asked the hotel staff to help me out, which they did, keeping me informed with emails all along. We also used the hotel's recommended private car to and from the airport, this was great as it took all the hassle out of commuting. All in all a great little hotel with incredibly helpful and pleasant staff, well done Hotel Diocleziano, your doing a great job!

Reviews.Title: “A really great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: suzyQ30
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights recently and was so impressed with everything about it. The staff couldn't have been nicer. On arrival we were told that we had been upgraded to a superior room! The rooms are smallish but are absolutely spotless and cleaned really well every day. There are also complementary minerals replaced in the mini-bar every day. The hotel has free internet access. All of these little touches really added to the service. The hotel is conveniently located very close to Termini Station. This area isn't the prettiest or cleanest in Rome But the hotel is located off a side street so you don't even notice really. Overall we had a great experience here and would definitely recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful saff, lovely hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: susan1951
Reviews.Content: Before my husband and I came to Rome I did a lot of searching the Internet to find a good Hotel and we wasn't dissapointed it was in good location a few minutes walk to termini station and spottessliy clean with an excellent hot and cold buffett breakfast and friendly staff waiting on. We stayed for one week and but was delayed due to the volcanic ash and had to stay an extra week it was a stressful time for us not knowing when we would be able to fly home but beeing able to continue our stay in this delightful hotel with the friendly staff which we formed a close rappor. From the reception staff and breakfast staff and also the porters what incedible people, they should be proud of themselves they are a cedit to the hotel group which they belong to as it is the front line staff what work so hard well done.We have stayed in hotels all over europe and nowhere have encounted such kind and helpful staff nothing was too much trouble on the first day we arrived we found our kettle wouln't work and on asking where we could find an electrical shop Simona kindly loaned us one which we really appreciated.The complimentary soft drinks and having a fridge in our room was a bonus also the free internet was a godsend when we was stranded.I can't praise the staff enough for all they did for my husband and myself.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific value - highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: nydolly
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel for a one-night stay-over on our way to Florence. It was a short walk from the train station. The friendly staff helped us with an orientation tour, held our luggage until check-in. The rooms were updated, clean and comfortable (bathrooms spotless, beds a little hard). Free soft drinks in the room fridge, free wi-fi throughout the hotel. A very nice breakfast included. Very happy!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth Euros 180/night”
Reviews.Author: Gunner7
Reviews.Content: In terms of value for money, this hotel is way off the mark and therefore has to get a very poor rating. The room was a decent size but it was basic - no better than a cheap travel lodge in the US - and the hotel is not in a particularly nice area although having said that it is a few minutes walk to the trainstation which can be important. There was free internet & breakfast & soft drinks in the mini bar but none of that made up for it being way overpriced and leaving you feel ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed at this hotel 2 nights at the...”
Reviews.Author: Challock
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 2 nights at the beginning of our trip and 3 nights at the end, and honestly could not wait to get back to this hot while staying in 2 other hotels in two other cities. The staff here is really great-all very happy to help and didn't mind or seem annoyed that we knew very little Italian. The staff reccommended two different restaurants close to the hotel that were both very good and had different atmospheres. The mini bar in the room was complimentary with soda and waters and the breakfast was great!! This hotel is in a great locations literally just a two minute walk from the main subway/train/bus terminal. And lie others have said-was very quiet. We would definitely reccommend this hotel to family and friends and would stay here again. We had a "superior" room on the first few nights here but had an upgraded room the next time we checked in and the bathroom had a two person jacuzzi in it! There were also complimentary house shoes left by the bed for us. Pretty fabulous for the amount of money we spent!!

Reviews.Title: “Well beyond our expectation”
Reviews.Author: pigroHK
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. The room is spotlessly clean and of good size. It is conveniently located close to Termini, that means close to both the train station, major bus station as well as metro. Yet it is in a quiet corner just off a major road. We enjoyed both the convenient location and the quiet environment. The breakfast room is very nice and the breakfast itself is especially good when comparing with other hotels offering so-called continental buffet breakfast. We are very impressed that the room, the breakfast room and the hotel (interior and exterior) is exactly as shown in the photos in the hotel's website. The free WiFi (we use our own notebook in our room but guests may also use the public desktops on lobby floor) and the free minibar in room refilled every day (with water and softdrinks) is also a comparative advantage to other hotels in Rome. Though not of high costs, it shows the hotel cares about guests and provides what is needed most by guests nowadays.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and a good night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: Ian_Pratt
Reviews.Content: Arriving in Rome late on a Sunday night, the last thing I wanted was to struggle to find my accommodation. Being able to walk from the entrance of Termini Station and into the hotel then was very welcome. Surprisingly for such a central location, the hotel was completely silent. My room opened up over an internal courtyard and I could detect almost no city sounds at all. Rooms were smallish but pleasant. I was in a superior room, which gave a little room to move and a reasonable bathroom. Internet was passably quick and free. Service was friendly and efficient, with check in and check out taking only a few moments. Breakfast staff were bustling and busy, but had time for a smile and were happy to squeeze some fresh juice or make a good coffee. Overall, the Diocleziano provides quality at a level that you would expect in this price bracket, which is certainly not something that is always the case in a city like Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, new interior, spacious rooms, good breakfast, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: JossKatt
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its very good location. As we arrived in Rome after 23.00 it was essential to find a hotel not far from Termini station (actually, it is even nearer than we expected – just about 3 minutes to walk). And it is practically in the centre (it takes only 15-20 minutes on foot to get to the main attractions; by bus or metro it takes about 5 min). We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and the staffs were constantly nice and friendly. For breakfast they offer an excellent cappuccino and freshly squeezed juice, the breakfast is plentiful and with a good choice (scrambled eggs, baked bacon, sausages, various cheese, ham, tasty pastries, various yoghurts and a lot of fruits). You can use wifi or their computers free of charge. It is definitely the best value for your money (and even more).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round”
Reviews.Author: Giacomo_Trifoglio
Reviews.Content: Straight out of the Termini Station, 400 yards walk. Very easy to get to. Location excellent, 50 minutes walk to Vatican, all other places walkable. Good choice at breakfast, clean sound-proofed rooms, friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near Rome Termini and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: brilliant_green
Reviews.Content: My mum and I stayed here for 5 nights in early March '10. We chose this hotel for it's location - it is literally few mins walk to Rome Termini station and metro (turn right as you head out the hotel, walk down the street and across the road and there it is). It is situated on a quiet street and we felt safe walking to and from the hotel at night. All major attractions are within a short 20 min walk. We found that Rome is a city best explored on foot... you get to discover so many hidden gems along the way! Our standard twin room was clean, tidy, comfortable and quiet and came with free wifi access and complimentary mini-bar which was refreshed daily (water, juice and soft drink). We had a room with not much of a view, but that didn't bother us at all. The buffet breakfast was excellent and served in a bright cheery room and we were welcomed with a smile every morning by the staff. The reception staff were superb - very helpful and friendly. They even offered us breakfast "to-go" on our last day as we had to check out early in the morning to catch the train to Florence. It's the little things that make all the difference!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Long Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Fotherby
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Diocleziano in Rome last weekend - lovely hotel within easy reach of the transport terminals, bus, tram, trains, metro - great location for hopping on and off to get to the various locations and saved lots of time. The hotel itself was lovely with a great breakfast to start the day and the staff were really great, friendly and helpful. Nothing was too much trouble for them, maps and information were readily available. The La Familia restaurant round the corner is highly recommended - always busy with locals and food was good and realistically priced. Took a late evening bus ride around the city and saw Rome by night and lit up - enjoyed by all of us. The Roma pass was worth its weight in gold - for by passing the queues if nothing else. Visited the Vatican on Sunday - the Pope gives a blessing at noon (info wasn't available in all the guidebooks) and you can attend Mass and take Holy Communion.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate with great included items”
Reviews.Author: BrinyBoy
Reviews.Content: Have just stayed here and was very impressed. The location is super, being a short walk from Roma Termini train station. Located on a quiet street, my room in the back was very quiet. The check in was quick and painless. The room is European sized, but not too small. There was a large closet and laptop sized safe in the room. I was in room 203 which has a whirlpool tub. Bathroom was immaculate with no trace of mildew. The bed was extra firm, which was a bit hard for me, but was certainly acceptable. The room included wifi access and even some beverages in the minibar fridge which were complimentary and refreshed daily. The buffet breakfast was varied and good. I would definitely stay again and in fact am staying on my return trip to leave Italy in a week.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!!”
Reviews.Author: Peter85
Reviews.Content: We have stayed for 4 nights from 11-15th March. First, I must said that location is GREAT (3-4 minutes walk from Termini station). When we came baggage boy take our staff and wait as till on reception explained as everything and gave as a plan of city. Breakfast was great and rich (eat as many as you can). Room was claean and tidy, with free minibar and free wireless internet. Hotel also have gym and souna frre of charge... When departing home (we had flight on 6 pm and we must leave romm till noon) hotel stuff offered as to leave baggage in hotel and come back later to take them. Overall great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MDJNJ
Reviews.Content: I must say the front desk at Diocleziano earn this hotel its 5* they were always very helpful and attentive. We were very impressed and to this day talk about our experience with the A+ staff (everyone)at the Diocleziano. The rooms are clean and they have everything you need to make your stay a pleasant one, including refreshment. The breakfast was good and the location was perfect. Its close to the main terminal which could take you to just about any attraction within minutes. Would love to visit Rome again and would stay no where else but Diocleziano!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a heavenly haven in the eternal city”
Reviews.Author: RobertoWaterford
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel and terrific value. It is very clean and is in a nice quiet location but located perfectly for the Metro and buses. What impressed us most of all was the friendly and helpful service from Reception to Restaurant to Cleaning Staff-this is a feature sorely lacking in many so-called high-quality hotels. We have to state that the staff set a standard that any other hotel will find impossible to better. The rooms were of a reasonable size and having a bath made it special in Rome. The breakfast was just excellent and the breakfast location was ideal. Our only reservation is that this could let out the secret that Hotel Diocleziano is the best hotel in Rome. We have nothing negative to say and this says it all!

Reviews.Title: “Up and Down”
Reviews.Author: BeerSnob11
Reviews.Content: Up until checkout I was going to write a fairly good review of this hotel. However, on our checkout, I asked the concierge where the easiest place was to grab a taxi to the airport. He informed me that we could take the car service for 47 euros. I said we would prefer a taxi because it was a 40 euro flat rate. He then lied to me and told me it was not a flat rate and could be more with traffic. Given the early morning and pouring rain we relented and took the car service rather than trying to find a taxi. Other than the terrible customer service the hotel is okay. The breakfast is good, the rooms are clean and it is quiet so you can get a good night sleep. However, the location is not at all convenient to get to the historical center. The metro works for getting to the colleseum and vatican but does not run anywhere else. You need to walk 30-40 minutes or take the bus. There are also very few good restaurants near the hotel. We ate at a place called Babbo's down the street which was good. However we spent 70 euros on dinner whereas the rest of our trip we spent half this for a better meal. Stay here is you get a good deal but you are probably better off paying a little more to stay in the historic center. Also, the lack of a restaurant makes coming back to the hotel for a nightcap impossible which is something we like doing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RomeEnthusiast
Reviews.Content: This hotel really does stand out because of the staff who are exceptionally friendly and helpful. The hotel is elegantly decorated. The rooms are spacious and quite grand really. It was great value for money as it only cost about £350 for flights and hotel for a 4 day stay on expedia. The hotel is close to the Termini station which makes it really easy to get around on the metro. Before going we read some reviews and a lot of people recommended a restaurant close to the hotel (can't remember what it was called but was is a neigbouring street) DON'T GO THERE! Our food had a few dead flies in it, the beer was topped up with water, the food was disgusting and old and the staff were vile. Instead walk down to Piazza republica and then up the main street a little bit until you get to Ristorante Zeus. But back to the hotel- Amazing!

Reviews.Title: “clean, comfortable & very friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: katieDundalk
Reviews.Content: We had no complaints at all. From breakfast whenever we were ready for it to helpful staff on the desk, we found everyone very welcoming and friendly. The hotel is very convenient but what a shame you have no restaurant or tea making facilities in the bedrooms.

Reviews.Title: “it was Fashion Week!”
Reviews.Author: oahioforever
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the best possible place in Rome, close to all attractions..Everything about our stay was perfect. The location..the food...the transfers, we reserved all the transfers from the aeroport to the hotel and the city tour Rome by night on Takemeitaly.com at the excellent price and the hotel on internet by expedia.

Reviews.Title: “Bad services”
Reviews.Author: Hunter081
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is good if you don't mind using public transportation to get around. The view from my room and probably for most of the rooms on its side wasn't great. Even if the furniture is a little worn out, the room is well maintained and cleaned. The room and the bathroom are of good size. The biggest problem is the services. They pre-authorized the fee for the first night 2 days before the date i could have cancelled without any penalties, probably to discourage you to cancel if you've found better last-minute deals. The problem is that even till today (more than a month later) they still haven't unblock that money (I honored the reservation and fully paid at the reception), even though i emailed them about the problem, i received apologies but they didn't solved the problem. I called my bank to take action regarding this problem, hope i'll get my money back sometime. I think this is the biggest faux pas a hotel can do in terms of services, it shows lack of respect to its customers’ money!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: RobTrina
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel and were allocated the VIP suite (room 501) at no extra cost! The hotel staff were unbelievable, so friendly and helpful, they just couldnt do enough for us. The bell boy took our bags up to the room and showed us the safety deposit box and free mini bar. The staff on reception helped with directions, sight seeing advice and restaurant reccommendations. The room itself was immaculate and very spacious. The breakfast room was very pleasant and the offering was good - cereal, fruit, yoghurts, bread and croissants, ham/cheeses, scrambled eggs, bacon, toast and preserves etc The location of the hotel was perfect - a two minute walk from piazza di republicca and via nazionale, where there are many bars and small cafes/restaurants. The trevi fountain, spanish steps and colloseum are all within half hour walking distance (or 5 mins on the metro). We would reccomend trattoria berzitello on via delle quattro fontane off via nazionale to eat. It is a small traditional Italian eaterie and the vast menu and extensive wine list is very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Hotel near Termini”
Reviews.Author: cham3b
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel because of its location (literally across the road from Rome Termini) after reading reviews on Tripadvisor. I must say that the accounts of other people hold true - this is a friendly, small hotel with very nice rooms. It looks as though it has recently been refurbished to a very high standard. The location suited me for travelling back and forth to the airport and also for the Metro. There are plenty of very good trattoria within a few minutes walking distance although the area immediately around the Termini isn't the best in Rome. My only minor negative point is that the heating seemed to be full blast all of the time but overall, excellent value, good location and very nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Rome, loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Severins
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Europe, and we were pleasantly surprised to see the hotel's special rate of 104 EUR per night for Sunday stays. Although Termini area is not very nice, the hotel is very conveniently located in a small and quiet street near the Terme Diocleziano. The room was spotlessly clean and had a spacious bathroom, and a complimentary minibar turned out to be very helpful! All the famous places are within walking distance (except Vaticano, but it was not a problem as the subway is a short walk), the hosts were extremely welcoming, and we immediately felt in love with the city and the hotel itself. I had some problems with my back, but the bed was very comfortable and we had great slleping time after busy days. A short walk around the corner and you come to Via Nazionale, where you can find many shops, and a nice trattoria is a minute walk. Unfortunately now the price is much higher, but anyway thanks to the hotel staff for our unforgettable experience!

Reviews.Title: “This is an amazing hotel in the centre of...”
Reviews.Author: Garden3
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing hotel in the centre of Rome. It really is just 5 mins from the train and metro stations. The staff are so friendly and helpful. Nothing is too much for them. The breakfast was plentiful and good quality. We stayed in a standard room and were really pleased with the accomodation. The room was on the small size but spotlessly clean and we didn't come to Rome to stay in a hotel room. The free soft drinks and water in the mini bar were a nice touch so different from most other hotels. We also loved our nightcaps of limoncello in the bar downstairs. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome and if I ever return to Rome would stay here.

Reviews.Title: “You have lost my custom!”
Reviews.Author: xp01321
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel before, and quite like it. We were looking forward to our stay tomorrow night, when the airline called and told us our flight had been cancelled due to inclement weather. I called the hotel immediately, and was told that calling 30 hours in advance is not good enough. According to their policy, it has to be 48 hours, and a policy is a policy. It does not matter why you cancel according to the lady at the front desk. I will now have to pay 99 euros for the first night. I can live with the fact that a policy is a policy, but the attitude and customer management at the Diocleziano is appallingly bad. I will choose another hotel for my upcoming stay in Rome, and would advise others to do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel staff very friendly location was brilliant”
Reviews.Author: travel123Dublin
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this hotel the staff were very friendly and helpful. Free minibar in room which was great. The hotel was very central within 5 mins walk to metro. I would highly recommend this hotel and will book it again when I return.

Reviews.Title: “You can't improve on perfection”
Reviews.Author: Kathycruising
Reviews.Content: Our first stay at this hidden gem in Rome was last August when I discovered that I had picked up someone else's suitcase (obviously identical to mine!) at the cruise terminal - every travellers nightmare!! The hotel staff moved Heaven and earth to locate my case which they finally tracked down at the airport about to embark on a journey to Tenerife!! They arranged a swap via their hotel taxi service and within an hour my case was safely delivered to my room. Now that's going the extra mile on service. A quality hotel, unbeatable location, excellent varied breakfast (including scrambled eggs and bacon!!) and friendly smiling staff always ready to offer advice and assistance. We've just returned from our second visit - where else would we stay in Rome? This hotel ticks all the boxes and has a great ambience. You can't improve on perfection.

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic”
Reviews.Author: pumpkito
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the first two nights in Italy. From the reviews I was a little disappointed. The hotel is a block from the Termini train station which was great for coming and going but the area is a little sketchy. The hotel was extremely hard to find. The rooms reminded me of a Best Western in the states. Breakfast was not so good, not horrible but decent. The pros were that it was clean and the staff was really helpful! The staff was really the best part. I would expect a hotel like this to be a little cheaper for the value and location.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't want for anything more - strongly recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BobAnneholiday
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived the service was exceptional and so friendly and helpful. We booked a superior room for four nights and were well rewarded - a large room by European standards, great bathroom and huge comfortable bed. Room price included really satisfying full breakfasts each day with happy obliging staff to welcome the day! No request was too great for any staff member at any time. Location is super - three minutes walk from the Termini. The only minor issue was that there is no obvious street signage so the taxi driver had difficulty finding the hotel when we arrived from the airport. We would definitely stay here again - would look no further! Bob & Anne, Brisbane Australia

Reviews.Title: “Great location, breakfast and staff. Rooms were fine.”
Reviews.Author: vlb1228
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a short walk from the main train station. The staff was very nice and spoke English. They recommended a great place for dinner not far away. The breakfast buffet was very nice. The rooms were okay and included free internet access. And in January, we got a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel! Don't look further...”
Reviews.Author: Snowball24
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean and comfortable rooms, delicious breakfast and super friendly staff. Loved the free mini-bar the most. Will definitely go back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: SilvMontrealCanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the this hotel for 11 nights from December 28th to January 8th. The rooms were spacious for European standards and clean and quiet. Very well located close to the train station and buses, extremely practical. Staff were excellent particularly Simone and Anna. They were always smiling and very helpful. We would definitely return to this hotel and recommend to friends and collegues. Silvia & Claude Montreal Canada

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: jkw123
Reviews.Content: Hotel Diocleziano is a great little hotel in the heart of Rome. Just minutes from the main train station and a short walk from the beautiful Piazza Repubblica. We stayed in a lovely room which included its own terrace that looked over parts of Rome. The rooms were impeccably clean and very comfortable. Breakfast was excellent - one of the best we experienced throughout many hotels in Italy. The staff could not have been more helpful with great advice and service. Highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and hopitality.”
Reviews.Author: udiash
Reviews.Content: Hi all, we just came back from 4 days in Rome. We have enjoyed Rome a lot. The hotel is 5 minutes walk from the termini station which made the all trip very comfortable. The hotel team helped us a lot with finding places and getting the correct bus lines. The rooms are are a little bit small but very clean and comfortable. buttom line - Great hotel, great location, great service.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay in central Rome”
Reviews.Author: glg-20
Reviews.Content: I've spent 5 nights at the Hotel Diocleziano in mid December in a twin room. We opted for the hotel shuttle which was a nice van since our flight arrived at night. It saved us the hassle of taking the train to the Termini station or a taxi which has more limited space for baggage. It took about 30 min. to get from the airport to the hotel by car (not much traffic at the time). The hotel is conveniently located on a side street, about a 5 minute walk from the main Termini train/bus/subway station. This side street location made for a nice and quiet stay. We didn't find the hotel area threatening and have often returned to the hotel from Termini late at night. There were a few bums/weirdos around (no different than other areas in Rome) and it's pretty quiet with few people at night but we weren't afraid of trouble finding us. Once at the Termini station, it's a short subway ride to the main city attractions (around 2 stops to the Colosseum and around 7 to the Vatican). The bus system provides a good backup to the subway that doesn't cover all areas of the city (like the Trastevere area which is a good spot for nightlife). We did do a lot of walking in central Rome which isn't very large by comparison to other major cities and attractions are within walking distance if you're wearing a pair of comfortable shoes and travelling light. During our stay, the hotel staff all round were very courteous and helpful. As in many hotels in central Rome, the classic building has been remodeled into a hotel. The hotel looks very well maintained and the rooms are modern/clean. It is a small hotel with about 40 rooms. There isn’t much of a bar and if you’re looking for a good bar/lounge, look somewhere else. Don't expect to find a room the size of a North American hotel. The room is small. The twin beds were more like 1 king bed cut in half and were virtually right next to each other. The bed though was comfortable and I had a good nights rest after a long day walking around Rome. There was a large desk area in the room as well as a good sized closet. Television was nothing to write home about with 1-2 English news channels and the rest in Italian. If I recall, it costs 5 Euros for a PPV movie which were in English and Italian. The minibar had limited items (soft drinks) but all were free and were refilled every day. The best thing about the room was the bathroom which was large by comparison to the bedroom. It was very clean and modern with a toilet, bidet, sink and walk-in shower which was very good and had good hot water pressure. My parents stayed in a superior room which had a nice hot tub and a large balcony. Their bedroom wasn’t much larger than our twin room. The room internet WiFi was free of charge (remember to get the password from the front desk) as well as the internet station in the hotel lobby. The room safe was large enough for small items and was simple to program. My larger laptop didn’t fit in the safe so I handed it over to the front desk who kept it safely during my absence. I haven’t used the fitness center although there is one in the hotel. Breakfast had an OK selection but wasn’t very good in our opinion. The Good: - Location - Staff - Modern/clean hotel/room - Free minibar - Free high speed wireless internet in room - Nice bathroom - Comfy bed The Bad: - Small room - Breakfast All in all, I definitely recommend this hotel which is ideal if you’re planning on spending all day exploring the city, only to come back at night for a nice shower and bed. I’d personally skip breakfast in the hotel and look for another place to eat. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable value and outstanding service for central Rome”
Reviews.Author: Tzantushka
Reviews.Content: Have visited Rome numerous times and usually stay on via Nazionale. Based on other's recommendations from tripadvisor, I booked this hotel - I could not fault the service and attention to detail (free mini bar drinks, umbrellas if raining, quite area to read/watch tv). The room was spacious, double glazed windows so NO noise which is unbelievable for Rome particularly as across from Central Termini. Bed was a little hard albeit the other great aspects make up for this. In terms of value for money, staff attentiveness and location, this hotel can't be beaten.

Reviews.Title: “Close to perfection!”
Reviews.Author: irenekeijzer
Reviews.Content: For those who have never travelled to Italy, keep in mind that most Italian hotel rooms are small, noisy and breakfast is limited (when I read the reviews that is what travellers complain about: but that is kind of 'standard'). Hotel Diocleziano however, was a wonderfull surprice for me and my mother!! We did book a superior room (and not standard) because we stayed a week, and wanted a little more space. Great, clean room, great bath, and clean towels every day. I asked for a quite room when I booked, and got it. The staff was very friendly, and breakfast was fantastic! The location of the hotel is nearby the Termini station, but in a quite street. It is not a cosy neighbourhood (but safe enough!), but it is perfect to take the Metro to anywhere (or train for that matter). We travelled by metro every day! So no complaints, what so ever about Diocleziano! For business travellers, keep in mind that Diocleziano has not it's own restaurant, but there are a few good trattoria's in the street.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: StephanieRose
Reviews.Content: What a surprise Hotel Diocleziano was for us! We loved staying here. The rooms were comfortable and the bathroom was huge! Of all 5 hotels we stayed at on our honeymoon in Italy, the staff here was the best! The decor is nothing over the top, just clean and comfortable. Free internet, breakfast, and stocked mini fridge was also a welcomed surprise. We would highly recommend this hotel! As for some comments on the area, the hotel felt safe to us. It's not in "the best" area of town. The location is easy to access the train station and other transportation. Safe Travels!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: nokturnna
Reviews.Content: The room (405) was very spacious and very confortable. I felt like home! (Ok, much better than home! lol) The bathroom was big with heated floor and great amenities. The mini-bar is free and you have there non-alcoolic drinks that were very good after a day walking in the city. You can buy cookies or pizza and bring to the room and you can have a meal or a late-snack in the room. The hotel is 200 mts (5 minute walking) from Termini Train/Subway. You can find cheap restaurants near. I have dinner a pasta with a drink for 8 euros. Internet in the room and in the lobby for free. The elevator is small (2 people + 2 big bags is ok but more people no) but they have bellboy so we don't need to worry about that. The staff was soberb. Very helpful. In the morning of the departure, we leave the hotel before the breakfast and they prepared for us a "pic-nic" with fruit, yogurt, various cookies, nutella, sweet and drink for us to take. Great, hein? I tottaly recomend this hotel. I forgot to take pictures but you can trust in their official website.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service in a great location”
Reviews.Author: jaffatraveller
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in Rome and the choices for hotels seemed overwhelming. However, Diocleziano was perfect. Excellently located near the Termini Station made it easy to get out and about to see Rome. As previously noted the hotel is on a quiet street, and makes for a peaceful break from the frantic atmosphere of Rome. The staff at the hotel were friendly at all times, and had endless recommedations, from excellent restaurants to transport advice. As others have noted the rooms are fairly small, but the bathrooms are large. As I see it, you are in Rome so shouldn't be spending too much time in your room anyway! I will definitely stay here again when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff, Clean Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: TravellersfromNJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days, and would definitely recommend this hotel. The staff was really great---whether it be recommending restaurants, or arranging drivers. The room was very clean, and quiet. We feel pretty much any location within Rome can be a great location, as the entire city is walkable. However, this hotel was pretty much across the piazza from Roma Termini, which made day trips by train very convenient. Free internet was also a plus! All in all, we definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel in an Amazing City”
Reviews.Author: WalesAway
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 7 nights and cannot find fault with this hotel. I arrived from the airport by train at Termini Station,the hotel is located about 10 minutes away in a quiet side street. My room was a twin bedroom with plenty of space,a television with various Italian channels,BBC news & pay movies. A mini bar with a choice of 5 soft drinks all free and a bathroom with all the necessary amenities.On the ground floor there are computers with free internet access which i used to book tickets to the Vatican Museum.There is also a bar,sauna,gym room & breakfast room that served cereals,cakes,fresh fruit,yoghurts,various cold meats,cheese,boiled eggs,bread,croissants & coffee. I must mention & thank all the hotel staff that i met during my stay who were all very approachable,helpful & answered every question that i asked them. As to Rome well it is an amazing city well worth a few repeat visits & i would say that this hotel is worth staying at again & again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - quiet but convenient”
Reviews.Author: Middle_aged_bloke
Reviews.Content: If coming from the airport, you can definitely walk from Termini station unless you have lots of baggage. Out the front, across the bus station, across the main road, and fifty metres up a quiet side street. Once there, you would not know you are downtown. Hotel is simple, clean and quiet; breakfast is fine, and wifi actually works. Staff friendly. Local restaurants are either pretentious or basic (La Famiglia is good value for money, but not exactly gourmet). Site is good for hop-on/off buses from Termini and Piazza Della Republica (you can get a decent seat upstairs before the bus fills up). Being at the Metro 'cross road' is also useful - subway to Vatican takes 7 or 8 minutes, then a 10 minute walk, or down to Lateran cathedral is similar. Colosseum is 3 minutes away. Rome buses are really easy to use if you buy a bus/metro travel card. Good signage and onboard information.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the complex city of Rome, Italy”
Reviews.Author: carolynandmichael
Reviews.Content: Hotel Diocleziano is near Termini, close to train, bus and metro services. We were able to walk to the terminus for Bus M that took us to Parco della Musica where we took in some of the Jazz Roma program. We booked into a superior room at Hotel Diocleziano that gave us space for us and our two suitcases. We had the advantage of an unusually big bathroom for room with a massage shower over a spa bath and a terrace accessible through French doors. Both the spa and the large terrace were a welcome relief after wandering around Rome's sites, and worth every extra Euro spent. Desk staff were charming and helpful, cheerfully encouraging our alarmingly ungrammatical Italian, and the Filipino staff an asset. Breakfast was substantial, a relief to those of us who like cereal and fresh fruit to start the day. The only negative reflects on Rome and not the hotel. The standard of restaurant food in Rome is declining. In this area, there were almost no places to enjoy a meal, especially on Sunday.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: ToCall
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the hotel during my 6 days trip to Rome and I highly recommend the hotel to my friends and relatives. The front desk and staff was very friendly and helpful answering my questions. Room was clean everyday and comfortable. Although I had a room facing the street I hardly could hear the noise from it. The noise from the electricity in the room was annoying, but it was easy to shut down and I had a very good sleep every night. The view from my room was great. Breakfast was perfect to make a good start for my journey into the city. Location made it easy for me to return to the hotel for a quick rest during the day. I definately would be happy to return to this nice hotel next time I visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: floyd71
Reviews.Content: Diocleziano is a lovely hotel for pleasure. The rooms are a bit on the small side but the beds are very comfortable and the place is not on a main street so no traffic noise. However, the real treat was the superb staff. They were so pleasant and courteous, nothing was too much trouble. Our stay started well, when we arrived to be told we had been upgraded to a superior room with whirlpool…and what whirlpool!!! Unlimited use of the hotel internet is free to all customers as well as soft drinks from minibar replaced every day…really nice touches!! We would recommend this hotel to anyone that wants to enjoy a special time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in a perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Elizobob
Reviews.Content: We stayed here prior to our cruise for our 10 year anniversary. The staff was perfect an attentive. The free breakfast was just enough to get us through our day (more than I even expected) . The location was blocks away from the main train station perfect for getting around Rome or if you travel lighter than we do, you can just take the train from the airport. The Room was a little on the smaller side but it had all the amenities you would need. FREE WI FI... made it for us (we were able to stream our AZ cardinals football game) We would absolutely use this hotel again and recommend it to others

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of peace in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Laurawoodham
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 2 nights in this hotel on the last leg of our honeymoon. I had originally booked a large hotel through the internet but ,after one miserable night there, we transferred to Hotel Diocleziano. This is a small hotel tucked away behind an old church but still well located near the train station and all amenities. The staff were superb and made our last days of our honeymoon really special. We had a lovely room overlooking an old Roman garden. The hotel has a gym and sauna which we will use next time we visit. I would particularly like to mention Giordano who was extremely helpful and efficient. I would recommend this hotel over all of the big tourist hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting.. Great Front Desk!”
Reviews.Author: nassos
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights, from the 25th of October untill the 28th of October. We had great weather which made our stay in Rome even greater! First of all, I had to say that I chose this hotel according to what other travellers had written about it, the rank it got in Tripadvisor, and the proximity to stazione termini (we had to live early in the morning on the 28th). The front desk was very informative (especially Anna, and a guy that had a very warming smile but cannot remember his name), and very helpful. The breakfast was adequate, and the service was quite fast I could say. Although they could improve a little bit. The rooms were 15 sq.m. but you could move easily (although the bathroom was small) The overall experience was interesting, and I could recommend it to anybody that would travel for a short period of time in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel close to termini”
Reviews.Author: marklaur
Reviews.Content: Walked from the train station to this lovely hotel with luggage in tow. We arrived early but they had a room ready allowed us to check in. We were given a large room on the first floor. No view from the window was it's only negative. Very clean and well appointed. Free juice, pop and water in the mini bar. Free wi fi as well. Front desk staff were extremely helpful - printing out our boarding passes and helping us place international calls. We stayed one night after a cruise and were thrilled to end our vacation in such a nice and friendly place.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: muckleTheToon
Reviews.Content: just returned from Italy with rome being the final destination. This hotel was excellent and everything that had been previoulsy written was true. The staff were excellent and couldn't do enough for you, free internet and PC's, gym, sauna and soft drinks replaced in your mini bar each day for free. Excellent stay and will be back here on my next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it”
Reviews.Author: AJHChicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Diocleziano for the first night of our honeymoon trip to Italy. We arrived at the airport in the morning and decided to overnight in Roma before taking the train to Orvieto, where we rented a car for 10 days in Umbria. Because the hotel is close to the train station, its location fit perfectly into our plans. The hotel itself is quite nice. The service was excellent. As an example, the front desk staff arranged for flowers to be in our room for our arrival. The dining room was nice and the breakfast good. While I did not use them, the hotel had a decent workout room. I was quite pleased with our room, which had an excellent view of Michelangelo's cloisters in the adjoining Diocletian baths. Some reviewers have warned about the neighborhood around Termini. Maybe because it's because we're from Chicago, but it struck me as acceptable for a big city. Nearby locations include the Museo Nazionale Romano at the Terme di Diocleziano, the Basilica of Santa Maria degli Angeli (also designed by Michelangelo), and the Piazza della Repubblica, where there is a convenient metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and great location”
Reviews.Author: Nadi66
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the hotel for 4 nights and we enjoyed every moment of it. The hotel is 5 min walk from 2 metro stations and 15-20 min walk from all the tourist attractions. The service is excellent and there's lots of extras for free (Internet, minibar, etc).

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: We_L0ve_Italy
Reviews.Content: great location, steps from the Termini. Quiet area at the end of a block. Rooms were very clean, small, (about average for Rome hotels), large bathrooms. Accomodating staff. Wonderful breakfasts. Three laptop computers with internet in the lobby free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: hborchids
Reviews.Content: Tucked away on a quiet street in Rome, the Hotel Diocleziano is a little jewel. Beautifully appointed with beautiful marble accents and an efficient and friendly staff, it far exceeded our expectations. Rooms were very comfortable and the complimentary breakfast quite extensive. We would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a lovely section of Rome.”
Reviews.Author: nedkey
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from Rome after having a "too short" stay at this hotel. Everything about this hotel was wonderful - the room, ammenities, breakfast and the wonderful and helpful staff. The hotel's location is on a quiet and lovely street very near Termini Station and accessible to the Metro. There are plenty of attractions and places to eat that are walkable. I would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: TTB_NY
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Italy with my sister and 85yo grandmother. Rome was our 3d destination in Italy, after Florence and Venice. We had good rooms in both places, but the Diocleziano beat them both. Not only is the hotel lovely, it: (1) is centrally located -- please do not let the fact that it is walking distance to Termini scare you off, the neighborhood is fine, and near some really great restaurants; (2) is modern, with wifi and a lovely new, small but servicable gym; (3) offers great breakfast service and (4) offers the best service I've ever had in a hotel. We had a lovely room on the top floor with a terrace. The person on duty for most of the time I was there was Simone. He was wonderful, from helping me to plan to tours, to just being a pleasant face to see when returning to the hotel after a long day of seeing the sites. The manager was also incredibly helpful and super-friendly. The Diocleziano was my grandmother and sister's favorite hotel of the entire trip (we went to four different places). I look forward to staying in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best”
Reviews.Author: LuvTravelGuy
Reviews.Content: A fantastic stay during our five days in Rome. Location is great - at the corner of a quiet street just minutes away from Termini train station. Room was clean and bed very comfortable. I could not thank the front desk and door staff enough who were always ready to help. Price was also reasonable for Europe. Breakfast was also great. This has got to be my best hotel stay in Europe thus far and would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a nice place to stay in Rome. I would definitely choose this hotel again for my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Best customer service ever!”
Reviews.Author: suzyq43
Reviews.Content: We chose the Hotel Diocleziano based on the Trip Advisor reviews and proximity to the train station. It went beyone all our expectations. It was spotlessly clean, roomy, had a very nice breakfast, free internet, and most of all. the nicest staff we have ever dealt with. One evening, when we became confused about directions to a nearby restaurant, the desk clerk had one of the other employees walk us within sight of the restaurant! Now, that is beyond the call of duty! We will definitely stay there again if we go back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: BazGippsland
Reviews.Content: My wife and I from Gippsland in Victoria, Australia, stayed for 3 nights towards end of september and found the hotel clean and comfortable and staffed with a team of friendly, helpful staff. The breakfast area is bright and cheerful and so are the staff. Rooms are on the compact side however the spa in our "superior" room helped after 27 hours of flying. Close to Termini with an easy walk to and from the station and an elevator assisted in luggage transfer. Air con a bit noisy however much better than none ! An appropriate chair for the receptionists would reduce the risk of future back problems for staff !! I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Close to Metro, Clean Rooms.”
Reviews.Author: MartiniAngel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location. It is a 5 minute walk from Termini Station, making it great when arriving from Da Vinci airport. The staff was extremely helpful and informative. Perfect English! We were very comfortable. Because it is close to the station, it is a few minutes ride to any of the popular tourist sites. The internet is available on 3 computers and is quite fast. The area the hotel is in is very quiet, we slept with the windows open one night. I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel Near the Train Station”
Reviews.Author: VAtraveler57
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great if its important to you to be near the train station, bus lines, da vinci express and metro. Despite hearing to avoid Termini at night, the area didn't feel unsafe to me. The rooms were clean, the staff was nice, the breakfast and the complimentary mini fridge was great. The bathrooms are a joke. This is not a deal breaker but people should be aware. We stayed at this hotel on two occasions in two different rooms. I thought that the shower in the first room was just a fluke but I was wrong. The location of the shower door opens right into the toilet (see picture). What's crazy is that it looks like the doors could easily be adjusted to open on the other side so you don't need to b avoid planting your foot in the toilet. And like all hotels in Europre, they never provide enough towels for a slippery floor that promptly gets soaked.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: SGH65
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights at the hotel. Chose it based on the reviews and location being close to the Termini (main rail station). Rooms were very clean and modern. Bathroom was larger than what wee had expected. Our 8 and 3 year olds loved the room and the attention they got from the staff. The staff were extremely helpful and went out of their ways to book us good bus trips in and out of Rome. The breakfast was superb - the kids had a wonderful time. For the last night they gave us their best room (suite) at their top floor. This was clearly their best room with its own balcony - great view. Next time we visit Rome this is where we are staying.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value of the money”
Reviews.Author: Jafferany
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife and two teenager daughters. I was coming from Venice to stay few days in Rome and do suightseeing. The location of the hotel is extraordinariliy convenient. It is just opposite to Stazione Termini, with a walking distance of 5-7 minutes. The rooms are extraordinarily large not found in Europe generally. The breakfast was delicious. The hotel is equipped with free Wi Fi. Although initially it was not working but the hotel staff helped to restore it efficiently. The staff is very courteous and helpful. One of the front desk staff Anna is very polite, smiling and helpful as well as one of the porters Godwin is very energetic, efficient and helpful. Dont misss to meet with them. Overall I had the best experience and I would certainly recommend to stay with them. I would defenitely prefer to stay with them next time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent staff and clean rooms with free daily drinks.”
Reviews.Author: CaseyBrisbane
Reviews.Content: Rome takes a lot of walking to get around and see the tourist things - this hotel was like a haven and well positioned to take a rest nd a drink prior to going out again. The breakfast was very nice as was the free mini bar non-alcholic drinks. I left some suggestions for improvement such as an iron and ice machine and received an email thanking me and advising they had taken on board my suggestions and were implementing. With the desire to serve their clients like this they will continue to exceed - i look forward to returning!! - hopefully! thanks again

Reviews.Title: “We felt really special”
Reviews.Author: HONEYBLOSSOM45
Reviews.Content: We arrived to a hotel that welcomed us even before we stepped inside. Really friendly helpful staff nothing was too much trouble. Our bedroom was a good size, air conditioned and very clean. Slept really well and had a very tasty breakfast, again the staff were smiling and helpful I don't know if I would be that way at 7.30 in the morning. When we checked out we weren't made to feel that we had to go, but could leave our luggage as our flight wasn't until later that night and when we arrived to pick it up we were given the opportunity to freshen up if we wished. All in all good manners and very friendly staff made are holiday very special. I nearly feel like I am giving away a secret.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fabulous location and very good value.”
Reviews.Author: AussieClaire
Reviews.Content: Staff were super friendly and helpful. Location was great and we could walk to all the sites. Hotel was very clean, nice rooms and good breakfast. Perfect for a weekend away.

Reviews.Title: “A sure bet, they work to exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: traveloften01
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted a hotel close to mass transportation, the hotel is located within walking distance to the Termini train station which is also a hub for the underground train and a large number of bus routes. The area is safe to walk and clean, the area has embassys and goverment buildings surrounding it which helps the overall environment of the area. The front desk attendants were nice courteous and anticipated most of our requests for help and direction. This is the kind of service that can make a good experience last for a long time. If we go back to Rome we'll certainly go back to Hotel Diocleziano.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful - Best Value In Rome!!”
Reviews.Author: eightydays
Reviews.Content: My family, friends and I spent four nights at Hotel Diocleziano before our Mediterranean cruise in August. We chose this hotel because of its proximity to Termini as we had planned a couple of trips out of Rome. We got so much more. The staff is wonderful -- friendly, generous, and caring. The room size is typically of hotels in Europe, but everything is well laid-out so there is no problem. Presumably you are not spending too much time in your room anyway. The bathrooms are clean and spacious, the airconditioning worked really well, the mini-bar had free soft drinks, juices and bottled water, and the hotel provided free internet which we really appreciated. In addition, we got an upgrade, so my husband and I had a huge terrace. Wish we were able to stay longer to really use that space. Although we did not use the small "gym," it appeared well kept and we were able to fill our water bottles with water provided there. The complimentary breakfast was also a big plus -- not really an American buffet, but a lot more than standard Continental fare: scrambled eggs, bacon, cold cuts, cheeses, tomatoes, fresh and canned fruits, pastries ... and cappucino. Considering the prices the hotel charges, I cannot understand the complaints about the breakfast variety. It gave us a great start, and because it opens at 6:45 am, we were able to have breakfast before setting off on our trips outside of Rome. Despite choosing the hotel for its location, I was a bit concerned before our stay based on prior reviews. Yes, the area around Termini is charmless, but definitely safe. In addition, there must have been a major clean-up campaign because the shaded area at the start of Via Gaeta was fine -- nobody hanging around and no smells. A pleasant surprise. Also, if you are used to walking, it isn't that much of a hike to the center and it was easy to get back to the hotel because almost "all roads lead to Termini." For those of you considering a trip to the Eternal City, this hotel is the best value in Rome!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good overnight stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: BettyBlueCat
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as a lone woman traveller on the way back from Tuscany. It was extremely comfortable and clean, and well located near to Termini station. It is not the kind of place I normally go for (I tend to like characterful small boutique hotels- this feels a bit corporate) and it's not somewhere to stay for a long time -- rooms are quite small and there are no places you'd ike to hang out. But it absolutely served a purpose well: professionally run, safe, decent breakfast, kind and friendly staff, and it's not too big and impersonal. I booked it on one of the late booking websites and got an excellent deal too.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAFF-GREATLOCATION-JUST A GREAT HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: Bren100
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights 3 days in May09. Its near 5mins walk from Termini Station, its 5mins walk from Republic Metro and its within 20mins walk from major attractions. The staff were so friendly, the room and bathroom were just perfect, the price was just ok but when you get there you will appreciate its well worth it.
