Breakfast was lovely, not overly plush but very nice and they dont mind you taking food back to your room. Enjoyed this hotel so much I would easily say this hotel is in my top 10 hotels Ive ever stayed in. Only negative is internet wasnt free (for WiFi or in reception).

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location at good price”
Reviews.Author: Lady1971
Reviews.Content: The Leornardo Express from the Fiumicini airport takes about 30 minutes to the Termini station and the hotel is located at 5 minutes walking distance from this Termini staion. A word of advice though, if you are taking the Leornardo express into Termini station do not take the Vis Giovanni Giolitti exit as there are plenty of unregistered taxi guys waiting out there to trick you into taking a taxi. Follow the sign M termini exit instead, from there the hotel is right across the main street. I had read reviews about the area not feeling safe and although the hotel is located in a quite street ( another plus) we never at any point of time felt unsafe even during the nights. La Famiglia, a reasonably priced restaurant is located down the same street. The location is really unbeatable as most of the hop n hopp off buses start from the Termini station and you can walk to all the major sights (takes between 20-30 min) if you do decide to walk. The staff was really helpful and courteous, the breakfast was decent and the rooms clean and quite big for Rome standards. We really enjoyes our stay at this hotel in rome.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great”
Reviews.Author: oshawa_guy
Reviews.Content: Based on previous reviews, we took a chance on this hotel for a trip to Italy with my parents and wife. For our first week we rented a house in Tuscany and then came to Rome for 3 days. This hotel is located in a great spot as everyone else has noted. The breakfast is fine but nothing special. The Internet didn't work in the rooms and was very slow in the lobby. The fitness centre is quite small and has a very low ceiling. My biggest problem was the staff, I found them to be rude and not that great. One night my brother and I came back fairly late and 30 minutes later the front desk called demanding that we come back downstairs to "sign in". I asked why and he didn't speak enough English to tell us why. So no I would not recommend this hotel nor would I stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best as ever”
Reviews.Author: Happy222Tokyo
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. Worthy to stay and no need to look for another hotel. The staff arranged twin beds accoring to our request and welcomed us in very friendly manner. The room was furnished nicely and had a big clean bath. Air- conditioner helps us from Roma summer heat. The breakfast was also great such as a varirty of breads, fresh fruits, drinks. The hotel also offered a free internet. The hotel is 7 miniuts walk from Termini station. While this is the city centre, the hotel is located in the very quiet street so we could open the window during day and night, no disturbance. We highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location, clean and friendly!”
Reviews.Author: mrstewart1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Diocleziano this past week in Rome, and were very happy with our experience! You can't beat Diocleziano's location, especially if you plan to use public transport frequently. We had an early train to Venice for an overnight stay- Termini is a short walk away, down a quiet street facing the station. In addition to the trains, metro stop, shops and restaurants, we took multiple buses from Termini to get to Campo del Fiore, which has no nearby Metro station. Many Roman sights are also within walking distance. Rooms were very clean with a modern, more updated decor. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful with our questions, and called to reserve our visit to the Galleria Borghese. The minibar was restocked daily with free soda and water, which was great considering the heat in late July- it was 90-95 degrees every day of our trip. The aircon/A.C. worked very well, in contrast to where we stayed in Venice. Other thoughts...Internet access is free - don't know about Wifi access. Breakfast was very enjoyable, there was also a bar but didn't seem to get much use. Gym was available, good not great, but walking in the heat was plenty of exercise on its own! Only negative? The bed- the two twin beds combined as a full were a bit stiff for our taste. But for the price, location and service, we were extremely satisfied with our experience and would definitely stay here next time we come to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: PA_FanMan
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel based on the reviews I read here and on our specific preferences: 1. Proximity to Termini - Because our arrival and departure from Rome were both by train, we wanted a hotel within easy walking distance from Termini, so we don't need to pay for taxi. The distance from Termini's front entrance to this hotel was only 300 yards. We knew it will be farther away from most tourist sites, but it didn't matter to us. We didn't want to walk there anyway. We had gotten the Roma Pass, which included 3 days of public transportation, and Termini is a main hub for both public and HOHO buses and the Metro. We were able to save a lot of walking by taking the bus/Metro to everywhere we wanted to visit. We only had to walk at the site and between the nearby sites. For example, we took the Metro to the Spanish Steps, then walked mostly downhill to Piazza Navonna with stops along the way at Prada/Gucci/Dolci...stores (to appease my wife), and visited the Pantheon and the Trevi Fountain. After we had dinner at Navonna, we took the bus back to Termini. If we had stayed somewhere near any of those places, we probably wouldn't have been able to use the public transportation as effectively. 2. A Newer Facility - Call us prejudiced, but we prefer newer or newly refurbished properties. We have heard too many horror stories, and experienced some ourselves, about older properties with the musty smells, creaky floors, questionable A/C, etc. This hotel is only a few years old, so just about everything felt new 3. High Quality Service and Amenities - Everyone at the hotel was so friendly and helpful! The breakfast was wonderfully prepared and ready for us each morning. Unlike what we read about other properties, there were plenty of seating. In the 3 days we stayed there, we always had a choice of tables. They offered scrambled eggs and bacons, pastries/croissants, along with the typical cuts of cheese, meat, and fruits. In the room, they provided daily non-alcoholic drinks in a small refrigerator. They offer all the standard convenience items in the bathroom. They offer free in-room wifi service (started in late June) as well as a public computer in lobby. For those who needs more exercises than walking all day, there's a nicely equiped gym along with a sauna. 4. Good Value - I'm a sucker to good value. The price we booked for a superior room at this hotel can't be beat by any comparable level properties closer to the many tourist sites. If there wasn't a Roma Pass and if the public transportation wasn't so convenient, we wouldn't have bothered. But, since they were, we found this hotel to be the best choice for us! As for the other major downside to its location that other reviewers mentioned - questionable security at nights - we didn't have any problems. It was quieter than most tourist locations, but we never felt unsafe. We had dinners at 2 nearby restaurants (Babbo's and La Lampada). Both were within a few blocks of the hotel, and we felt very comfortable walking to and back from the restaurant. In fact, we found the quietness to our liking after a long day of crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty average”
Reviews.Author: lmccu81
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Diocleziano for 5 nights in July. After searching through many hotels in Rome we decided that this was the best 4*, based on the lovely photos and fabulous reviews. This hotel is nice, but nothing special. Based on other hotels I've stayed in I would definately not rate it as 4* but 3*. The staff were friendly, and spoke fairly good English and the hotel was clean and fairly modern. The room was however quite small and the bathroom was a terrible layout (you had to squeeze round the toilet to get into the shower and to sit on the toilet you virtually had to put your legs inside the shower.) The minibar in the room was free and was refilled each day, however it only contained 1 bottle of water, Coke and Fanta, (no snacks or alcohol.) Although the hotel is close to the station, it isn't in the best of areas. During the day it's fine and an easy walk to the station or bus terminal, (less than 5 minutes,) however at night this area doesn't feel terribly safe. There are a lot of homeless people hanging around, and after dark the area is fairly quiet compared to other parts of the city. The hotel itself is down a fairly secluded side street, and the road leading from it to the station reeked with the smell of urine each day, (not very nice in 36 the degree heat!) Taxi drivers also found the hotel difficult to locate and even when given the street name generally went to the other end of the street, which crosses a more major road. All in all I'd say that this is a nice enough hotel for the price, providing you can afford to get taxis to and from it after dark. However if I went back to Rome I'd stay closer to the Trevi Fountain or Pantheon area, which is more central if you want to explore Rome by foot and be close to the shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Waterloosunset1
Reviews.Content: As per the other reviews I would say this is an excellent hotel. I have been to quite a few around the world and this is one of the best. All of the staff are very friendly, it is spotlessly clean, everything looks brand new and the aircon works well - it was really hot in Rome and it was vital for me that the aircon in the room worked well which it did. Also the breakfast buffet was really good. The hotel also has a pretty good brand new small gym. I thought the location was fine because it was easy to find just 5 mins from the station and although it was a 20 min walk into the centre it was so easy to jump on a bus at the termini bus station across the road where the buses are regular and go everywhere. It was also just as easy getting back because they all head back to the main station. The trip into the centre takes 5 mins on the bus. I would imagine that for a similar hotel in the centre that the price would be double so unless money is no object I would advise you to stay here. Its well worth getting a Roma card which gets you into two main attractions free and gives you 3 days unlimited travel on the bus.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with great features.”
Reviews.Author: slapnut
Reviews.Content: As soon as you walk in the door of this hotel you can tell it is all class, walking up from the road gives you a different impression but once through the front doors it all changes. Breakfast was sensational, the rooms are great, staff are very friendly and helpful, you would have to be very fussy to find any fault with this hotel, it is close to some fantastic eateries such as La Famiglia (great food and wine) the best starters buffet ever. There are heaps of internet cafe's and the best laundromat (were you just give all your washing to the guy inside and give him 10 Euros and come back 2 hours later to have it washed, dryed and folded. We dropped all our laundry off before heading out to dinner (usually La Famiglia) and picked it up on the way home. No complaints here.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel”
Reviews.Author: waltzian
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 nights at this hotel and truly impressed. The staff is just incredibly friendly and helpful. They all were not just nice, but very warm and welcoming. And I mean all of them: The door guy, the cleaning staff, the breakfast staff and of course everyone at the reception, day and night. Where else is the cleaning staff constantly greeting you, and when you leave the breakfast room, someone gives you a nice "bye, thank you" through the whole room? Our room was a good size, had good a/c and a comfortable bed. But most of all, it was really clean. My partner is extremely picky when it comes to cleanliness, and she was very happy with this hotel. In fact, it was the cleanest hotel-room we ever stayed in. By chance, we got a superior room, although we booked a normal one, so we got a whirlpool. This was a nice feature, but I would not pay extra for it (although my partner probably would). The breakfast was very good. There is a good selection of stuff to eat, very good fruit juices, and more. Btw, we recognized that some people ordered extra coffee from the staff, so we did too, and got very good cappuccinos instead of the not-so-good coffee at the buffet. The extras offered by the hotel are amazing: every evening, the minibar is filled with just the right amount of free drinks after a hot day in Rome, and there is a selection of shampoo, bathing foam, and much more in the bathroom. We also liked the slippers to stroll around with in your room (or, as some people do, in the breakfast room). The whole hotel is very nicely built. All common rooms are bight, spacious and look and feel valuable. Two cons: First, the location is not perfect. It takes you some minutes to come into the centre by foot or public transport. But its perfectly fine. There are stations at Termini and Repubblica. Tourist buses leave at Repubblica. The neighbourhood was fine for us, we never felt unsafe. All in all, we thought the location is ok, because it may be a bit off, but it is very, very quiet at night. Second con: low water pressure in our room, but not too bad. All in all, an exceptional hotel. We will definitely go there again, if we go back to Rome. Still impressed by the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Diocleziano is 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: pupidda122505
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Diocleziano was by far our favorite hotel during our 14 day trip in Italy. We spent 6 nights here and if we’re lucky enough to return to Rome one day we will definitely make Diocleziano our home during our stay again. As soon as we were greeted by the bellboy we immediately felt at home. There are not enough words to describe how helpful and friendly the staff was – Giordano in particular gave us many tips and was always willing to answer our many questions. Our room on the 1st floor was very spacious and the bathroom was big as well. Our room was kept extremely clean during our entire stay and the cleaning service really did go out of their way to ensure that the room was cleaned before we returned from touring. We enjoyed the free drinks in the refrigerator and really felt that this was a great touch. We were in Rome during a heat wave and there was nothing better than coming back to our room after a long day of touring and have cold drinks waiting for us that we didn’t have to pay for at the end of our stay. The free breakfast was the best we had in all of Italy. After almost 2 weeks eating croissants, it was great to have scrambled eggs, bacon and toast. They also had hard boiled eggs, cereals, fruits, cakes, croissants, small rolls, salami etc. Their American coffee was also the best we had during our trip. The location of the hotel was excellent. It’s less than a 5 minute walk to the Stazione Termini which we used everyday to take the metro to the major attractions. Not once during our entire stay did we feel unsafe. The area is not dangerous, but like any major city you need to be aware of your surroundings and just be cautious when walking at night. The hotel is also very close to two great restaurants: La Famiglia and Babbo’s. We ate at La Famiglia three times for lunch and Babbo’s three times for dinner. La Famiglia is not a tourist trap, in fact its patrons are mostly all locals and the food is typical Roman cuisine. Babbo’s is also not a tourist trap and offers exceptional food at reasonable prices. Hotel Diocleziano exceeded our expectations and we look forward to returning there very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Nice new rooms. Location near train station.”
Reviews.Author: curlymin00
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very clean, new hotel with lots of pluses- free wireless internet access, free gym and sauna, free breakfast, discounted tour packages. The room was very nice- great mattresses and air conditioned. Free minibar. the only downside is that it was right by the train station- the area is a few stops away from the attractions, but there is no noise at all. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “It's All Good”
Reviews.Author: nzlynn
Reviews.Content: I just have to agree with all of the good reviews about this hotel. I too can rave about the cleanliness of the hotel, the cheerful and helpful staff, and the excellent location near the Termini station. We had a really long flight to endure to finally arrive at the Diocleziano but immediately felt at home after the warm, friendly and helpful welcome we received. We enjoyed a deep sleep in the air conditioned, double glazed room. The breakfast buffet was pleasant and plenty of it. We will stay again if we ever get the chance.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT MODERN HOTEL! WE LOVED IT.”
Reviews.Author: mijinaLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great location, a 5 minute walk from the Termini Station. I like that they had high speed internet, and a workout room. The rooms were VERY comfortable and CLEAN! Strong AC which is helpful during summer days :) Excellent service and nice staff. They also gave some good restaurant suggestions. They also have an elevator which is helpful when you are carrying luggage. Excellent free continental breakfast. I’d definitely stay here again. Also about a 15 – 20 minute walk to other great sites such as the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain. Cons: Can’t think of any. Great value!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: danmel10
Reviews.Content: Great location. Great room. Great services and welcome from people from the hotel

Reviews.Title: “A VERY GOOD CLEAN MODERN HOTEL WITH VERY HELPFULL STAFF”
Reviews.Author: HAVINGFUNAberdeen
Reviews.Content: We throughly enjoyed our stay and would recommend the hotel indeed, receptionist was very helpfull indeed in giving us advice and guidance.

Reviews.Title: “What if all hotels were like Hotel Diocleziano?”
Reviews.Author: mariusmyk
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome by train after a few relaxing days on the Tuscan coast. The hotel was only a short walk from the Termini station, so although we carried quite a lot of luggage, there was no need for a taxi. Moreover, the hotel's vicinity to sights like piazza navona and the spanish steps could of course be better. Most of the sights are within walking distance though, and if your feet are tired, the metro is always an option. The stations closest to Hotel Diocleziano is Termini and Piazza della Repubblica. Upon arrival we were greeted by very friendly faces, the piccolo helped us with our luggage and showed us to our room. We stayed in room 205, which was a twin room with separable beds. The room was just the right size, and because of tje high ceeling, it did not feel claustrophobic in any way. The minibar was free of charge, but only contained soft drinks and bottled water. Nevertheless, a nice geisture. One thing that must be mentioned when reviewing this hotel, is their breakfast. Italian hotels normally offer a very limited breakfast, but in Diocleziano we got a full continental breakfast with scrambled eggs and bacon every morning. This made the start of our busy days in rome so much better. Bravo! For our departure, we decided to book a taxi to the airport in order to avoid the stress of termini station and the leonardo express train. However, the reception staff had a better idea: For just a few € extra, they could offer us a car service that was supposed to be both safer and more convinient than a taxi. This turned out to be just right. When we was checked out the morning of departure, there was a black mercedes and a nicely dress chaffeur waiting for ous outside the hotel. This service dotted the i and crossed the t of our stay in rome. If something were to be critisized, I can say that there could have been WiFi hotspots in the rooms. Thank you for a delightful stay! Note: Although this hotel is great, everyone who travels to Rome should be aware that the area around Termini station, in which Hotel Diocleziano lies, is full of pickpockets! We were exposed to them twice during our stay, so keep your valuables safe and keep your eyes open!

Reviews.Title: “Super-Friendly Concierge, Great Value, Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: NYCProfessor
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at Hotel Diocleziano in Rome because of the great reviews I had read on Trip Advisor. Because we were flying round trip from New York to Rome, we stayed at Hotel Diocleziano for 4 days upon our arrival in Rome, and then after travelling around Rome, we stayed at Hotel Diocleziano for 1 day before flying out of the airport. We liked Hotel Diocleziano during our initial stay, and after comparing it to the other hotels and returning a second time, we realized it was indeed a great discovery! I found the concierge staff to be really nice and friendly. They understood English very well, and when I tried to practice a few Italian phrases, they were always very encouraging. There is a beautiful gym facility on the ground floor, and it included equipment, television, and what looked like two bathrooms/streamrooms. Our hotel room was clean, with free sodas (a coke, a water, a fanta, and either an apple or a pear juice) in the minibar. The buffet breakfast includes several meats, cereals, eggs and bacon, pastries, coffee, and cappuccinos (upon request). The hotel does offer internet access via two terminals in the lobby; my only suggestion would be for Hotel Diocleziano to consider installing wireless internet, which they could charge customers for. Also, upon our second stay, the concierge and staff remembered us! We were quite suprised at this. Also, there is a really wonderful restaurant around the corner named Babbo's Pizzeria Steak and Fish (Via Volturno 9/11/13) that had some really wonderful food at very affordable prices (several fish dishes were under 10 Euros). The next time I'm in Rome, I'd definitely stay at Hotel Diocleziano again!

Reviews.Title: “They Will Not Honor Your Reseration if a Better Deal Comes Along”
Reviews.Author: Gallina7
Reviews.Content: I booked a room with Expedia and confirmed late arrival with hotel by email. Arrived as planned to be told they gave away the room and booked us elsewhere. New hotel was inferior, small dark room, pay Wi-fi, bad A/C. Was told that Diocleziano does this all the time, had been informed that the room at the new hotel was inferior, but they didn't care. Maybe the reviews are good, but you cannot trust this place to honor their commitments.

Reviews.Title: “Am recommending to all who visit Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Wolfhousen
Reviews.Content: The location was great - walking distance to shops, restaurants, and train terminal. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: JMac123
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2-night stay at the Hotel Diocleziano at the end of a cruise. The hotel had a great location (I was a little worried as the area around the Termini station can be seedy, but this is off in a nice, quite area). We took the subway and buses several times and it was great having this within a 5 minute walk. The rooms were nice although a bit small. Very clean though and our air conditioner atually seemed to work quite well even though it was fairly warm out. Seems like it might be a bit of a problem if it gets to be during a heat wave. The staff were excellent and arranged transportation from the port in Rome to the hotel and also a taxi to the airport for quite a bit less than what we could have obtained on our own. I dealt mostly with Diego (the hotel manager) and Giordano at the front desk and both were very friendly and accommodating. Could of things that could be improved upon that have been mentioned previously- Diet Coke (Coca-Lite) should be an option in the fridge and the mattesses were not the most comfortable. Great job apart from that.

Reviews.Title: “The staff was very helpful in making arrangements for all our needs.”
Reviews.Author: bearlover51
Reviews.Content: The service was great. The staff made arrangements for restaurants, taxis, and museums that were wonderful. The room was on the small side but the bed was comfortable. We did not spend much time in the room so the size was not that important. The mini bar was stocked with drinks that were free of charge. The hotel had a nice exercise room with showers. They had 2 computers in the lobby that you could use for a nominal fee. The location was perfect. It was a short 5 - 10 minute walk to either the train station or metro station. The breakfast was good. There was nothing that we did not like about this hotel. We would definetly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “An Excelent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SeniorTravelers2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I found this hotel to be excelent, it is in a very central location and the rooms were very comfortable, it represented very good value. The staff were all very helpful and Emily provided us with the most friendly and beautiful breakfast every morning. I rate this hotel very highly.

Reviews.Title: “A clean and safe value centrally located in Rome”
Reviews.Author: hpinera
Reviews.Content: This was a good hotel and great value in Rome. The service at the hotel was excellent. While the rooms were small (by American standards) they were clean and updated. The hotel is in a good location with all of the main Roman attractions within walking or short transit trip away from the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful! A Quiet Oasis in Busy Area”
Reviews.Author: EuroWhenever
Reviews.Content: We spent three days at the Diocleziano in late May and had a grand time there. It's amazing how a hotel can be so close to the main train station in a world capital and still be quiet and almost cloistered. While no more than a 10 minute walk from Termini, the Diocleziano sits on a side street with very little traffic. When you step in the front door, the feeling is one of mellow comfort. Rooms are quiet, tasteful and functional with well-appointed bathrooms. Other reviewers have made mention of the free mini-bar, certainly a nice touch. The buffet breakfast is excellent, with great variety and fresh ingredients. There is a small, but aparatus-filled, gym and two computers are available for complimentary use on the ground floor. All of these contribute to the good feelings I have about the hotel. But the separator is the hospitality and service that the staff exhibits. On numerous occasions, the desk clerks were helpful and the entire staff seemed genuinely happy to assist. Ironically, I chose the Diocleziano because of the proximity to the train station and ended up using hired drivers to get us from the airport and to the port of Civitavecchia (both of which the hotel arranged). However, I wouldn't have changed my selection for an instant. My wife and I look forward to returning here again on our next trip to Rome. (Note: easy walking distance to Galleria Borghese, Spanish Steps, some great churches by Bernini and Borromini, and more.)

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: CET68
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a central location near the Termini station which was convenient for the buses and the sightseeing hop on hop off bus. It was about 5 minutes walk to the Piazza Repubblica and about 20 minutes walk to the Piazza Venezia annd the Colosseum. Many restaurants and cafe's in the area. The hotel staff were very polite and friendly and the rooms were cleaned well on a daily basis. We had a triple room for our 5 night stay, which was slightly short on space but adequate for our needs. There was a selection of items available for breakfast, buffet style, which set us up for the day's sightseeing. Would recommend an early start when visiting the Vatican city to get there before the tour buses and the queues. I had my elderly parents with me and we discovered that over 65 UK residents can enter the colosseum for free on proof of ID. Not many public toilets and those that can be found are not pleasant to use. Very interesting city and thoroughly enjoyed it, even though the value of the pound made it quite expensive. PS the ice-cream was good!

Reviews.Title: “This great hotel made our stay in Rome very happy”
Reviews.Author: Pianoman42
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, having booked a superior room and being given room 103 - the one with a terrace, and with a Jacuzzi and lovely breakfasts, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Hotel Diocleziano. The service was great, from the smiling and ever helpful reception staff, right through to the restaurant and porters. Excellent location made getting about Rome very easy. Without doubt we would book here again. What is value? A great experience, and great memories. My wife especially appreciated the concern on the day she had a migraine.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: CheshirePhil69xxxx
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here 20-22 May 2009 (3 nights) and it is a great hotel (www.hoteldiocleziano.it) It is a 5-10 minute walk from the Termini station, which is convenient when you fly into Fiumcino airport (30 mins using the non-stop express: 11 Euros per person for a single ticket). Rome is a busy and noisy 24/7 city, so I wanted to stay somewhere close enough to the centre but not IN the centre - the Diocleziano fits the bill well. The hotel is 4 stars and felt it: air-conditioned rooms; generous beds; free mini-bar stocked with bottled water and soft drinks (updated daily!); courteous and friendly staff. The breakfast is included and is self-service. It comprises tea, coffee, selection of juices, toast, cereals, yoghurt, cold ham/salami, cheese and tomatoes. The selection was great and replenished often. The breakfast room is spacious and you could eat what you liked and as much as you liked. The hotel has a bar but we never used it. Our room was neither huge nor small, but was certainly big enough for a couple in a capital city (double bed, ensuite, TV). It had air-conditioning (controlled by us) and apparently we stayed in the hottest May in Rome for 200 years! Daily temps hit 30C, 32C and 29C so the air-con was a must. The hotel area is fine even though it is not in the centre of the city. There are plenty (10-15) restaurants within a 5 minute walk (2 literally around the corner, 1 min away) so there is enough choice for a short break. There were no downsides. Yes, Rome is noisy, but that's to be expected. But we had double-glazed windows so the noise was not a problem at night. Keeping the aircon on all night was noisy but if you switched it off the room because too hot - probably not an issue if you travel when the days aren't 32C! The hotel is 5 mins from the Republica metro or about a 30 min walk to the Colisseum, eg via Via Cavour. The staff were friendly and all spoke English. The hotel is good value for money (£550 for 3 nights) though it would be even better if the Pound to Euro wasn't so poor at the moment. We didn't try any of the hotel facilities so can't comment. For a longer break than 3 days you *could* consider a more central location but then it would be noisier at night. Overall I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone. Rome is a beautiful city and Hotel Diocleziano complements this very well. 10/10!

Reviews.Title: “how all hotels should be”
Reviews.Author: uk69
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights with this being our first trip to Rome. Location is perfect, near to Termini but in a quiet side street overlooking the Rome museum. What was the one thing that made this hotel perfect? the staff. Everyone, from the maid to the manager, had a smile and a welcome for us. Courteous and attentive without being pushy they made the stay a trip to remember. Eating out is very expensive but fortunately just around the corner from the hotel is "bobba's" - excellent food and reasonably priced (for Rome!). The rooms are clean, well appointed and as others have said the 'soft' mini-bar was very welcome after a day tramping the streets. The shower in our room (406) was a little difficult to get in and out of due to its position and an older, or larger, traveller with less mobility may struggle. Rooms were quiet and the aircon worked well. I can heartily recommend Diocleziano, you wouldn't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “the best”
Reviews.Author: Egid
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in July 2008 for 8 nights, but forgot to write a review. Now i'm on tripadvisor searching for a hotel for my upcoming summer holiday i want to take the opportunity to thank the staff and the hotel because they deserved it. When i'm reading the reviews which are posted the last weeks i'm happy to see that nothing has changed. Unfortunately also not the position 16 in the rating which was the same when we where visting Rome, to be honset this should be much higher. The Hotel rooms are really perfect, nice quit airco well maintained and modern with a very nice bed and of course the free minibar which is a very warm welcome when you enter you room after a long day exploring the city. Termini station is only a few hundred meters away which makes the location perfect. Connection to the metro and bus can not be better. You can buy a ticket for 7 days for subway (metro), bus and tram for 11 Euro per person at the small shops at the bus stand. When you take the bus at the evening to go to the several romantic areas in Rome, it takes you only ten minutes and till deep in the night you can come back to the hotel, which is by the way in a quit street without traffic noise The staff is very helpfull and when you ask for a nice restaurant they will not send you to one which is known to tourists but to the one which they like themselves. In this way you will expierence the nice romantic parts of rome which makes the evenings one of them which will stay in your memories for ever. Thanks again for everything and i hope you will be number 1 because you and the hotel really deserve it. Egid & Tiffany the Netherlands

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: fmallant
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights in Rome and were absolutely delighted with this hotel ( 4 stars). Very central to the train/ metro /bus station. The hotel is on a quiet ( very clean) street, no noise in the rooms. The room (standard) was spacious with a beautiful bathroom with bath. The soft drinks in the minibar are free The breakfast was lovely. The staff was welcoming and helpful. Where can I find a better hotel in ROME?

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: WideOpenMind
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife at this hotel in April. Everything about this hotel displays the care and attention of a motivated, courteous and intelligent staff. From the front desk staff to the room attendants the level of service exceeded my expectation. The location is fine; convenient to public transport yet quiet. The rooms aren't large but are well laid out and well appointed. The daily complimentary soft drinks and water left in the room mini bar will be appreciated after a days sightseeing/commuting around Rome. When I am returning to Rome I will use this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “An idyllic treasure-central, chic and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Lorraine29Ireland
Reviews.Content: We spent a few nights in Rome as part of our honeymoon tour of Italy and were absolutely delighted with this hotel. While incredibly central to the train/ metro station, making all our exploring easy, the hotel is on a quiet street, meaning you have none of the noise and hawkers you might expect to find in such a central location. The room on the fifth floor with its own terrace was bliss, the soft drinks in the minibar are free, the cute toiletries chic, the breakfast lovely. All the staff were so welcoming and helpful - I was only sorry not to be spending longer there. I will definitely be back!!

Reviews.Title: “An unexpected delight”
Reviews.Author: 1redrose
Reviews.Content: This hotel is everything I could have wanted by the time we got to Rome. It is a 3 minute walk from the train station and the Metro, but remarkably quiet and serene and in a good neighborhood [national museum next door]. The staff was more than cordial, the breakfast the best we found in Italy, and the room was spacious and comfortable. I would love to go back to Rome just to stay in this hotel, and I mean it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Finezze”
Reviews.Author: pgeorgiou
Reviews.Content: Located away from the buzz but very close to the train station and within easy reach of the centre. Warm and helpfull staff. Simple and practical room and bathroom. Quality soaps and Shampoos replenished daily. Friendly and cosy atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Oolitic_Shoals
Reviews.Content: Great three star hotel - very friendly and helpful staff - clean - comfortable rooms - great Italian breakfasts - quiet - close to metro stations on small side street with little traffic. Small fridge in room with free soda and water. No restaurant in hotel, but nearby there were several - including Babbo's around the corner which was excellent. Room was small and not plush, but very adequate when you need a clean comfortable place to rest after a long day walking in Rome. One other small negative was the location near main train station where we found what seemed to be more than average homeless in the general vicintiy. I could not give this hotel four stars as per the sign, but I would still recommend it highly as a great Rome experience and an obviously well run establishment. However, if you are looking for a Marriott or Hilton hotel experience - this is probably not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “What a friendly accomodation!!”
Reviews.Author: laikiytonia
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife spent three days on january in Rome. We choose Hotel Diocleziano because it seemed to be a little gem and there was available a weekend offer at less than 350 euros for the entire stay. The choose was perfect! A very friendly staff gave us a very warm welcome and made our stay extremely pleasant. The room was extremely clean and quiet (we got a room on the rear of the building with a spacious and comfortable double bed). All the most attractive places were 15/20 minutes walking distance and all the public transportation, metro and buses, were nearby 100/200 metres. We had breakfast in a natural bright breakfast room, high quality food and good selection. All very impressive!

Reviews.Title: “Never so impressed with a hotel”
Reviews.Author: TNclogger09
Reviews.Content: I searched for days to find a hotel in Rome. Not knowing the city, I wanted just the right location in a good part of town. After hours and hours of surfing and reading reviews, I came across the Hotel Diocleziano. I read nothing but good reviews and it was located just across from the Termini, which I thought was a plus. The hotel was very unassuming on the outside, but when we walked in the front door, I was amazed. It was beautiful. Brand new. The breakfast was incredible, with eggs and bacon, plus all of the usual continental offerings. The room we were in was large and the bathroom was larger than mine at home, again all brand new and decorated beautifully. After reading horror stories in other reviews about the size of the rooms and bath, I was very pleasantly surprised. If the weather had cooperated, it would have been a walk from most attractions, but as it was, we booked tours through the hotel. Now here is where it really gets good. We booked a private car transfer from the aiport based on recommendations of the staff before we arrived. That was the best decision we made the whole trip. Only 99 euros round trip and the driver was waiting for us with a sign (even though our flight was delayed by one half hour). Then the tours we booked, which were wonderful, each agreed to deliver us to the hotel after. On 3 different trips this did not happen. They put us out fairly close, but especially the first time when we didn't have a clue where we were, it was very scary. The manager and staff got in touch with the tour company on 2 different occasions trying to straighten it out. We eventually cancelled the last tour since it was at night and we didn't want to chance it, even though the hotel manager had gone to bat for us once again, at that point I didn't trust the tour company. The hotel even went so far as to write a letter to the head of customer service of the tour company and in turn the tour company offered us a partial refund after we got home. Now that is customer service. I would recommend Hotel Diocleziano to anyone travelling to Rome. It's one of Rome's best kept treasures.

Reviews.Title: “Great friendly little hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Nicky F
Reviews.Content: Having read the reveiws on trip advisor i thought it would be a safe bet to book a double superior at the hotel diocleziano, i wasnt wrong its a really nice hotel situated off a quiet street just a stone throw from the termini station. The jacuzzi bath was a great bonus which we used alot and was very relaxing, also the complimentory mini bar with free soft drinks only was a plus. The room itself wasnt very big, but very comfortable and clean. i would recomend the hotel diocleziano. Nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jorpelo
Reviews.Content: Nice spacy and quiet clean room, with ecxellent breakfast. Very polite and friendly staff. Good location, near metro.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: KOSTASVassilika
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, very clean and comfortable. Very good breakfast The hit of hotel is the bathroom with hydro massage

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in easy walking distance to mostly everything”
Reviews.Author: EssiMacGregor
Reviews.Content: My mother and I wanted to go to Rome and I did not have much time to look for a hotel. We wanted to stay in Rome proper and not somewhere in the outskirts, but also did not want to pay too much. I read the reviews on the Diocleziano on Tripadvisor and went by those suggestions. As mentioned in other reviews, the hotel is close to the main train station and is easy to get to from both airports. It is in easy walking distance to the main sights of the city. It is situated not quite in the city center, more on the edge of it. I was quite happy that I had chosen the Diocleziano. It is an excellent hotel for the price: clean, comfy, friendly and safe. As mentioned, for sights and food one has to walk between ten and fifteen minutes into the city. There is no restaurant or snack place at the corner. Although I do recall seeing a couple of snack places close by, I do not remember whether they were open at night. The amenities in the hotel were excellent. The beds were good. I tend to get back aches with most mattresses. I had no problems here. There was a desk, a small tv that had the regular Italian TV channels plus a German and a Spanish TV channel. The bathroom was very spacious. Our room, however, had the bathtub in a corner with shower stall walls installed on the tub. It was a little difficult to get into the tub for a shower. I think for somebody with hip or knee problems, this might be a little problematic. Breakfast was included in the price. The little restaurant downstairs was nice, with plenty of food. I think they serve breakfast until ten thirty in the morning, which is nice if you want to sleep in. The girl cleaning the tables and filling the food trays was a little overworked one day because she was alone that morning - the other days, there were two of them - and we had to wait for a few minutes to get a table cleared. My mother, however, is rather easy going, she started to clear the table that she wanted by herself, which got us immediate attention and the table was cleared and laid within a matter of minutes. The hotel offers a car service to the airport for a fixed price, which, if you prefer going by cab, could be a life saver. The traffic in Rome is so bad that it might take you a few hours standing in traffic to get to an airport. Paying by the meter would be prohibitively expensive in that case. We took the airport bus from and to Ciampino which arrives at and leaves from Termini, the main train station. This is a good low budget option, but we also got stuck in traffic. Make sure you leave way ahead of time when flying out, otherwise you'll miss your flight. All in all, I would recommend the hotel to "normal" travelers, families, regular travelers without party or romantic aspirations, families with kids and similar people. It's not a party place and it's not close to party places, it is not overly romantic, but it is excellent value for the price and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Preferred Hotel Diocleziano to Westin Excelsior”
Reviews.Author: CardsFan59
Reviews.Content: My daughters (ages 20 and 16) and I stayed one week in May 2008. We had reserved a triple but found the room too small for a week's stay. The General Manager offered several options, from which we chose two rooms at a reasonable price. The rooms were very comfortable, newly furnished, and clean. Breakfast (included) was not extravagant but quite good and always fresh. The location is convenient. What set this hotel apart, however, was the extraordinary service we received beginning the first day. From the General Manager down, every employee was helpful and kind. Alitalia lost one of our bags, and the staff kept in communication with the airline and provided me daily e-mail updates. The recommendations for restaurants were superb and included several that were within walking distance, very reasonably priced, with outstanding food. One experience in particular exemplifies the level of service we received. I wanted to purchase a vase from a nearby shop. The vendors spoke no English. The GM helped me negotiate the price and researched shipping options for me. He then asked one of his staff to accompany me to Poste Italiano and handle the insurance and shipping. Of course the vase broke in transit. When Poste Italiano denied my claim, I wrote it off as a life lesson. The GM did not. He prosecuted the claim for several months on my behalf and recovered the money I paid for the vase as well as for the shipping. When I offered to split the proceeds with him for his substantial effort, he politely declined and wire-transferred the full amount to my account. I have stayed previously at the Westin Excelsior. For comfort, value, and service, I would choose the Hotel Diocleziano for my next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: smyth7
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just brilliant. We got the teravision bus from ciampino which left us at termini station and the hotel is just a few mins walk. It is extremly clean with polished floors everywhere and the staff are extremly nice. the room was really nice,well heated, and had a free minibar with soft drinks. At €700 for seven nights it was great value. There is a fabulous trattoria just down the road called famiglia where we ate every night which was very handy after a long days sightseeing. Overall a superb hotel, in a great location, beside a great restaurant. P.S The breakfast buffet was brilliant with lots of choice and fabulous coffee.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: Misti27
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in close proximity to the train station and in walkable distance to most sighseeings in Rome. The room was spotless clean and the hotel stuff was more than helpfull and polite. The breakfast buffet had a great selection for all different kind of tastes. There was free mini bar with non alcoholic drinks in the room (restocked every day). What more can anyone ask? It was perfect and we will definately stay there again when we go back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas as it should be”
Reviews.Author: ralama
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights during the Christmas period '08. I want to say that the hotel and the staff were great. The hotel is very well located (very close to the metro!). The room was nice, clean and big enough (tip: ask for a room with a bath),. The breakfast was good. The staff was very friendly and always willing to help us in finding the best restaurants, and having a sauna was a great luxury after exploring Rome for a full day. Conclusion: I would have given this hotel a 4 1/2 star rating if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to explore Rome.”
Reviews.Author: stegab
Reviews.Content: The Diocleziano is a very good hotel, has very friendly and helpful staff, has an excellent location, and all this for a very attractive price. We were more than positively suprised by the very central location of this pretty new hotel (5 min walking distance to/from the train station Termini) and the silence we found there. We could open the windows of our room at night and it was quiet (yes!) . We explored Rome from here by foot. Once again, perfect. 2 minutes walking and you are at the Piazza della Repubblica. Or, within the same time, inside the basilica Santa Maria degli Angeli e dei Martiri. Nice restaurants are reachable by foot within minutes. Thanks to the hotel manager Diego and his crew for making our stay sooooooo wonderful. Stefan & Gabi

Reviews.Title: “Solid option”
Reviews.Author: BaldEagleWings
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and nice. The staff was very professional and attentive. The rooms are very small. The free stocked bar was a bonus. The room rate we received was very good relative to other options. The location of the hotel is within walking distance to the train station which was great upon our return from Florence - when we checked into the hotel. Having previously explored the city, areas closer to the river are more scenic (and in my opinion, more desirable) but you can't beat the overall value for this hotel. If you want a good deal at a clean and nice hotel (near the train station), this is a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and convinient”
Reviews.Author: Finpol
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is friendly and helpful. You feel really welcome there. Rooms are spacious and clean, equipped with all what you need. The only improvement could be done reg. TV and radio channel choice, which is quite poor for non-Italian guest.

Reviews.Title: “Best Ever!”
Reviews.Author: bankerLondon
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at Hotel Diocleziano. The hotel was perfectly positioned a 5 minute walk from Termini station (and a big sign along the way points out the direction of the hotel) and the main sights are only a 20 minute walk away. The room was immaculate (the cleanest room I have ever stayed in) and the service by the hotel staff was wonderful. We were recommended a delightful family run trattoria near the hotel which served good food at a cheap price (however we noticed that everyone else also had a map of rome - so maybe all hotels recommend it?). The included breakfast was great - continental or american; and it was a valued rareity to find out that the mini bar was free each day!! Definately recommend Hotel Diocleziano.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Diocleziano - Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Reggie2008
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Diocleziano for 4 nights in September 2008 on vacation with my girlfriend. We were given a room on the top floor with a King size bed. The room was modern and very clean and we had a beautiful terrace with a table for breakfast and amazing views of Rome. The only real downside to the room was that the bed was a little hard. The hotel also offered breakfast each morning included with the cost of the hotel. It included pasties, cereal, eggs, proscuitto, cheese, juice, coffee etc. The breakfast was a great way to start the day and the cappucino's were one of the highlights of our trip. Location wise...the hotel was a very short walk to the Termini and some great local family restaurants. For the most part we are able to walk to the major historic sites, but none of the walks are super short so if you want to take Rome on by foot, be prepared to walk a few miles. Overall, the staff was very friendly and helpful. They were able to recommend some great restaurants, provide maps and directions and assist with cabs and reservations. I would consider this hotel a good value and would have no reservations about staying there again on my next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Tricky find, but worth the effort”
Reviews.Author: ontheqt
Reviews.Content: As a last-minute holiday, it was not easy to find a hotel in Rome for a price that was right in the right location. We plumped for proximity to Termini (where the Metro lines cross and the Leonardo express goes), but would probably go somewhere more lively next time. The hotel was easy to find from Termini and the staff very helpful. The room was clean, the bed comfortable, the breakfast good (continental) and plentiful and the Sauna was welcome after a hard day sightseeing. The location should have been good, but it wasn't one that we wanted to spend time in the evening (the trat. round the corner made the best quality meals we had in Rome though), so we made full use of travel pass to get back to busier parts of town.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshingly clean”
Reviews.Author: muguette
Reviews.Content: We, a group of three couples, spent three nights at this hotel and we all agree that it was a great choice. The staff is extremely helpful and friendly, the hotel and rooms spotless. A breakfast buffet was included, as was the use of the sauna and (small) gym. The standard rooms are small, but comfortable. If you want more space, ask for the superior rooms, that also have a bath/jacuzzi. The central station (Termini) is a five minute walk away, which makes exploring Rome by subway and/or bus so easy.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OniLink
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last January (I know a bit late on my review) and the staff is wonderful, they have a buffet breakfast every morning and the location of it is spot on. There is internet (no wi-fi though) on each room and my only complaint would be the lack of room service. The rooms are always clean and very quiet at night. Absolutely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further than here for a central Rome hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yorkshirelad34
Reviews.Content: Large clean room, friendly helpful staff, very adequate breakfast but most of all superbly positioned! It only took us 10mins walking - with cases - from Hotel room to a seat on the Leonardo express. Its location down a quiet side street meant you had the feeling of being in the coutryside! In fact the air conditioning was all one could hear unless you really tried! We walked everywhere and it is ideally situated so to do but if you wanted public transport it is all to hand at Termini with its trains, metro and buses. Only two minor points: 1) No in-room tea/coffee making facilities, quite surprising for a Hotel of this obvious quality. 2) Its secluded location can make it annoying to find, very poorly led by myself it took us about half an hour! So a tip for when you go - stand with your back to Termini and across the main roads to the front are the old Roman baths. Walk to the right of the bus station, cross the main road and go down the partially hidden little road to the right of the baths with a - very nice - street cafe with a glass surrounded seating area at the end of the road. 25 meteres'ish and you are there. Despite these small niggles, Hotel can be thoroughly recommended. (you can get good deals on prices as well!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anon016
Reviews.Content: Hotel conveniently located to Termini. Rooms are modern and spotlessly clean, good continental breakfast and very helpful staff. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A great find, Thanks Tripadvisors”
Reviews.Author: TravellerBD
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel on Tripadvisor and booked directly online, although I checked by phone that the booking was confirmed, which it was. What a lovely surprise. A brand new hotel 5 min walk from the Termini station, which means easy access to everything. We walked almost everywhere we wanted to go as it was central enough for us (50's) with good shoes. We only explored the ancient part of Rome, I cannot say how far the Vatican is to walk. I had booked a superior double room for myself and my husband, which had a huge (two beds together) double bed, very comfortable, a large bathroom with huge jacuzzi tub/shower (one person only in jacuzzi, it's not an American one), ample storage for all our clothes and places to put cases out of the way. Shower was superb. Good large free safe for valuables. Internet was a deal at 16 euro for four days. Every one of the staff could not have been more friendly and helpful. Immaculately clean and very quiet indeed, no noise from within the hotel or outside. Free minibar with water and soda. Room is small, but we were out most of the time. Nice breakfast as described by others. The area around the hotel is typical of other cities near main railway stations, but Via Gaeta is a small secluded street. We did walk through the Piazzo dei Populo nearby at around 9.30 one evening. Lots of people there, it was like a street party which initially looked intimidating. However, everyone there was interested only in each other, not in us and it was fine. We did not feel threatened or vulnerable at all in Rome. I see more homeless in Chicago. There is litter around the place, but it's all around Rome, which is a messy city. I will stay at the Hotel Diocleziano next time I'm in Rome, it's a great find and you get full value for money. They were helpful with restaurant recomendations and directions. Best of all, they don't nickel and dime you, you feel good about staying there. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull hotel”
Reviews.Author: yrogn
Reviews.Content: It has been a great pleasure being in the hotel. The room was very clean. The stuff was very friendly and kind. showing a real will to help. The location of the hotel is perfect. After being in rome i can understand it. it is located not far from the termini station so you can reach anywhere but still can enjoy the peace and quiet .The breakfast is o.k . should consider differnt kinds of eggs or cheese and more vegetable. They give you soft drinks and water everyday in the minibar.If i come again to rome I would definitely choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LuckymanKyoto
Reviews.Content: This summer, my wife and I had a Mediterranean cruise on the Princess and stayed four nights pre and post cruise. The most worried matter was where the hotel was. After arriving at the terminal, we walked through the bus terminal and cross the E.D. Nicola, a wide and busy street and found two drink shops on the corner. This was the entrance to the hotel. We walked ahead and found a hotel. The Diocleziano is next doors. Three hotels are lined up and each hotel is hanging international flags. The location is best for tourists. It is very easy to go everywhere and also to come back to the hotel. This is very important. Wherever you are in Rome, it is quite easy to find a bus for Termini Station where the hotel is. Near the hotel, in one minute walking area, you can find many internet cafés. The charge is about 1 Euro for 30 minutes. This hotel is small and the staffs and guests know each other. The entrance is facing to the front desk. The public area is only for the hotel guests. This means it is very safe in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Helene_1982
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend went for a 5 day trip to Rome in August 08. We booked this hotel mainly because of all the good reviews, price and location. We landed at Ciampino and easily found our way to Termini Train Station. From Termini it was a 5 min walk with luggage, not far at all. We got there mid-day, so we didn’t notice any of the "seedy" bits people have been talking about, it just seemed like a wonderful/normal neighbourhood. The first impression of the hotel was great; friendly and welcoming reception, receptionist and "bellboy" who brought our luggage to our room. The room (double standard) was spotless; Big and lovely room, overlooking Via Gaeta, lovely big bed and closet. Bathroom was big and spotless, but as others have mentioned, they should change the hanging on the shower-doors, as you basically walk into the toilet getting out of the shower unless you are "petite" The room is 100% soundproof, the easy way to check this is by opening and closing the windows to the street :) Neither me nor my boyfriend agree with the "negative" comments about the neighbourhood and nearby streets. The street and the area in general felt perfectly safe, no threatening people, no litter etc. We found the hotels location to be absolutely perfect, 2 underground-stations within roughly 3 mins walk (Termini and Repubblica) and Termini itself (starting point for several buses and trains), you can easily get anywhere from Termini, and it makes it easy to find the way back should you get lost. (As Termini is the main station in the city) The hotels location was in the middle of everything, super-easy access to every major and smaller sight, not that far of a walk either. We will definitely choose this hotel next time we are in Rome (Because we will come back!). The breakfast was excellent, nice and fresh bread, cheese, ham, tomatoes, cereal, egg & bacon (nice and thin bacon), yoghurt (the yoghurt is wonderful!), fruit,tea & coffee(the cappucino was excellent!) etc. Basically everything you would want for a good breakfast. The free mini-bar was a lovely touch :) We had a late flight going back to London, so the hotel was nice enough to give us a late check out and store our luggage for us (they locked it up, nice and safe) . On our last day in Rome we got back to the hotel abit too early, but the hotel had a lovely waiting area with a sofa, some chairs and a nice flat screen TV (right next to the gym). The gym looked wonderful, and the 2 changing rooms/showers (had a quick look to change into traveling-clothes) were huge! The shower (one of those fancy huge types, with different types of settings where the water comes out) looked amazing, wish we didn’t have everything packed, otherwise we would have tried it :) (Nice tip for other ones returning late, if you have a towel handy/on top of your luggage you can shower and change before the journey home. It does get “quite” hot in the summer) All in all we don’t have a single bad word to say about this hotel, as it exceeded our expectations, and was very good value for money. (We paid 412 Euro for 4 nights, standard double for 2 adults, notice we went in the hot off-season August) The main receptionist (cant remember his name) was also very friendly and helpful, he probably gets the same "tourist questions" day after day, but that didnit affect his mood/helpfulness one bit :) Will definitely recommend this hotel to other travelers :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: The-Mimmo
Reviews.Content: Hotel Diocleziano is located within walking distance of the train station metro and local bus station. It was very easy to hop on the Metro and be anywhere we wanted to go within minutes. The staff in this clean hotel is extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms are spacious, quiet, and pleasant. Breakfast is very good, with a broad selection of food and beverages. In addition, there was a newspaper in a few different languages offered each morning. This hotel is a great vantage point to enjoy a city as overwhelming as Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: ghomaz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights prior to heading out on a cruise. We arrived at the hotel prior to check-in, and had a limited amount of time before having to head out for a tour. The front-desk staff was very accomodating - they allowed up to freshen up in the lobby bathroom. When we returned in the late evening, our luggage was waiting for us in the room. The room itself was wonderful with a very comfortable bed. Having stayed in a few european hotels, I can say that the shower stall was the biggest I've ever seen. Actually, it was a jacuzzi-style tub with jets! The breakfast spread was great and the food was plentiful. Prior to booking this hotel, I read quite a few negative comments with regards to the location. It's true that there isn't too much to do in the area. However, it's about a 5 minute walk from Termini station, and since we were on a very tight schedule when we arrived, this was very convenient for us. As with any city, the areas close to the main train/bus terminal often attract the homeless, etc. However, we did not feel unsafe at any time (even when we walked back to the hotel after dark). Definitely a good choice overall! The FREE non-alcoholic beverages in the mini bar were an added bonus :)

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Watthree
Reviews.Content: We had the opportunity to stay three nights at the Hotel Diocleziano and were really glad we selected this hotel. We had read many reviews on Trip Advisor and the reviews sounded fairly consistent, so we decided to give it a shot. Thanks for letting us share our opinions on the following aspects of the stay. Staff: Each staff member we met was friendly and very helpful. We loved Anna at the front desk! The exceptional level of service would stand out anywhere, but it was especially appreciated and noticed in Italy, where we sometimes experienced service standards that were not what we had hoped for. The team at Hotel Diocleziano was helpful with everything: suggesting places to eat, helping with tour reservations, arranging car for the airport, etc. Facilities: The area where the hotel is located is a little run down and there are some homeless people who live close by across from the train station. However, the location is convenient, very close to transportation and the hotel itself is spotless. The common areas are small and the elevator is miniscule (three people max, with no luggage) but everything sparkled and nothing was worn or dirty. The dining area (free breakfast included!) was roomy and pleasant. The room was small and we had four bags; there wasn’t enough room to put them without stacking them on top of each other. There is no bureau to store clothes, so you have to live out of your luggage if your clothes do not hang up. The bathroom was also small, but had a large Jacuzzi-type tub and shower in it. I would have preferred a regular shower and more floor space in the room or bath. However, everything was clean and well-maintained so the room was very nice, aside from the size. On the main floor, there is a small fitness room as well as two computers for internet access. Internet rates are very reasonable at 8 euro per day if you have your own laptop. Highlights: The location is great; very close to the subways and buses and within easy walking distance of many of the sights of the city. The breakfast was very nice and when we had an early tour, Anna made us a boxed breakfast to take with us. There is a free mini-bar in the room with a daily supply of water and soda. Areas for improvement: I really liked most things about this hotel, so these are just a couple of small suggestions.  Supply washcloths in the bathroom.  Provide more than one bar of soap so one can be kept at the sink and the other in the shower. The shower was so big that if the soap was left in the holder, you had to climb into the shower to get it.  Another couple of English-language channels on the TV. CNN and BBC news are very repetitive, but I did get hooked on the Italian game show “Jackpot”. Overall impression: Compared to other rooms I’ve stayed in while visiting Rome, this was probably the smallest, but it was also the cleanest and newest. The entire staff takes hospitality to heart and made me feel like a valued guest. The management of this hotel has done an excellent job of training and developing the service team. The price seemed very reasonable considering the quality of the facility and the level of service provided. A bigger room would have been nice, but we didn’t spend that much “awake” time in the room anyway. I would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend who was looking for a great location with outstanding service. Nearby transportation: Termini Train Station (5 minute walk) Fiomicino (Leonardo Da Vinci) airport: 35-40 minutes by car 30 minutes by train Subway: Line A: Repubblica -Teatro dell'Opera Station (5 minute walk) Line A/Line B: Termini Station (5 minute walk)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect 3 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: toapayo
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms although a bit small but small rooms are standard in Rom. Location is very good since it is only a 5 min walk to the underground station. Breakfast is excellent. We would book it again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased with our choice of Hotel Diocleziano”
Reviews.Author: sue
Reviews.Content: Very please with our choice of hotel, I booked a triple room on the ground floor for my Mum, sister and I for our 3 night trip in March 2008, we got a room rate of €150 a night directly from the hotel which I thought was fantastic for a 4 star hotel! The staff were very pleasant, our room was beautiful and the breakfast very satisfying, what more can you ask for. For me, rating a hotel depends on the experience you wanted and value for money, this ticked all the boxes for me, and it was very handy, walking distance from Termini. If you walked one way the area wasn't great at night, but the other way was fine, we didn't have a problem at all. I would recommend this hotel and for the price and convenience I would stay again, then again, I am not a creature of habit and I do like trying new places so may look elsewhere just to try somewhere knew, but this was my second visit to Rome and I found the location, more convenient than my previous Hotel choice (which I also loved!)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, shame about the location”
Reviews.Author: vortrekker
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights with my wife earlier this month; booked 1 night (Saturday) in a Superior room at 204 Euros/night thru bookings.com. Decided to go one day early so contacted hotel directly by phone. Superior room was not availalable for extra night but offered us a Standard room at the same rate! They did say we could then move into the room we booked but we really didn't want the bother of moving roms for just 1 night so we stayed where we were but they still charged us for the Standard room at the Superior room rate which I thought was a bit rich. Hotel is okay but nothing special; good breakfast bar and reasonable service. However, it is in a pretty awful area. It's in a side street close to the main railway terminal and the area is a magnet for the homeless, down and outs and (at night) hookers. Indeed on the first night we saw a hooker turning a trick in the street less than 50m from the hotel front door - not one of the sites in Rome I wanted to see.. The main square and street stinks of urine and generally was rough and dirty. If you want to stay in Rome I'd recommend you find a hotel in a better area, particulary at these prices.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet but central”
Reviews.Author: Chris RJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights with friends in late April. Hotel is tucked away in quiet location however within a few paces of the Termini and bus stops providing easy access to rest of city. Walking is not a problem though Vatican is about 30mins . Hotel staff could not have been more welcoming or helpful whether it be to provide directions or book a table for a local restaurant. We had a superior room which was at the rear and very peacfull though room was not huge it was adequate with good storage. Bathroom was high quality marble though with the corner bath and over-shower it was a little cramped especially when stepping in-out of bath. Overall I would certaily recommend this hotel and adverse comments about the area at night should not put visitors off as we did not feel at risk at any point.

Reviews.Title: “great rome hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelover11
Reviews.Content: I found this online, and read the tripadvisor reviews which were very accurate. The hotel was a bit pricey, close to $300, but everything in Rome was high and the dollar very low. It is a hotel that is 5 minutes from the train station, Termini. Its true that it isn't on the most beautiful Rome street, but it didn't matter. The staff was fantastic, very helpful. The room was small, but not by European standards and had a king sized bed in it. It was very new and clean and the bathroom was great; it had a jacuzzi and a great shower. The breakfast was good and in a really nice breakfast room. The hotel arranged a car to the airport which was around 47 euros, but we had a lot of baggage and didn' t want to take the train. A private mercedes showed up and it was a very pleasant ride. The hotel is just around the corner from the sights of Rome, and easily accessible by bus or taxi or on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Newer Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelerDallasTX
Reviews.Content: Booked through hotels.com and had no problems upon checking in at the Diocleziano. A nice tip: When exiting the Termini station you need to go across the bus stop area and to the right of their to find the hotel. The hotel opened in 2006 so it was very clean, new and satisfactory. The free buffet breakfast was a nice touch and included a variety of things including scrambled eggs and bacon. The rooms were nice. The mini bar is complimentary and replenished daily. The in room safe worked great and is complimentary as well. The beds are firm but comfortable. The area was decent. We felt safe walking around at night and never had any problems. They do have two computers in the lobby with high speed internet for 4euros for 1 hr or 8 euros for 24hrs. Additionally, there are very inexpensive internet/phone cafes right around the corner of the hotel. The best restaurant we tried was "That's Amore" near the Trevi Fountain. I recommend going in the evening to see the fountain and then find this place. It had great ambiance, music and food. Prices ranged from 8 euros to 15 euros for dinner portions. Just an fyi: For those riding the metro from FCO to the Termini station, it takes approx 30 mins and costs 11 euros each way, per person. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Hotel Diocleziano”
Reviews.Author: boxermom2
Reviews.Content: My 17 yr old son and I just stayed at the Hotel Diocleziano for 6 nights on a spring break trip to Rome. This hotel was such a nice find for us and perfectly situated to easily navigate our travels via train, bus, and metro (5minutes walk to any from the hotel). Our room was very clean and the size was great by European standards; we even had two nice size windows, one in the bedroom and one in the bath, for natural light and fresh air. Yet with the windows closed, the room was very quiet. The bathroom was nice size, well lit, and immaculate. The breakfast area was a nice size, extremely clean, and the food was adequate. The personnel at the front desk were always friendly and very accomodating and helpful. They helped me with reservations, addresses and maps, and an airline issue I was trying to solve; all with a smile and very pleasant attitudes. I was careful walking one small area adjacent to the hotel at night, however, never had any issue at all. I would recommend this hotel to a friend or family and would return again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sesamedoor
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there 3 nights for our honeymoon. The room is good size with a modern feel. The staff are friendly and the breakfast is good. I especially like the free minibar (non-alcoholic beverages only). The bathroom is quite small and the design of the shower door is not very efficient. My husband has to put his foot in the shower in order to use the toilet. They also have a good size gym and a sauna which is a plus. The location is good, 5mins walk to the train station, metro and all the tour bus stops. However, if you don't have a map, it's hard to find the hotel. The hotel doesn't have a big sign that you can easily spot out in a distance. It's about 15mins walk to the spanish step and 20 mins walk to the coloseum or you can just take the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: Rivelin
Reviews.Content: Less than 5 minutes walk from Termini Station, this hotel is tucked away on a quiet street. First impressions were good. The room was spotless and easily big enough for 2 (standard room). Shower and bath. Staff were helpful and friendly and most had good English. They gave us a little tourist map which was very useful during our stay. The place was too hot for us but the A/C wasn't switched on as it was only early March. This meant we have to keep the window open at night and so it was slightly noisy at times. We were at the front of the hotel (101). Suggest you try for one at the back. Breakfast was buffet and included eggs and bacon as well as cereals and fruit etc. Lovely coffee. Free soft drinks - water and juice in the room. Free gym and sauna as well. Few minutes away from several restaurants and only a minute from the metro station so easy for going further afield. We walked almost everywhere and although we were very tired each evening, this makes the hotel in an ideal location and for a reasonable price (144 euros per night). Watch out for the pay channels on the TV especially if you are with children as it is too easy to surf on to a porn channel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Diocleziano – A Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: RAH-AtlantaGA
Reviews.Content: Our party of 6 stayed here Feb. 21-23, 2008. It proved to be everything we had anticipated after reading previous positive reviews. The rooms are immaculate, comfortable, and quiet. The complimentary mini bar (soft drinks) is a plus, and the breakfast is varied and plentiful. Of particular note is the friendliness and helpfulness of the hotel’s English speaking staff. As it happened, due to an unforeseen change in our itinerary, we arrived in Rome a day early. The Diocleziano was totally booked for that night, but the front desk clerk was most helpful in booking rooms for the extra (early arrival) night at an equivalent property nearby. I would have to agree with other reviewers about the unpleasant area between the Termini Station and the Hotel Diocleziano. It is unfortunate that the City of Rome does not support its tourist industry by providing public toilet facilities for the vagrants and homeless who tend to hang out in front of the station. The city fathers of Rome really need to address this issue in order to support fine emerging hotels such as The Diocleziano.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: SandEW
