Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our two day stay here. It was in a good location. Although near Termini, the area immediately around the hotel felt safe and unthreatening, with a good family restaurant nearby. The staff were extremely friendly, welcoming and helpful. Our room was comfortable, with a good shower. We also enjoyed the breakfast. If you are looking for a decent, friendly, small hotel near the station, then you need look no further. We warmly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel in a sleazy part of town”
Reviews.Author: Jutiapa
Reviews.Content: This place was listed as a four star hotel, and as far as accomodations go, it deserves the rating, but the area around it was pretty sleazy. It's only a couple of blocks away from the Roma Termini train station and the walk from the station to the hotel was foul smelling, ugly, and mercifully short. The front desk staff were polite and spoke English and warned us more than once to keep tight hold on our wallets while visiting Rome. I suppose they were trying to be helfpul, but the effect was less than inviting. We were automatically upgraded to a room with it's own veranda, which was nice, but it looked less safe than if we'd been up on a higher floor with nowhere for thieves and lowlifes to sneak into the place. (Don't worry, there are surveillance cameras to scare them off.) The mini bar was stocked with sodas and water (which we could imbibe free of charge) and the bathroom had a jacuzzi tub big enough to hold two or more (!) people. We were disappointed that there was a charge for internet service and even local TV was on a pay-per-view system. The highlight of our stay was breakfast service which came as part of the hotel stay. The breakfast room was large, bright, and cheery, and the kitchen staff was friendly. The selection of food and drink was varied and pleasing. It's a nice place to stay if you want to be close to the train station, but I wouldn't recommend it for an extended stay in Rome. If you're only looking for swanky hotel accomodations, this place is the way to go, but we prefer the cozier and quirkier family owned and operated hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: heinzBean_Kent
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just perfect for a city break. The rooms were clean and very comfortable, the breakfast provided was tasty and had a good selection. I think the staff coud not have been more helpful. They recommended a local pizzeria which was fantastic and were also very helpful with recommending areas around campo d'fiori etc as well as having a good knowlegde of the best ways to get around town. Colesseum is 15 mins walk as is trevi fountain. Spanish steps are 20 mins. We walked to the vatican in 50 mins but there are plenty of buses that would get you there a lot more quickly!! The only minor down point was the smell on the streets immediately surrounding the hotel. I guess some people just can't wait until the get to a toilet to do their business! Overall, a great hotel with extremely helpful staff who made the stay very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic find”
Reviews.Author: Robertsone
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a four night stay and cannot fault this excellent hotel. Our party consisted of mum, dad and our two boys aged 13 & 10. We had taken advantage of their airport transfer which for four people was good value. The front desk staff were extremely friendly handing out complimentary maps and pointing out the main attractions. Our rooms were ready for our early afternoon arrival and we were shown straight to them. We booked two standard rooms and were allocated 404 a double and 408 a twin bedded room that the boys shared. They were adjacent and at the rear of the hotel making them extremely quiet with pleasant views out over cloisters and gardens. The rooms were modern and extremely clean. The mini bar with free soft drinks, restocked daily, was a nice touch and particularly appreciated by the boys. The hotel doesn't have a restaurant but does have a lovely breakfast room offering a range of breads, pastries, cheeses and fruits etc. Although we didn't take advantage, it has a new fitness room and sauna. It's location is about 5 minutes from the main train and bus station offering easy access to public transport. However, if you want to make the most of your visit to this city then walk, most of the main sights are 15-20 minutes away. The Termini area may not be the best address in Rome but don't let that put you off we felt perfectly safe walking around even late evening. Book this hotel, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine”
Reviews.Author: pno2ner
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for 4 nights in February, 2008 and were very satisfied. This is a completely modernized and beautiful hotel, in a good location near the RR and bus stations. There are a number of other hotels nearby. Reception was friendly and eager to please. There is an elevator. Rooms are modern, comfortable, very firm beds, phone and room safe. Rooms are very clean, and far enough away from traffic to be quiet. Internet available at 4 euros for one hour. There is a large supermarket 2 blocks away, and be sure to try the Ristorante La Famiglia just down the block. Plentiful, well prepared food at reasonable prices. All bus tours start at the bus station, or if you are a walker, you can walk to many of the monuments and attractions in Rome. Breakfasts were excellent, many choices, all well prepared in an attractive breakfast room. We were happy there and would use them again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: boblaw
Reviews.Content: Great location , only five minute walk from Termini Train station, Rooms very clean, staff friendly and helpful. Breakfast was above average. We walk a lot and this is centrally located for many attractions. Will stay there again the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed staying at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: FayMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in Feb 2008. We have been to Rome many times and always stayed in the Termini area for the convience. In the past we stayed at the "old world" hotels, the Bailey and the Mecente Palace. Both were elegant and old. The Mecante recently began showing its age. The Dioclezaino is neither elegant or old, but a new modern hotel that is clean and very nice. Don't stay here if you want the Hilton, but stay here for a good central location, spotless rooms, and friendly and aknowledgeable staff. The breakfast is very good, the free mini bar is nice, although personally I would prefer a coffee pot. We arrived very early and were given rooms immediately. Our friends who have never been to Rome loved the hotel and would also stay here again on their return visits. The only down side to the hotel is the very short walk from Termini. Although we never felt unsafe, there is a quarter block of the walk that really stinks. We walked in the street to avoid the smell which is really only on the sidewalk area. It would not deter us from staying here again. A few tips. The hotel offers a car service to and from the airport. It is pricey, but negotaible. There were 4 of us, and we negotiated a rate only slightly above the taxi rate. Taxis are a hassle here, as the drivers do not want to accept the law mandating a flat rate of 40 euro. The amount you have to fight to get them to accept this rate is not worth the effort. It is just easier to take the train. We really enjoyed the Diacleziano and will stay here again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CopenhagenShi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very nice hotel . The staff is smiling and friendly. We stayed for 4 nights in a normal room. Very clean and in perfect order. The bathroom was not so big - and I am happy that I not is very big - because then I would have had a problem getting in and out of the bathtube. The breakfast was alse much better than normal for a Rome hotel. And it was cheep too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: John5620
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a weekend break in Rome. I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. The hotel is within 5 minutes walk of the Termini train station - which is great for airport transfer busses, trains and the metro service. Despite being so close to the station, the hotel was remarkably quiet. The room was of a decent size, was immaculately clean and the bathroom was well equipped. The gym and sauna facilities were really good, although there wasnt a lot of time to make use of them. Breakfast was nice, plenty of choice and everything was fresh. The hotel staff were really polite and helpful. I would certainly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Utterly Superb!”
Reviews.Author: TexasPadre
Reviews.Content: After several trips to Europe, we couldn't imagine a better experience than the staff and accommodations at this Rome hotel. The rooms are wonderfully new; the free buffet breakfast was complete and tasty; the staff was entirely excellent in every regard, including help in any matters that might arise; the location is ideal [a five minute walk to the Rome train station] as it sits on a quiet side street, with many restaurants and shops available. We researched Rome hotels on the Trip Advisor website...and the reviews helped us have a terrific experience!

Reviews.Title: “A fine hotel with an odor problem”
Reviews.Author: rochelle.alexis
Reviews.Content: We were staying in Rome with some friends and booked 3 rooms at the Hotel Diocleziano. We booked the hotel through www.booking.com - One of the rooms we booked was the "superior double" because we thought it would be slightly bigger. Unfortunately, all 3 rooms were the same size expect that the "superior double" supposedly had a whirlpool bath. I wouldn't call "that" a whirlpool bath, but whatever. Definitely NOT worth the extra money. The hotel rooms had a funny smell. I think the smell was from the old pipes and seeping through the bathroom (it had a sewage smell). The first night we sprayed a ton of perfume which help for about 15 minutes. The next day we bought Febreeze which helped a little better. Breakfast was decent. A selection of canned fruits, Muesli, cereal, breads, yogurt & cheeses. There were some "warm" eggs and bacon too. The rooms were plenty clean. The carpets and bread spreads were a little dingy and dated. The bathrooms were clean. They don' t offer a conditioner, so bring your own if you are picky about that stuff. The bar is deceitful. On our last night we asked for a night cap and were told he would only serve us beer. We finally convinced him to open some wine. The location was good. Very close to Termini and easy to get to all the major sites whether you'd like to walk or hope on a bus or metro. The hotel was plain and simple and even though there was a bit of an odor problem, it met our needs for the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at excellent price”
Reviews.Author: Ymseduria
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 6-night stay at the Hotel Diocleziano. A great hotel located only a 5 minutes walk from Termini station.The neightbourhood was ok, much better than one should expect, due to the negative reviews of the Termini area. There were also some pretty good restaurant just a block away from the hotel, and a supermarket nearby. One of the best ways to explore a city is by foot, and we could easily walk to all the major sights from the hotel; including the Vatican and Basilica San Pietro. The staff were friendly and polite, especially the lady in the restaurant, that each morning came and asked what kind of coffee or tea we wanted. The breakfast was better than I have experienced in other European hotels, and included cereals, egg&bacon, ham and cheeses, and several choices of juice and pastry. The rooms were average in size, but perfectly clean. The towels were changed every day even when we did not put them on the floor. The bed was maybe a bit on the hard side, and the room was somewhat hot at night, but we could easily sleep with the window open witout being troubled by a lot of noise Probably the most excellent feature of the hotel was the free minibar with soft drinks and mineral water, who was restocked daily.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: Bailey2001
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel solely on the reviews given by fellow travellers on this website and we were not disappointed! Hotel was spotless, room was spotless, massive bathroom, nice view from balcony and more than adequate breakfast. Hotel staff couldnt have been more helpful either. Location wise, perfect, around a 5 min walk from the Termini, which is great as the metro stops there which allows very easy access to all the major landmarks. I wouldnt look to stay anywhere else upon my return to rome! book it, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and modern”
Reviews.Author: plutopizza
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel that I would stay in again if I returned to Rome. The rooms were clean, modern and elegant. Staff: The staff were very helpful, assisting with luggage and explaining the transit system to the major attractions. Their attention to detail was impressive, as they knew our names on check-in before we even said a word. Bathroom: Although it does have an awkward layout as other reviewers have noted, the bathroom was large and with modern amenities - a bidet, a full/half flush toilet and a spacious hot shower. The hotel stocked the complimentary beverages in the fridge daily, cleaned all towels even when they weren't placed on the floor, and on the second day even provided a cup for our toothbrushes! I particularly liked that the towel bars and tiles were heated, making a shower on a cool winter's day feel like an spa experience. Room: The bed was queen sized and firm. The windows were shuttered and you could open both glass and shutter and lean out. I would be worried if I had children with me, but as I didn't, it was great to have the fresh air. Although BBC news was the only English channel on television, English pay-per-view movies were available. Location: This hotel is 2 blocks from Termini station, which has a bus terminal, shuttles to the airports, the metro and national/international trains. Unless you are a wary traveller and/or look Italian (my blond husband was targeted by pickpocketers on the Metro), I recommend taking less crowded buses instead of the Metro since buses from around the city can be found that go to Termini. Breakfast: included breakfast was varied and tasty. It inluded coffee, juice, and milk, breakfast breads, cereal, yogurt, scrambled eggs and meat among other things. Dining: I highly recommend "La Famiglia," a restaurant one block down Via Gaeta. They had a nice selection of Italian food for a reasonable price and with English descriptions on the menu. A comment about booking through the hotel website - I was concerned because I couldn't see a security lock icon in my browser while on their secured web page, but I e-mailed the holder of the security certificate and learned that it doesn't display because it is within a frame, but the hotel indeed is authorized to use their booking engine.

Reviews.Title: “Clean modern convenient and in-room internet”
Reviews.Author: pastywhitescot
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location, literally minutes from the Termini and subway. As a sidenote a car in Rome is a liability, save yourself the trouble of trying to find parking/ not getting your car stolen/battling traffic, etc. and take the subway or a cab. T Anyway, this hotel is very clean, modern, in a convenient location and has in-room high-speed internet which I needed since I had to stay in touch with my office and receive documents while I was on vacation. The staff are very helpful and go out of their way to help you with restaurant reservations or booking tours. It is on a nice quiet street and is within walking distance of some very nice local (ie not tourist trap) restaurants, ask the front desk stafff for their recommendations, I liked La Lampada 25-27 Via Quintino Sella. Also there is a kiosk which sells wine and cold beer a block away. I would stock up at the end of the day after walking all over the city and sit with my feet up and relax with a cold one while I decided where to go for dinner. There is also a newstand nearby with a limited selection of english newspapers. The breakfast buffet is quite good and typical of what you will find in Italy: scrambled eggs, bacon, cereals, juices etc. I returned to this hotel on the Saturday, my last night before flying out after travelling to Florence and Venice and they upgraded me to the Penthouse which is very spacious.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: albilliionare
Reviews.Content: we stayed at Diocleziano from 12/22~12/25, our first time in Rome. The hotel is great overall, great location 5 mins walks from Rome Termini(it connects to the Rome FCO airport with 20min train ride), the staffs were extremely friendly and helpful, room is clean. and the subway will take you to all the tourist spots within 15 mins. great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, awesome beds!”
Reviews.Author: hi2wc2000
Reviews.Content: This little hotel near the Termini station is a great place to stay. The staff was pleasant and friendly from beginning to end. They were very friendly and helpful with any questions, and english was no problem. The morning breakfast was a nice way to start the day. As for the room, it was a decent size for my wife and I. The beds were the foam "tempurpedic" types, and they were great. Unfortunately my wife wants one now. The bathroom was a nice size and easy to move around even for a larger person. They offered a free mini bar of soft drinks and water which was a life saver after a long day roaming Rome. The location was a little seedy being that it was near the station. However, if you are making use of the metro or the other trains, this location can't be beat. It makes getting around Rome and Italy easy as it is 5 minutes away. Taking the train to the airport (FCO) was a breeze. If a clean, friendly hotel for a good nights rest is what you are looking for, try this hotel. Thanks to the friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet & well-located”
Reviews.Author: winston_chops
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a clean, modern and quiet place to rest your bones after a good day's sight-seeing then this is a fine hotel. My wife and I stayed here for two nights in a double-superior room at £100 a night. The room was very clean and OK for space: the queen bed took up most of the area. The ensuite was also spotless and has a jacuzzi tub though its size and comfort are nothing to write home about. The bed is quite hard and not the most comfortable. "Internal views" from the window are of adjoining buildings but this was no surprise as it is clearly stated in the room description when we booked. Hotel staff are helpful and friendly. We were given an excellent map and good advice on sightseeing the moment we stepped in. They ironed out any small issues we had from getting an extra pillow to storing bags post-check in. We did have a problem with no hot water for a couple of hours in the morning but this was resolved after breakfast with minimal impact. The breakfast is a plentiful buffet of bacon, eggs, cereal, croissants, cold meat, cheeses. The location of this hotel is one of its strong points. We came in from Ciampino airport using the terravision coach service (8 euros each). Takes 30 mins to get to the Termini station. From here the hotel is five minutes walk away. The Termini is ideal for access to the sites with the trains/buses/metro all here. The immediate area around the Termini does have its loiterers and strange smells but the hotel is safely located off a quiet cut-off road. When you approach the turning for the hotel the noise and hubbub of the city suddenly disappears and you get that feeling of quiet relaxation inside the hotel too. There's nothing quite like the chimes of church bells drifting through the window in the mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff/stay”
Reviews.Author: tenerife_wannabe
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel - excellent staff, friendly, efficient and made you feel as though nothing was too much trouble (even if you asked a daft question!). Hotel was extremely clean and well run. Breakfast relaxed and plentiful. Bar area and roomsen-suite a little small but nothing that would impact on our stay to any great degree. Complimentary drinks in mini bar, complimentary newspapers all helped make this a very relaxed mini break. Definitely a good hotel to come back to after a hard day of walking around the City.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HelenM30
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for just the one night in November following reviews on trip advisor and weren't disappointed. We booked the car pick up through the hotel also which was expensive (cheaper to get a cab) but the standard of car on pick up from the airport was fantastic, unfortunately the return trip to the airport was slightly disappointing as despite paying 95euros we had to return in a mini-bus!! The hotel was lovely and we were upgraded to a superior room on arrival. Or room wasn't ready so we had a complementary coffee at the bar and our luggage was stored until we returned in the early evening. The service we received was excellent, the location was quite far out of the centre -7 euros in a cab to Via Corso - so be warned - not suitable for those not fans of walking!! All in all a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Best location and 5 star service”
Reviews.Author: FunTrvlCpl
Reviews.Content: You can't find a better location in Rome as it is very close to the train station, Metro and bus line. The manager of this hotel runs a first class operation and his staff will go out of their way to help you. Breakfast was great with a huge selection of hot and cold foods. They had a nice gym with a dry sauna too. Rooms are nice. We had internet for our four days for 22 euros. If you need to call the States, buy a 5 euro phone card from a newstand and you get over 600 minutes, that's just amazing! If you turn left when exiting the hotel there is a market about one block down on the right hand side for whatever you might need. Again, the location and staff make this hotel a true value!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SKIpal
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel, well appointed in a convenient location

Reviews.Title: “Perfect home base for a week in Rome”
Reviews.Author: frankinto
Reviews.Content: I am used to budget hotels when I go to Europe, but this time my friend and I decided to splurge a little bit and choose this still-affordable hotel in a very convenient location, close to Termini Station. The room was modern and very clean, larger that what we were used to in Europe, with a great bathroom. There is a small bar area that's ideal for a night cap after a long day, a great breakfast room with good service and selection, and I believe they have an exercise room at the back (who cares after all that walking!). I would definitely return to this hotel, and I recommend it without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great find. Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: FarflungEddie
Reviews.Content: We wanted somewhere in Rome close to the station but not anywhere noisy or seedy. Hotel Diocleziano was perfect. 5 minutes walk from the station but in a small side street overlooking the old thermal baths and a monastery...very quiet but incredibly central. We arrived very early in the morning after a 23 hour flight. We were expecting to have to store our bags and go sight seeing. The gentleman at the desk was very understanding. He said our room was ready and to go straight up. It was bliss to have a shower and a change of clothes and freshen up before heading out. I would certainly recommend this place and we would definitely return. The free mini bar was also a god send in the hot weather. Much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: CJIMI
Reviews.Content: Thanks to everyone at Tripadvisor for steering us to the Hotel Diocleziano. This hotel has only been open since Jan. 2006, so it is not listed in any guides. We arrived at the hotel at 1:00 PM on a Sunday afternoon, exhausted after a transatlantic flight. The hotel let us check in early. Even though it was hot and sticky in Rome, the A/C kept the room at a cool 69 degrees. The black out curtains kept the light out, and the double glazed windows kept the noise out. Having had a hard time sleeping in Rome the last time I was there 11 years ago, I just could not get over how quiet our room was at the Diocleziano. As previous contributors have mentioned, the non-alcoholic drinks in the mini bar are free. If you want to purchase beer, wine, or that wonderful San Benedetto peach iced tea, there is a very well stocked supermarket about 2 blocks away from the hotel. The location, near the Termini railroad station is very convenient, if not particularly attractive. The area around the train station looks - and smells - seedy, especially after dark. But we walked around at all hours, and the only people who ever approached us were lost travelers, asking directions in various languages. The breakfast buffet is huge. Pig out, and you can easily skip lunch. I found out on our last day that the hotel had fitness machines, as well as a sauna. I never got to use either, but you'll get plenty of exercise just walking around Rome. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is as good as all the reviews say.”
Reviews.Author: jacquesBrisbane
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was perfect for our overnight stay on Sunday 09 Sept The Hotel arranged a car to pick us up at the airport. The plane was late, the driver was waiting and very helpful. We found the staff very helpful advising us to get our train tickets on Sunday for our trip on Monday to Cinque Terra and directions to a very nice restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Good option at Rome”
Reviews.Author: Theo_Pappas
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at Diocleziano. Hotel: Is very modern and well equipped. We stayed at a "superior room" and I think the only difference compared to the standard room is the jacuzzi at the bathroom. The room ins't very spacious but isn't tiny. Average size. I booked a double bed and they gave to us two twin bed together with a "hole" in the middle of them. Food: The breaksfest is very good. Staff: Very helpful. Location: Very close from the termini station (5-8 minutes walking distance) and from the subway station. The area near from hotel isn't good to go out at night. Only one restaurant near and isn't good. I'll stay again at this hotel on another visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: awtozer
Reviews.Content: We just finished our 5 day hotel stay at the Diocleziano. It was wonderful! It is everything you need in a hotel. Beautiful, Comfortable, Priced just right. Breakfast was great. Beds were awesome. The staff was friendly, attentive, and worked hard to please you. Very polite. We will refer I friends and family there in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rsk14
Reviews.Content: This was such a beautiful hotel, the staff were friendly and very helpful. The whole place was spotless and clean. Having the free mini bar was great and the breakfast was good. Very well placed for sightseeing, but in a very quiet area. i would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Diocleziano”
Reviews.Author: angelikiSouthWales
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at the Diocleziano and it was all good. Hotel is very easy to get to from the station- just a few mins walk - the staff are all helpful and charming, and the hotel is immaculate. Our room was well equiped -air conditioned,safe in the room, and a free soft drink mini bar. Breakfast is served in a pleasant room and has a good selection. Hotel is in a quiet street so it was peaceful and is easy to sleep. We would stay here again, and hope we return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: SueL74
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights, and can't recommend this hotel enough. The staff are extremely friendly and very knowledgeable, nothing is a problem for them. The room was immaculate and cleaned every day. We had a standard room which some may find a bit small however, the idea is to see the sights not sit in your room all day. The air conditioning is standard in all rooms, which was a god send as it was hot. The hotels location is perfect for walking to the sites, but all the transport links are within 5 minutes walk if you prefer to get around that way. We were a little concerened about some of the rumours we'd heard about the Termini area, however, we found it no worse than any other major city, and as long as you are sensible after dark you will have no problems, however this is the case in all parts of Rome. I'd recommend taking the shuttle bus from the airport, it only costs 6 euros each and drops you off within 5-10 minutes walk of the hotel. Head to the Republica area for evening meals particuarly Ristorante Strega which we found to be so good we went back a second time.

Reviews.Title: “Very very good, but.....”
Reviews.Author: dhgn
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very good. the location is excellent.. very near to the main station.. yet quiet and very clean... The breakfast is good except for the bread; not always fresh. the staff is friendly and helpful... Our room was a very small with a toilet nearly inside the shower! :-) Be sure to reserve a big room in advance. All in all the hotel is a very good choice. if we would go back to Rome, we would choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant!”
Reviews.Author: breener77
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is Out the Right Exit off the Termini Trains, Walk straight up over the BIG Crossroads and the Next Small Street up TURN LEFT and the Hotel is down on the Right (about 4 Houses Down). We stayed for 3 Nights (upon Tripadvisor Reviews) at the End of August. We booked a Superior Suite (E130) which had a Jaquizi Bath. The Mini-Bar is refreshed EVERY Day and includes Cola, Fanta, Fruit Drink, Water (Still and Sparkling). The Breakfast is Continental and also included in Price. Some Cereals, Pastries, Scrambled Egg, Bacon, Ham, Yoghurts, Fruit and Ranges of Teas/Coffees. Ive got to say the hotel was Exellant and the Staff and VERY Helpful and Trust Worthy. If I go back to Rome I Would Recommend this Hotel Without Fail. Very Plesant Stay!! Thanks

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveler12ga34
Reviews.Content: Family of 2 adults and 2 children, stayed 5 nights at the Diocleziano in July. Had 2 standard rooms. Very clean, modern hotel on a quiet street 5 min. from the Termini station. Will not repeat what others have already mentioned. Strong AC was especially appreciated in the July heat. Staff was very helpful; prepared box breakfasts when we had to leave at 7AM on a tour to Pompei and on another morning for the airport. "Shady" people tend to hang around the Termini area but they do not bother you. There is a laundromat around the corner that doubles as an internet cafe; their internet rate was 1 Euro for 30 min. CAVEAT: our wallet was stolen on the bus (line H coming back from Trastevere). We loved our stay at the Diocleziano and would highly recommand it to any body.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel-Thanks TripAdvisor!”
Reviews.Author: drtravel47
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Diocleziano is a gem in this wonderful city. About a 5 minute walk from Termini Station, the hotel is perfectly situated to the train , the central bus depot, and the Metro, all of which we took. STAFF: Extremely friendly. All were more than happy to help and offer advice. We stayed there 2 times over 2 weeks (we had a cruise in the middle). On the 2nd stay, we arrived at 11am and the room was already made up and ready. Matteo printed out a train schedule so we could do a day trip to Assisi (well worth it!). ROOMS: Extremely clean. Most everything is very new. Whiles the rooms are small, the bathrooms are more than spacious for a hotel of this type. Mattresses on bed were very hard, great for getting over jet lag and room darkening curtains really darkened! The A/C is very efficient, with the hotel having this modern system of having a computer card activate all electricty, thus saving energy. I would suggest you take a room facing the back. While there is no view, the back is very quiet. Some rooms have multiple shower jets. Each room has a free safe. The free water and juice in the refrig. is a nice treat BREAKFAST: Far more substantial than one expects in Europe. It included a nice variety of juices, pastries, eggs, cheese, ham, cereal, fresh fruit, and yogurt. Italian newspapers were complimentary. OTHER: As others have written, there is a small gym, but who had time to use it? Rome was calling to walked through!! On TripAdvisorI had read about La Familia restaurant. While the hotel recommended other places, we chose La Familia 2 times. The food was great, the staff friendly and full dinner for 2, including a full litre of the house wine was only 36 euros!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great City!”
Reviews.Author: sunshine-girl23
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful 3 day stay in Rome and couldn't have asked for a better hotel. The hotel is situated in a quiet street just a few minutes walk from the Termini Railway station and Terravision bus stop. The staff were extrememly friendly and professional and never required a deposit for the room (a common occurrence in other establishments). The rooms themselves were more than adequate, the air conditioning and free minibar a wonderful addition in the summer heat. The breakfast at the hotel was of a good standard and set us up for our busy day sightseeing. There was also a small gym and sauna onsite although we never actually used this. Rome itself is a wonderful city and the people were friendly. I was offered a seat on every subway trip we made due to my growing bump!! Although we did do a lot of walking, we bought day cards for the transport system which were a bargain at 4 Euros. The Subway system is very reliable and many of the newer trains are fully air conditioned. We found that walking to the end of each platform meant the carriage was much less busy and made our journeys more comfortable. All in all, a wonderful hotel in a wonderful city!

Reviews.Title: “A real gem!”
Reviews.Author: tribblet
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three delightful nights at the Hotel Diocleziano in mid-May as we explored Rome for the first time before beginning a cruise. We found the location to be perfect -- since we took the train from the airport, the proximity to the Termini Station was ideal. (I wish we had nailed down the directions a little better before leaving home -- the station is quite large and we exited it on the wrong side for the direction of the hotel -- after about a 2 mile excursion dragging our luggage across the cobblestones and asking numerous people for directions, armed with a map, we finally found the hotel behind the 3rd Century Baths of Diocletian on the opposite side of the large open park/bus loading area adjacent to the station. It was literally a stone's throw away!) We found the staff to be absolutely wonderful -- they were very helpful in recommending restaurants to exactly match our desires, even calling to make sure space was available. They also had the ability to arrange tours efficiently and knew the best gelaterias! The hotel was peaceful on a quiet street in a safe area. Our room was comfortable and nicely decorated and had a beautiful large bath. The water and soda that were replenished daily in the room's refrigerator were welcome refreshments! The hotel breakfast was excellent in a bright, cherry setting. The cappuccino was the best I've ever had. My husband really enjoyed the ham. We are both walkers, and enjoyed trekking from the hotel to the Roman Forum, Colosseum, Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona and many other places along the way. The architecture is too splendid to view from a bus (plus it enable us to make frequent gelato stops!) Relatives joined us at the hotel on the second day, and we spent the third walking to all of the same places, but did invest in a guided tour of the Colosseum and the Ancient Ruins -- it helped us to better understand what we were viewing. The Santa Maria degli Angeli is very close to the hotel, a small part of the enormous Baths of Diocletian that was converted with Michelangelo's help into one of Rome's grandest churches. Be sure to take a look inside -- it's astounding! We look forward to making a return trip to the Hotel Diocleziano!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: pat99
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights at Diocleziano and could not be more satisfied. Hotel and room spotlessly clean. All staff very professional and friendly, nothing too much trouble for them. Booked standard room via hotel website and got a better deal. Bathroom was spacious, room more than adequate. Breakfast good, enough choice for all tastes, cereals, fresh fruit all types of bread and cakes, pastries etc. and eggs and bacon, proper fruit juice too. Located 5 minute walk from Termini and all major attractions within walking distance. Complimentary mini bar was much appreciated . OK there are down and outs around but not near hotel, more to Termini, they never hassle or bother anyone. Would recommend this hotel to all as an ideal base for visiting Rome. Did think use of internet expensive at 4 euros for minimum one hour, there are loads of cafes about with cheaper rates and 15 minutes minimum. Overall , highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, exceptional staff...loved Hotel Diocleziano!”
Reviews.Author: pairotravelers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a week-long wonderful stay at Hotel Diocleziano. We have stayed at our share of hotels and we must say that Hotel Diocleziano's staff are among the best that we have encountered. ALL of the staff were extremely friendly, courteous, helpful, and professional. They made us feel comfortable and right at home. The hotel was very clean and well-kept. It was also decorated beautifully. The hotel is literally a 5 minute walk from the Termini which was very convenient for the subway and trains (we even did a day trip to Venice on the Eurostar). The hotel rates were extremely reasonable and included a lovely breakfast daily. Hotel Diocleziano helped make our Rome vacation a relaxing and enjoyable one. We were glad that we chose to stay there and were sad to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed stay”
Reviews.Author: AVBB
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Close to Termini train station for travelling - Clean and modern bathroom - Powerful shower - Friendly staff - Nina is very nice in the breakfast room - Breakfast is plentiful with good cappuccinos Cons (minor): - Location is farther than we expected from some major attractions if you are walking (especially in summer heat) - English TV channels lacking (only BBC) - Wakeup call was unreliable as it is not automated - Internet at hotel was quite expensive at 4E's / hour (minimum 1 hour)

Reviews.Title: “Great little hideaway”
Reviews.Author: JayneyG
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel out of the many that are on trip adviser for Rome mainly because of its proximity to the train station. We were back packing so I didn't want to have to travel too far with my heavy back pack (I'm getting old now)! Anyway the hotel was lovely we stayed on the 3rd floor - very clean lovely view of the rooftops of Rome - went to the wonderful trattoria - La Famiglia this must be one of Romes best kept secrets. The food was fab and it was only just up the road from the Hotel. The metro was at the train station so all in all it ended up a very wise choice. Out of the hussle and bustle so no noise, very clean and happy staff. It was on the more expensive side for our budget, however it was worth every penny - Tip book on the hotel website its definately the cheapest option.

Reviews.Title: “We had an excellent stay at the Hotel Diocleziano.”
Reviews.Author: GatesheadMackem
Reviews.Content: My wife and spent four nights at the Hotel Diocleziano and we found the Hotel to be excellent in every respect, the reception staff are friendly and courteous, (a specail mention of Anna who was very helpful), the room we had was immacculate, and exactly as the website promised. Pay a little extra and treat yourself to the superior room with the large shower and whirlpool bath, we found this to be brilliant at the end of a long hot day sight seeing in Rome. There was also a very good selection at the breakfast buffet. Many thanks to everyone at the Hotel, we would have no hesitation in returning again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: SkygirlLondon
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel because of its location but were pleasantly surprised by this charming hotel. The rooms were bright and well looked after and we enjoyed the breakfast and the hotel bar. There was also a gym and sauna, which we didn't know about until we got there. In addition, the staff were friendly and efficient. The hotel is within easy walking distance of the main attractions but we did not hear any noise from the street which was appreciated. Would definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “When can we return!”
Reviews.Author: Dunkeld10
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay at this hotel in late May. We read hundreds of reviews on hotels and were not disappointed with our choice. The hotel is situated very close to the busy Termini which is ideal for airport transfers and for travelling around the city by metro. You wouldn't know the hotel was so close to Termini as its situated on a quite side street closeby. We were warmly greeted and shown to our room which had complimentary soft drinks and a safe for valuables to use. The room, and the whole hotel, were very clean. One thing to watch out for, the shower was badly positioned in the bathroom, be careful getting in and out!! Given we were on holiday and in wonderful Rome we were not in the room much. Breakfast was adequate for the day ahead, bacon, egg, toast, toast, cake, etc all served in a lovely airy dining room. I would disagree with previous reviews about the local restaurants. La Famiglia was a lovely family restaurant where we ate on a a few occasions as it was so good. Lovely food, good atmosphere and always busy with locals and visitors alike. As for the area nearby, yes its where some of the locals gather but we were never approached by anyone and would definitely return to this area/hotel. Overall, we had a wonderful time in Rome and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “A very good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: STY40
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in this hotel. The standard double room we had was excellent. It was spotless and was cleaned everyday, as was the rest of the hotel. The complimentary soft drinks bar was a welcome bonus each day, after sightseeing in the heat. The air conditioning was great! It was very quick and effective. As for the staff, I found them to be extremely friendly and very helpful. Nothing was too much trouble for them and this appeared to be the same for the other guests staying there. The breakfast was great - lots of choice and as much as you could eat. Nina was there and was always very helpful. Maybe travelers should remember its nice to be nice and a smile to the staff costs nothing but reaps great rewards!! The hotel is very close to the Termini station which is great for all your transport needs. The area itself is abit rundown but that reflects in the price of the hotel. If it was anywhere else in Rome you would be paying at least double the price. In conclusion the hotel is great and very good value for Rome. I would recommend it and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Plain_Jane_Too
Reviews.Content: PROS * Very clean all over * Helpful staff - respectful - dignified staff - like taking your top-of-the-line Lexus to a respectful dealer for an oil change * Bathroom has heated marble floors & heated towel rack * Free mini bar * Free safe/vault in room * Great air conditioner system * Close to Roma Termini - 3 minute walk - convenient for airport - very easy to take Leonard eXpress train to/from airport * By Roma Termini are the buses that goes around Rome * 7-8 minute walk to the Metro (underground train) - takes to directly to Spanish Steps * Block away from "La Famiglia" restaurant which offered great food with informal ambience CONS * Walking to/from hotel is kind of scary and dirty - but no worst than NYC or any big urban cities - just don't walk alone late at night - use common sense * Towards the Termini are all the migrant workers looking for work * Anywhere in Rome you will be warned "Watch for pickpockets!"

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!!!”
Reviews.Author: sarahPortlaoise
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hostel, sorry hotel for 2nights in may. i would strongly advise anyone to stay away...I have never in my life come accross such arrogant,ignorant and obnoxious staff all under the one roof.. We got the same feedback from fellow guests...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Near Termini”
Reviews.Author: meggenberg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Diocleziano May 25-29, 2007. Hotel is only 5 minutes from Termini. Not the greatest neighborhood of Rome, but convenient to all transportation at Termini (metro, buses, and trains). Staff was courteous and spoke English. Breakfast was American with eggs and bacon and other typical items. We had Room 1 which I believe is the room reserved for wheelchair guests. It had a large bathroom and very clean. We had a problem with the shower doors, but the Hotel repaired while we were gone. The only other problem was the air conditioning. When we were in Rome it was 95 degrees F. and the air conditioner could not keep up with the extreme heat. We requested the housekeeper not adjust the A/C when we were gone all day. So when we returned the next day after a long hot day of touring Rome it was somewhat cooler. We ate several times at the local tratorria , La Famiglia, that is one block from the hotel. It is open all day unlike many local restaurants that close from 3:00 to 7:00 pm. We enjoyed eating there. Great antipasto bar and they would bring you ice to cool the drinks. Overall we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: travel-world-mom
Reviews.Content: I think the experience with this hotel is dependent on the specific room. We had one of the best rooms in the hotel with a large balcony and a two-person corner jaccuzi (we paid slightly more than the standard fare). The room is small, but everything is sparkling new and functional. My 3 year old loved running around in the balcony. The breakfast is OK, and the famous Nina was actually very nice and friendly with my 3 year old. The location could not be better--extremely convenient to all. That being said, I have a feeling that once the hotel aged, it would not be that nice.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Claustrophobia”
Reviews.Author: NoelCorky
Reviews.Content: We had the great pleasure of visiting Rome in mid May and had a truly wonderful time. Rome itself is stunning and our hotel appeared ok, however, its shortcomings soon became apparent. Firstly, I'm average build and height for a man of my age and I had great difficulty maneuvering into and out of the shower, which was located dangerously close to the toilet. The lift too is quite 'cosy' and if you're in any way claustrophobic, avoid it. In addition, the hotel has a sauna, however, I was unable to sit comfortably in it alone; cant imagine having to share it with other guests. The bar area too was unfeasibly small; there were only enough seats for a few people and the price of drink there is extortionate (€10 for a baileys & €8 for a bottle of beer). Can't wait to return to Rome but definitely wont be revisiting the Diocleziano.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Staff, good rooms, and central to attractions”
Reviews.Author: TravellingLighter
Reviews.Content: AlItalia/Air France had lost my luggage and the staff at Hotel Diocleziano in Rome were very helpful in sorting me out after a very trying time with the airline(s). Although part of a chain, it had the feel of a family-run hotel; it is very close to hte central railway and metro so getting around the city centre is very easy. Breakfast was limited but adequate; the rooms clean and tidy. The immediate vicinity had a local feel to it as well - with a guy who runs a cafe fixing my mate's sunglasses for free after getting out his bag of tools [maybe a lot of tourists have problems with their glasses in his cafe?]. I would stay there again. Peter M

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, pity about the staff!!”
Reviews.Author: IrelandKen
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for a Thursday and Friday night stay. Whilst the hotel itself is well situated near the train station and within walking distance of many of the sites Rome has on offer, i must say the hospitality left a lot to be desired. I was put in a room practically, beside the reception and on the other side of me was the so called bar, a counter about 10 foot long with room for about 2 people. Duirng my stay some people were having drinks at the bar at night and i had to ask the porter to get them to keep the nosie down to get some sleep. That said there was only about 8 people in the bar and were not behaving excessively, it was just the room was too close to the bar. When i asked to move to another room, there was no attempt made to accomadate me. Rome was wonderful, hotel was nice, but i found the staff rude.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: jwg55
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay. Clean, good basic buffet breakfast (with cappucino), we walked to everything except the Vatican. Helpful staff. Close to Train Station, we walked to hotel after dropping off rental car - cabby thought it was other end of street and would have taken us for a ride (literally). Good food on other side of train station on Amedeo

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JulesSouthYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Location - good to get around Rome, close to Train Station, Metro and Bus Tours. Most taxi drivers didn't know where hotel was so ask for Hotel Fiamma on Via Gaeta, hotel is next door. Getting there - You can use Terravision coach from Ciampino airport which is cheapest option, the coach stops at the Train station and the hotel is 5 minutes walk. As you get off the coach the hotel is located at the North end of the train station, across the road next to the Dioclezian Baths. If there are more that two of you travelling you can get a taxi for around 50 euros. Hotel - Very nice, newly refurbished. Very clean. Free minibar with water and soft drinks. All usual facilities, TV, safe, hairdryer, but no trouser press or iron. Hotel does have laundry facilities. Breakfast was usual standard continental fare. Staff helpful and professional, especially Matteo. Drinks in the bar were expensive but other than that, and the average breakfast, you could not fault this hotel for the price (We booked through hotel's website). Around the hotel - plenty of restaurants at reasonable prices, there is a nice restaurant called Famiglia just down the road on the right as you turn left from the hotel. The hotel will reserve a table for you, recommended as it is quite busy. Sightseeing - we bought bus tour tickets on line for the green bus tour. This is good way of seeing Rome and you can hop on and around the city at the main sites. We got a two day ticket which didn't cost much more than a one day ticket. The queues for St Peter's and the Vatican Museums (Sistine Chapel) are much smaller if you go mid afternoon. We also booked the Angels and Demons Tour (based on the Dan Brown book) this was an excellent way of seeing most of the main sites and gave you a lot of information not relating to the book too. The views from the top of the Castel Sant'Angelo are stunning. Rome is the most beautiful city with stacks of history. But take care not to get knocked down while crossing the road for your gelato!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Diocleziano”
Reviews.Author: 2cornot2c
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a short stay in Rome. We stayed at the Diocleziano. We had read previous reports and wanted an hotel that would give us maximum freedom to see as much of Rome as was possible in such a short stay. We wanted an hotel that was in a safe area and also we didn't want to compromise comfort and cleanliness in any way. This hotel did not dissapoint us. It is an hotel that we would recommend that anyone could stay at. The Diocleziano is very excellently situated for all form of travel in Rome. We flew into Ciampino airport and the transfer coaches take you to within minutes of the hotel.The proximity to the main Metro Station of Termini is also only a few minutes away. From the same area you can join in one of the stops for many of the hop on - hop off buses. The buses all seem to begin and end at Termini and therefore you have no problem with either day or night buses to take you anywhere. The hotel is immaculately clean and the rooms are very functional. The beds were comforable and again very clean.The staff are courteous, respectful and helpful and always from all staff a welcoming smile. The buffet breakfast room was very bright and cheerful and again immaculate in every respect and even early in the morning a welcoming smile awaited.The choice of food was excellent.The showers were very good. We had hot water at all times There was also a complimentary mini bar that had 4/5 assorted soft drinks put in every day. In every respect my daughter and I were so pleased that we chose the Hotel Diocleziano. We don't often bother doing reviews but wish others to enjoy Rome as much as we did and the most important part is where you choose to stay. Ask for a room with a view, we didn't and it was the only small thing that we would request. The Diocleziano was for us a very pleasent hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Seymo
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Rome and the amazing Hotel Diocleziano. Rome is a beautiful city and we had a great time. The hotel was superb, it cannot be faulted at all. We arrived at the Termini and easily found our hotel a few minutes walk away. On arrival we were warmly greeted by friendly english speaking staff. Our room was spotless, furnished to the highest standards it had two large windows, and the biggest most comfortable bed we have ever seen. The room had air conditioning, great as the temperature soared whilst we were there and a lovely free minibar replenished daily with pop, juice and water. The dining room was lovely, the breakfast was well presented, tasty and plenty of choice. The whole hotel was beautifully decorated and very peaceful (just what was needed after a long day sightseeing). The location of the hotel was excellent, very close to Termini (central bus and train station) but in a peaceful side road. We found it so easy just a few minutes across the road to get on our 110 red open touring bus. Very handy at the end of the day when your feet will take no more. If returning to Rome we would definitely stay here again. The whole holiday was superb.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Italian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aggiegrad102
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Diocleziano during my recent stay in Rome and I have to say it made my trip. It was so wonderful to return at the end of a hard day of sightseeing. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful, the breakfast buffet in the morning is a great way to start the day and includes much more than most hotels, the location is great since you can see termini station from a few steps out the front door. The only negative that I could possibly have was that our mini-bar didn't cool. But as it was in the upper 50's most days of our trip, we just put the water and cokes on the window ledge and had a wonderful refrigerator. This is definitely the hotel I will stay at the next time I'm in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Edjamro
Reviews.Content: The staff told me that this hotel was created a year ago; it used to be an apartment building is my guess. Excellent location. It is located a short walk from Termini Station and the Metro on a quiet street, which is surprising for the neighborhood. Also within walking distance to the historic center and other major sites. The rooms were spacious, the beds comfortable, the public rooms OK too. Don't expect a spacious lobby or many products in the bathroom, just bare essentials. The biggest asset is the staff: very accommodating and dedicated to good service. I think I found the hotel I will always stay at when I go to Rome. Viva Italia!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ToursByBarb
Reviews.Content: Our group of 6 adults in 3 rooms just returned from a 6 night stay at the Hotel Diocleziano. Its location, a short walk from Termini Station and Piazza Repubblica, made getting anywhere in Rome easy yet the hotel's position on a side street with the ancient Baths of Deocletian as a nearby boundary kept the area quiet. The hotel is well maintained and well managed. We found the guestrooms well apointed and very clean and comfortable.The key card entry that also controlled the lighting in the room seemed well thought out and the breakfast room was lovely. When making your reservations, opt for the free mini bar service. It doesn't include alcohol but it was always nice to come in from a day of touring to a cold bottle of water, pop or juice. Matteo, at the front desk, is terrific. He was extremely helpful in tracking down 3 pieces of luggage "misplaced" by Alitalia on our flight from NYC. Although, it still took 2 days for it to arrive, I'm sure it would have been longer without Matteo's frequent phone calls. He also helped with reserving tickets for the Galleria Borghese, one of my must see sights while in Rome. Overall, our experience was excellent. The staff was pleasant and helpful (especially the evening bartender), the breakfast was fine, the hotel was beautiful and the location was great. For $200 a night, it would be hard to find a better hotel in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed!”
Reviews.Author: 06sun
Reviews.Content: I booked a stay at the Hotel Diocleziano last August. It's a 5 minute walk from Termini train station. Very clean and recently renovated hotel. Buffet style breakfast. I'd book again.

Reviews.Title: “Must have been good...”
Reviews.Author: cdm22
Reviews.Content: Its not often i write about hotels (or anything else come to think of it) on the net but thought i would say thank you to all the reviewers saying how good this hotel was. As had been mentioned, location is very convenient, the rooms were quite large and airy and quiet at night and the staff were excellent. Really can't fault the place :o)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl&Roger
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this brand-new hotel. The staff was absolutely wonderful - the most helpful and friendly people. Anna, Diego and Giuseppe all helped us with restaurants, stores, sight-seeing hints, etc. They even indulged us in helping us improve our meager italian. The cleaning staff were exceedingly competant and professional. The breakfast buffet was huge with a wide variety of choices and real italian cafe and cappuccini. Nina, in charge of the buffet, was very sweet and helpful. The room was luxurious, with a king size bed, easily programmable safe and large closet. The bathroom had a large, deep tub, lovely bidet :-), and heated towel rack and heated tile floors. Water pressure more than adequate, hot water never ran out. The hotel is a two-minute walk from Termini - trains, bus and metro stops literally out your front door. Even though it was close to Termini, the hotel is on a little side street that is quiet, safe, with little vehicle traffic. We had views from our window of 2000-year-old ruins. Lovely little restaurant down the street, free beverages in the mini-bar, nice little hotel cocktail bar. In all our European travels, this was the best hotel we've ever stayed at. It has it all - location, comfort, value, and the friendlist staff you'll ever meet. BOOK NOW!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic clean and friendley”
Reviews.Author: vineygee
Reviews.Content: my fiancee and i stayed at this hotel feb 07 and the overall standard of this hotel was excellent. the rooms are spotless with large comfortable beds we stayed in a superior room which included a bath/jacuzzi inc shower and everything is like new. its slightly tucked away but a nice stroll to all amenities and is only 2 min walk to train+ bus station. breakfast has a wide selection of fruit,pastries,ceral and egg + bacon all buffet style so you can get as much as you want when you want and again the standard is very high and you are made to feel very welcome. i even found time to use the gym + sauna excellent excellent excellent

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Pompeyperson
Reviews.Content: Very close to the Termini station (about 200 metres) so it's very convenient. Hotel was very comfortable and everything is spotlessly clean. The hotel staff were helpful and friendly. The breakfast was excellent - great choice (the croissants and custard or jam filled Danish pastries were so delicious), they even had sliced bread that you could toast to your liking. My only minor criticism was that the coffee at breakfast was very bland, which was surprising because the coffee is generally on the strong side in Italy. Our room was very comfortable with a lovely bathroom. TV offered a number of international channels, including BBC World Service and CNN. My only criticism was that, for us, the room always seemed to be too warm (and it was February!) - we turned off the heating and opened the window often, but we had to shut it to sleep (the area is not especially noisy, but hey, Rome is a big city and so you don't expect it to be quiet at night!). I would definitely recommend this hotel for a city break and, we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “hard to beat”
Reviews.Author: scotgirlLancsEngland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights at the end of October and it exceeded our expectations .Room spotless, free mini bar full of soft drinks, great bathroom and excellent staff . As stated before extremely close to Termini but at the end of a nice quiet street , tended to explore on foot all day then hop a train or bus back before venturing out again at night, ate in various locations across the city but our best meals were at a little place along the same street as the hotel. Can't wait to go back !

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anniversary37
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect! The location was great-right near the train station so you can easily get to the buses or trains. It was recently renovated. The room were not large but not as tiny as some we have stayed in. The rooms and the bathrooms were very clean. The staff were wonderfully helpful and all very friendly. The breakfast was good. We would certainly go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel near the Termini”
Reviews.Author: johnsmith47
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Diocleziano from October 5 to 10. Our room was a very good size by European standards. We had room to store 4 bags and still walk around. We had upgraded to the superior room, which had a jacuzzi bath. The bathroom was large, with a shower in the bath, surrounded by a rolling glass enclosure, so there was a lot of room in the shower, The hotel seems new, as the room and bath were in great condition. The AC worked great and was quiet. There was a safe in the closet. The hotel is about 2 long blocks from the front entrance to the Termini train station, and the metro. It is on a quiet side street, an easy walk. The neighborhood seemed very safe and has a number of restaurants. The hotel staff were very friendly, especially Anna and Matteo. They made dinner reservations for us and gave us directions when needed. There's not much to do around the hotel, but you can jump on the subway and get to the major things to see. If you don't mind walking a little, you can get to the Trevi fountain, Pantheon and other places. The breakfast was very good. There is a small bar next to the lobby, where you can have a drink. There is a free minibar with water and soda that is restocked. There is a small market close by if you want to buy some fruit and extra water. I highly recommend this hotel and will stay there again. We got a great rate on Expedia. It was much lower than other hotels in the same category.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully Affordable Boutique in Rome”
Reviews.Author: hudiva
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly suprised by this hotel. Compared to the usual high priced hotels in Rome, this was the most affordable. The room was big enough for me and my cousin to stay comfortably for 3 days, and the bathroom was very large for Europe. The beds were also comfortable. The staff was friendly, however, we did have a few suprises on our bill when we checked out. Turns out EVERYTHING in Rome comes with a price, so dont assume the hotel staff is just being nice. Also, finding it is not easy. The directions on the website or quite misleading. If you are on foot, be prepared to walk for awhile, but it is literally 3 minutes from Termini Station. Tip: If you speak English, there are many tours that you can join once you get to attractions that will allow you to skip the incredibly long lines.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet (for Rome)”
Reviews.Author: tandjb
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay here based on the reviews given on trip advisor and we were not disappointed. The hotel is in very good order and the rooms were clean and well appointed. Breakfast was very good and staff extremely helpful and efficient. The location is good for termini not bad for the rest of Rome - we walked every where and providing the weather is okay you get see all parts of Rome. There are so many restaurants that you do not need to go far. We only stayed 2 nights so we did not need to look too far (SW of Termini has plenty of good eating places at reasonable prices).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, staff & location”
Reviews.Author: AlNic
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from Rome & had a wonderful trip. The hotel staff were very helpful, spoke good english & were very friendly (genuinely friendly rather than acting the part). As soon as we arrived they gave us a free street map & made it clear to us that the mini bar in the room was free. They didn't even do the usual trick of insisting on taking our credit card number for any other services we may have used. The hotel & rooms were very clean. The breakfast area was a pleasure to eat in & yes you could eat as much or as little as you pleased with a good selection of food. The hotel location was excellent, just two minutes walk from the following areas; The Termini, Terravision Bus drop off/collection point, The Metro & the 110 Open Top city tour bus. Turn left from the hotel towards the end of Via Gaeta is a supermarket. If you turn right out of the hotel then come to the junction with Via Solferino 30secs away, you will find a wine cabin on the corner of the street. They do reasonable wine at about 7 euros & even de cork it for you. We had room 302 which was at the front & had a reasonable view over the Museo Termo di Diocleziano ( a museum) If I had to pick any fault with the hotel ( minor faults & probably unfair to mention) it would be the fact that there is no tea/coffee making facilities in the room & the shower door that was too close to the toilet. Needless to say, when we go to Rome again we know which hotel we are going to. Our thanks to the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful in Rome”
Reviews.Author: icapem
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise! Newly renovated, spotless and very comfortable. Lovely breakfast room with good breakfast included. Five minute walk to the train station, and within a good walk of just about everything! Was WAY better than I expected and the price was very reasonable. Would stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nicely designed and maintained hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: tatiana_d
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in the first week of September. It totally exceeded my expectations. It's not fancy, but very nicely designed with clean lines, nice furniture and very nice bathroom with jacuzzi tub for two and european shower. Everything looks new and spotless clean. The staff is nice too, always helpful with breakfast, luggage, directions, etc. They also provide free drinks (water, juice, soda) in minibar and refill it every day. The breakfast is very decent too.. with eggs, bacon, cereal, croissants, yogurt, coffees, etc. Plus it is literally about 5 minutes or less from Termini station. Overall a very pleasant surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and modern”
Reviews.Author: JC2711
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 4 nights and it was very clean. We arrived about 9 am and we were able to check in straight away which was great after a 24hour flight and a very scary ride from the airport. We organised a private transfer through the hotel to pick us up from the airport and found the driver very rude and dumped our bags in the street(not even on the footpath) and said 5euro to carry them inside. I have a 9month old baby and thought this very rude. We told him no way and carried our own bags! Breakfast was great, the best we had out of 5 different hotels throughout europe. Aircon worked great, Very close to restarants and a supermarket 2 mins walk away that sells everything including baby supplies. Walking distance to the colleseum and Trevi fountain. My Television wasnt working but they sent someone within 2 hours to fix it. I would stay there again if I was in Rome but dont plan on ever going back to Rome.... or not with a baby anyway!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Base for Exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: aller et retour
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4-day trip in bella Roma and had a very enjoyable stay at the Hotel Diocleziano. It is about a 5 minute walk from Stazione Termini, which made it very convenient to the trains, metro, and buses. While Rome is very walkable, it is nice to have the option to take public transportation back to your hotel when your feet get tired. Everything at the hotel feels very new and very clean. The free breakfast was very nice, and I especially loved the free drinks in the mini-bar in the room. The front desk was very helpful in making restaurant reservations and trying to help us book tickets for the Galleria Borghese (unforunately, they were unsuccessful with that - we tried to book the tickets 1 day in advance, but it is probably wise to try to book it even earlier than that). My only complaint during my stay is that, at certain times, the water for the shower didn't stay a consistent temperature. Anyhow, this temperature issue only came up a couple times, so it is really only a very minor complaint. I would still heartily recommend this hotel.
